 ' this is very memorable spaghetti western it has great storyline interesting characters and some very good acting especially from rosalba neri her role as the evil villainess in this film is truly classic she steals every scene she is in and expresses so much with her face and eyes even when she not speaking her performance is very believable she manages to be quite mesmerizing without being over the top not that there anything wrong with being over the top mark damon is surprisingly good in this movie too br br the music score is excellent and the theme song is the kind that will be playing in your head constantly for days after seeing the movie whether you want it to or not there are couple of parts that are very amusing especially like the part where rosalba neri undresses in front of the parrot there also lots of slick gun play that very well done br br would probably have given this movie 8 or 9 stars if it wasn for two things the first being silly bar room brawl that occurs about 25 minutes into the film this is one of the most ridiculous looking fights have ever seen in movie it is very poorly choreographed and looks more like dance number from bad musical than any kind of real fight one might be able to overlook this if it were terence hill bud spencer comedy but this is more serious western and the brawl really needed to be more realistic the other thing that annoyed me about this movie was yuma cowardly mexican sidekick guess he was supposed to be comic relief or something but the character was just plain stupid and unnecessary in movie like this and he wasn at all funny all can say is where is tuco when you need him br br all that having been said let me assure everyone reading this that johnny yuma is classic spaghetti western despite the faults have mentioned and all fans of the genre need to see this movie ',
 ' the plot michael linnett connors has done everything in films but direct and is looking for his 1st big chance he discovers molly in play and at once knows she will be big film star he signs her to contract with the stipulation that he must direct the producer agrees and their big time careers are under way what follows is recreation of the silent film era and early sound movies with great emphasis on comedy and oh yes there romance and little sadness too the performances by don ameche and alice fay are top notch the music is real plus too with some old familiar tunes heard lots of dvd extras as well in this restored version released in 2008 it must be emphasized that this movie is story 1st not just tribute to silent films later years would bring similar films such as singin in the rain 1952 dick van dyke carl reiner the comic 1969 what is special about this film though is recreating silent movies in 1939 we see portions of them as the cinema audience would in that bygone era although some sound effects are included in glorious w while the rest of the movie is in pristine color one of the greatest in the silent era buster keaton who at this point was on an uphill climb is used superbly in 2 silent film recreated scenes and he is on the top of his game it is said that he had some input on his scenes as well but the real reason to watch the movie if your motion picture history fan is that beyond everything else hollywood cavalcade is mack sennett film legacy it doesn take genius to realize this movie is positive reworking of mack sennett and mabel normand life the character michael linnett connors is mack sennett whose real name was michael sinnott and molly of course is mabel sennett had the pie throwings the bathing beauties and keystone cops he worked with buster keaton ben turpin cameo roscoe fatty arbuckle body double and fell in love with his leading lady not only all that but sennett was technical adviser for this film and appears in it as well as most film viewers today prefer sound features those who were associated with short subjects and silents are left out to pasture as mack sennett fell into that category it is fortunate that there is hollywood cavalcade sennett was of course very instrumental in the evolution of comedy in movies his career started in 1908 as an actor then writer director producer he semi retired in 1935 with about 500 films to his credit he had worked with the best such as charlie chaplin gloria swanson bing crosby c fields keaton harry langdon arbuckle and even roy rogers in way up thar as film comedy is an extremely difficult path to continue for an entire career mack played it wise did only selective work for the next 25 years in 1931 he had receive an academy award in the short subject category and another in 1937 for lifetime of work in the 1940 his presence was still felt g here come the co eds 1945 where recreation of the oyster soup scene used in mack wandering willies 1926 is done in 1947 the road to hollywood used some of sennett crosby films 2 years later brought some nostalgia with the film down memory lane in which he participated with his knack of always associating with the right people guest role with the eternally popular lawrence welk his radio show came about later in the year 1950 brought re release of his greatest triumph tillie punctured romance 1914 with sound in 1952 he was honored on tv this is your life then his autobiography the king of comedy 1954 which is great companion piece to hollywood cavalcade was published 1955 brought more concrete association with abbott costello as he had cameo in c meet the keystone kops finally in 1957 another tribute with the compilation film the golden age of comedy so when you watch hollywood cavalcade it is the legacy of motion picture pioneer in the film at the banquet scene the camera pans over the guests at long table as we get to the silver haired mack he alone turns his head to the camera as if to say here am when he rises to give speech short while later he is at his most subdued underplaying the words given him as if to mentally convey know my influence on comedy will never end but will people forget mack sennett the individual maybe this movie will help ',

keeps the laughs coming with his quotable patter you got rats the size of oldsmobiles here she not woman she the terminator one little murder and m jack the ripper those are all crystal words but some for all its worth devito hasn disappeared from films of course but it a mystery why he hasn really followed up on the directorial promise of this movie maybe it because as throw momma from the train lack of mainstream success shows his kind of vision isn to everyone tastes that too bad for those of us who can watch this over and over and like it ',

 ' it doesn happen very often but occasionally one man can make difference big difference br br george crile 2003 best seller charlie wilson war is fascinating and eye opening account of the most unlikely difference maker imaginable relatively obscure congressman from the second district of texas good time charlie was known more for his libertine lifestyle than his libertarian legislation likable and licentious even for politician charlie wilson served his constituency well since the good folks of lufkin only really wanted two things their guns and to be left alone it easy street replete with his bevy of beltway beauties known appropriately enough as charlie angels br br when asked why his entire office staff was composed of attractive young aides his response is classic you atrocities being committed in afghanistan moved him to muster his entire political savvy toward funding the utter humiliating defeat of the russian military and possibly to even help hasten the end of the cold war as result fat chance huh br br under the skillful direction of mike nichols and smart snappy screenplay by adam sorkin charlie wilson war is sparkling sophisticated satire that chronicles seymour hoffman steals every scene he appears in as gust aurakotos smart street wise e non ivy league graduate cia malcontent who knows the score both in the agency boardroom and in wilson bedroom br br for the mujahideen to succeed the most important assistance the s can provide is the ability to shoot down the dreaded mi 21 helicopter gunships which rule the skies this takes money lots of money and eventually charlie team covertly coerces those in congress to fund the effort to the tune of 1 billion dollars for advanced weaponry to arm the afghan rebels this includes top of the line state of the art anti aircraft and anti tank rockets as well as other highly sophisticated killing devices nasty nasty stuff br br that this kind of multi billion dollar illicit activity can and does take place behind congressional doors is truly alarming every american should see this movie or read this book because it reveals truly frightening aspect of the business as usual political scene rarely seen outside the walls of our very own government oh momma wish it weren so br br even though the initial outcome for team charlie was an unqualified success the unimaginable unanticipated final result is that these sophisticated weapons are now used against our troops by the taliban and others since the funding was entirely covert the young generation in this part of the world has no idea the fall of soviet oppression and the end to russian barbarity was the direct result of american intervention yes once the russkies left so did our aid zip for schools zip for infrastructure zip on maintaining meaningful relationships with the afghan people as result the overall consequence is an unmitigated disaster it like the forerunner to mission accomplished br br as nichol film so pointedly points out the ball you ve set in motion can keep bouncing even after you ve lost interest in it mike krzyzewski knows this eva longoria parker knows this little lateesha in lafayette knows this but the typical american politician doesn so we go from good guys to bad guys because we couldn let the world know we were the good guys talk about catch 22 another mike nichols film br br perhaps charlie wilson said it best we ked up the end game br br again ',

 ' if you are interested in learning more about this sort of thing happening in modern civilization there is an excellent book called outlaw seas or the outlaw sea and it describes in story after story how these things do happen the lawlessness of the high seas is reality for number of reasons one many of the world freighters are of questionable registry nationality and it difficult to impossible to enforce international laws when the ships owners don have an office in real country two many ship lines employ crews from dirt poor third world countries the crews are often like illegal immigrant workers threatened and bullied into complying with questionable or illegal practices three there is often language barrier not only between the officers and the crew but also between the crew members themselves the crew are rewarded for their compliance and their silence four once committing an illegal act the ships are able to hide in plain sight with little more than fresh coat of paint anyway it fascinating reading br br horrifying story excellent movie does anyone else notice how hbo seems to make the best and most important movies hollywood has trouble releasing enough oscar worthy movies in any given year so that several of the top 5 contenders usually come from britain jerry bruckheimer the end of quality cinema br br loved the thoroughly evil performance by sean pertwee also as usual loved omar epps ',

surprise since everyone thought the academy would split the awards for best director and best picture while thought the hollywood friendly plot of the aviator would have made it dead cert for best picture while mdb controversial subject matter would have turned lot of voters off br br what these awards perhaps illustrate is that this year the voters have decided to ignore oscar politics and genuinely give out awards to people who deserve it something they haven done in the past mean beautiful mind beating the fellowship of the ring for gawd sake and long may the academy vote with their heads instead of their hearts ',

 ' in 1929 director walt disney and animator ub iwerks changed the face of animation with the release of the very first installment of their silly symphonies series the skeleton dance iwerks and disney had been collaborating together since the early 20s in disney laugh gram cartoon series however their friendship suffered tremendous blow when iwerks accepted an offer by competitor to leave disney and start his own animation studio that was the birth of celebrity productions where iwerks continued developing his style and technique and where he created the character of flip the frog while his work kept the same high quality it wasn really popular and by 1936 the studio was closed later that year iwerks was hired by columbia pictures and iwerks decided to return to his old skeletons for another dance this time in color br br 1937 skeleton frolics is essentially remake of the 1929 classic the skeleton dance the movie that borough him fame and fortune like that short film it is set on an abandoned graveyard where at midnight the creatures of the night come alive and begin to play the dead rise from their coffins ready for the show that about to begin as group of skeletons has formed an orchestra and begin to play happy tune now it not easy to be musician made of just bones as some of the orchestra members have problems with their body parts however the band manages to put good show and another group of skeletons begin to dance lovely couple of them faces the same problems that troubled the orchestra it hard to dance with loose body parts everything ends at dawn and just when the sun is about to rise again the skeletons run towards their graves br br directed and animated by ub iwerks himself skeleton frolics follows faithfully the pattern set by the skeleton dance years before although with crucial difference iwerks did the whole film in technicolor the bright tonalities allowed iwerks to create more visually appealing film and also to use the many new techniques he had been practicing since leaving disney creating even better effects of depth and dynamism than those he conceived before it is certainly more experimental film than the skeleton dance although sadly this doesn mean it necessarily better film for starters the film is practically identical to the one he did with disney with the only differences being the music more on that later and the color effects it looks beautiful no doubt about it but it definitely feels kind of unoriginal after all br br however it is not the unoriginality of the concept what truly hurts the film after all iwerks executes it in wonderful way but the fact that the musical melody created by joe denat for the film is pretty uninteresting and lacks the charming elegance and whimsical fun of the one done by carl stalling for the skeleton dance in other words while denat tune is effective and appropriate for the theme it easy to forget about it rapidly while stalling song has unique personality that makes it unforgettable being musical film this is of high importance and so the mediocrity of the music brings down iwerk flawless work of animation personally think that with better musical accompaniment skeleton frolics would be remembered as fondly as the skeleton dance despite not being as groundbreaking as it still fun film to watch br br it kind of sad that most of the work iwerks did after leaving disney is now forgotten due to his poor success however it must be said that if iwerks lacked the popularity of disney or fleischer disney main rival he did not lack the quality of those companies films it was probably just case of bad luck what made the man who gave life to disney mouse for the first time to face failure out of disney despite its shortcomings skeleton frolics is very funny and visually breathtaking film that while not exactly the most original and fresh film one just can help but thinking of the skeleton dance while watching it it definitely reminds us that iwerk skeletons are still here to haunt us and inspire us br br 8 10 ',

play the role is pierce brosnan who took over the role of james bond from timothy dalton in 1996 and made his 007 debut in goldeneye br br this is the setting for the first major title developed by third party on the nintendo 64 goldeneye developed by rare for nintendo has been on the market for some time its continued dominance in the sales charts is just one testament to how good this game is horrendous games like cliffhanger true lies lethal weapon and not to mention all the star trek flops are ammunition enough against this mix and for the record am not fan of movie licensed games especially if ve seen the movie at least that how used to think in the case of goldeneye had more reservations than normal while not bad movie goldeneye the film didn have that much appeal to it and don rank it in the top ten amongst bond movies as game however let just say it a completely different story br br the game is first person shooter and in order to be successful you ll need at least as much brains as brawn for those who have seen the movie which imagine is most of you reading this the story is very consistent and follows the path of the movie with little variation plot to control the world most dangerous satellite goldeneye has begun in the ussr and in the process beautiful woman has been captured your missions will be many the danger extreme you will have to rely on your wits and experience to get you through the most grueling missions the world has ever known will brief you as soon as you re ready good day james ',
 ' edmund lowe who reminds me somewhat of warren william heads the nice cast of an interesting little mystery that moves at brisk pace and runs just little over an hour br br douglas walton plays the unlucky jockey who appears to be intent on his own demise hypnotism anyone and the suspects include good number of the supporting cast everyone from virginia bruce kent smith frieda inescourt gene lockhart jessie ralph benita hume rosalind ivan and b warner as an added bonus there nat pendleton as dimwit detective and furthermore get load of that art deco set decoration for the fancy interiors of wealthy home must have been set that was used in many subsequent film br br on the plus side the mystery is not so complicated that anyone can follow the plot with reasonable assurance of not being too baffled it all suddenly clear to detective philo vance and then he has final confrontation with the murderer that gives the film nifty five minutes of unmitigated suspense br br nicely done and passes the time in an entertaining manner ',

witness but smith and especially renart immediately suspect he might be the killer in typical basic instinct fashion smith gets some dates with the young businessman under the assumption that she last scene where brutal mass murder supposed to be shocking and sad comes off as such laughably overdone and nonsensical that frankly can imagine how anyone could not laugh at it br br at 87 minutes  ' this movie starred totally forgotten star from the 1930s jack pearl radio baron munchausen as well as jimmy durante however 7 1 2 decades later it being billed as three stooges film because they are the only ones in the film who the average person would recognize today film fanatics will also recognize the wonderful edna may oliver as well as zazu pitts br br as for the stooges this is film from there very early days before mgm had any idea what to do with the team at this point they were known as ted healy and his stooges as healy was the front man fortunately for the stooges they soon left this nasty and rather untalented man read up on him you ll see what mean and the rest is history within year they were making very successful shorts for columbia and executives at mgm were soon kicking themselves for losing the team this sort of thing was common occurrence at mgm great studio which had no idea what to do with comedy such as the films of buster keaton laurel and hardy abbott and costello and others in fact up until they left for columbia mgm put them in wide variety of odd film roles including acting with clark gable and joan crawford in dancing lady and oddly in this film they didn act as team they just did various supporting roles such as larry playing the piano br br this particular film begins with pearl and durante lost in the african jungle when they are rescued and brought home all sense of structure to the film falls apart and the film becomes almost like variety show punctuated by scenes with the leads here and there as for pearl could really see why he never made successful transition to films as he has the personality of slug but slightly less welcome as for durante never knew what the public saw in him as least as far as his films are concerned he was loud and loud he apparently took time off from helping mgm to ruin buster keaton career to make this film together pearl and durante rely on lots of verbal humor and vaudeville style routines that tend to fall rather flat br br in this film the stooges they didn yet have the right chemistry seeing healy doing the job that moe did in their later films is odd what they did in the film was pretty good but because all the segments were short they came on and off camera too quickly to allow them to really get into their routines stooges fans might be very frustrated at this though die hard fans may want to see this so that they can complete their life long goal of seeing everything stooge even the rotten joe derita and joe besser films oh and did they got bad after the deaths of shemp and curly br br overall the film is rather dull and disappointing however there are couple interesting things to look for in the mess at about the 13 minute mark you will see brief scene where tour guide on bus is singing look carefully as this is walter brennan in role you certainly never expect another unusual thing to look for in the film is the clean as whistle song starting at about 22 minutes into the film this song and dance number is clearly an example of so called pre code scene that never would have been allowed in films after 1934 when the production code was strengthened despite the word clean in the title it a very titillating number with naked women showing lots of flesh enough to stimulate but not enough to really show anything it quite shocking when seen today though such excesses were pretty common in the early 1930s finally at the 63 minute mark see jimmy durante set race relations back few decades see the film you ll see that mean ',

innocent but he convicted and it sure sounds like he a scoundrel using inside information from people that have come before his bench in order to amass fortune then in the final moments of the film  ' despite some reviews being distinctly luke warm found the story totally engrossing and even if some critics have described the love story as mills and boon so what it is good to see warm touching story of real love in these cynical times many in the audience were sniffing and surreptitiously dabbing their eyes you really believe that the young victoria and albert are passionately fond of each other even though for political reasons it was an arranged marriage did feel though that sir john conroy who was desperate to control the young queen is perhaps played too like pantomime villain as it is rumoured that he was in fact the real father of victoria as result of an affair with her mother the duchess of kent it would have been interesting to explore this theory emily blunt is totally convincing as the young princess trapped in the stifling palace with courtiers and politicians out to manipulate her she brilliantly portrays the strength of character and determination that eventually made victoria great queen of england which prospered as never before under her long reign believe word of mouth recommendations will ensure great success for this most enjoyable and wonderful looking movie ',

 ' such joyous world has been created for us in pixar a bug life we re immersed in universe which could only be documented this enjoyably on film but more precisely universe which could only be documented through the world of animation for those who have forgotten what plentiful and exuberant world animation can offer â when it in the right hands that is â bug life is warm reminder we walk out of the film with an equally warm feeling and sense of satisfaction derivative of only high calibre film productions br br it is only pixar second animated feature the sub group of disney made their spectacular debut and perhaps entirely inadvertent mark on the film world three years prior in 1995 with their landmark movie toy story it was movie which defied convention re invented and breathed new life into animation and defined whole new level of excellence now they return with their sophomore effort which to be honest draws creeping sense of cynicism in us all prior to seeing the film br br after all it a film about ants well all walks of the insect and bug world are covered in bug life but it is the ant which is the focal point in this film as humans are the focal point in dramas romances and so on how can such an insignificant species of animal such as an ant act as the protagonist of movie let alone provide the entire premise of feature film surely they jest however we forget that in toy story bunch of toy box items were able to become the grandest most inspiring and lovable bunch of animated heroes and villains ever concocted the guys at pixar manage to pull off the same feat and manage to turn bunch of dirty and miniscule bugs into the most endearing and pleasant gang of vermin you ll probably ever encounter br br not only are they all entirely amiable and likable â there isn an unpleasant character in sight even the villains are riveting characters â but they re colourful they re eclectic and they re idiosyncratic and the array of characters is also gargantuan for lack of better term only adding the rich layers of distinctiveness already plastered onto bug life from the beginning we shall start with our main character and our hero his name is flik david foley and his character is rather generic to say the least out of the thousands of faithful and obedient worker ants residing on the lush beautiful ant island he is the one considered the black sheep of the clan as seen in the opening moments of the movie when he inadvertently destroys the season harvest with his antics br br the problem arises in the fact that the ants harvest is for bunch of greedy grasshoppers led by hopper kevin spacey who are eager to continue to assert their wrath and autocracy amongst the puny little ants when they show up to ant island for their annual banquet and see that their offering is gone they go insane for lack of better term hopper offers proposition to save the ants from total extinction at his pack hands however it a negotiation which is simply impossible to fulfil the cogs and clockwork in flik mind run at full steam now despite his guilt and shame and he offers to leave ant island in search of some mighty bug warriors who can come to the colony rescue and fight off hopper and the grasshoppers br br if you think about it bug life bears some heavy resemblance to the plot line of akira kurosawa classic seven samurai or the american remake the magnificent seven in which village of hapless but good hearted folk are threatened by malevolent and wicked enemies â one lone village dweller goes in search for help in the big city finds it and returns to the colony to drive off evil in bug life the help comes in the form of down and out circus troupe who is mistakenly perceived by flik as warriors in bar room brawl br br much amusement comes out of these scenes and much amusement comes out of these circus troupe bugs among them are an erudite stick insect david hyde pierce side splitting obese german caterpillar by the name of heimlich and quasi femme fatale ladybug who in fact gritty and masculine ladybug dennis hopper it exceedingly enjoyable watching these bugs on screen as it is watching the bugs and the insects interact on screen as is the entire movie collectively br br as ve said much amusement and mirth comes out of their characters and joyous interactions with one another which give way to bevy of hilarious lines wonderfully suspenseful and riveting situations and overall dazzling movie what makes bug life even better is that the film isn restricted simply to children as many may perceive it to be although children would indeed find more entertainment out of this film â the clichã kid friendly situations are bit more abundant than we like however it easy to ignore this fault and it incredulously easy to enjoy this film br br although bug life may not reach the dizzying and landmark standards set by its predecessor this is still superb movie and the start of something promising here pixar have proved that they re not just one hit wonder but instead much gifted and talented group of film artists in hollywood they raise the bar endlessly and when someone always manages to top their standards it only always by themselves what more is there to say about bug life other than see it it not quite the best which we ve seen from the folks at emeryville california but this beats out the lot of its year â and ll be damned if this isn the best animated feature of 1998 br br 8 5 10 ',

want to vomit br br my next major complaint has to do with the fact that superman lifts continent made out of kryptonite up into outer space it doesn take comic book guy from the simpsons to point out what wrong with that don know how many comic books brian singer has read but when superman is exposed to even small amount of kryptonite he barely has the strength to stay on his feet whoever had the idea to have him fly large island made out of his greatest weakness into space has no business being associated with any superman related projects ever again the concept is as ridiculous as making dracula movie where the title character has stake through his heart and still manages to fly spaceship made out of garlic into the sun why not just have superman eat kryptonite he can eat it and then brush his teeth with it and then go to sleep in kryptonite pajamas that not any more absurd then having him hoist continent of kryptonite into space and then fall powerless through the atmosphere without burning up in re entry or splattering all over central park when he hits the ground br br my third major complaint has to do with the fact that singer slaps movie goers across the face with religious symbolism the entire movie have to take issue with his characterization of superman as the only son of god like jor el sent to earth to be savior jor el wasn all wise he was just scientist and he didn send his son to earth to be savior he threw him in rocket and hurriedly fired it into space because his planet was about to explode ll buy the christ allegory if brian singer can show me the part in the bible where god sends christ to earth because heaven was about to explode and then radioactive pieces of heaven become christ primary weakness furthermore the crucifixion scene where luthor stabs superman in the side with kryptonite spear just makes me want to slam my face into brick until m too brain dead to notice the brazenly obvious and inappropriate symbolism that will be tainting the man of steel for the foreseeable future they might as well rename this movie superman returns the passion of the christ br br and speaking of luthor my last major complaint has to do with singer depiction of lex luthor lex luthor is shrewd cold hearted business tycoon who is more apt to run for president which he does in the comics than try to destroy the world the man wants money and power he wants to be in charge not wreck everything yet the luthor we see superman returns as well as all the previous superman movies is wacky theatrical dunce who comes up with zany schemes to destroy the world if singer had the slightest loyalty to the characters instead of the quite awful previous superman movies this film might not be such an unbearable travesty maybe singer next project can be batman movie where he focuses on the interpretation of batman from 1960s tv show zam whap pow br br to summarize don know what hate more the movie itself or the fact that so many people seem to be giving it good reviews everyone is entitled to their opinion but if you don hate this movie then your opinion is wrong sincerely encourage anyone who reads this not to see this movie if you haven already don see it don buy it when it comes out on dvd don rent it basically don contribute any money towards it in any way this movie does not deserve to make any money in fact think that for every rectified when terrorist incident occurs and from here the show steps into themes and situations that very rarely see television tackle br br bsg dealt with themes such as monotheism existentialism reality death and terrorism but they were primarily subtext there for the viewer to contemplate on or ignore if they so choose here on the other hand these subjects are the focus of the show and personally found myself evoking such works as ghost in the shell and the matrix as reference points while watching and being surprised by how well the themes were being discussed think if you are fan of the two just mentioned or other films television shows which deal with the subjects referenced think you will find at least something here br br in terms of starting point to explain how the situation we know in bsg came about believe they handled it in very interesting way especially liked how they explained where the cylon belief in one god came from and the creation of caprica had just  ' the first cube movie was an art movie it set up world in which all the major archetypes of mankind were represented and showed how they struggled to make sense of hostile world that they couldn understand it was on the non literal level man vs cruel nature plot where the individual who represented innocence and goodness came through in the end triumphing to face new indefinable world beyond man petty squabbles world where there were no more struggle but peace rated cube 10 out of 10 and it a movie that was never meant to have any sequels br br the second movie hypercube was massive disappointment some of the ideas were kind of cool but in the context of the original movie both the story and the setting made no sense and had no meaning still for being fairly entertaining rated it 5 out of 10 br br the third movie cube zero while ignoring the second plays like vastly inferior commercial movie rehash of the first sans the symbolism there is no homage or tribute here there is only ripping off the same kind of plot with some elements idiotically altered like having letters instead of prime numbers between the cubes an idea which shows more clearly than anything else that this is rip off with absolutely no originality and nothing to say br br that we see something from behind the scenes means nothing because the watchers are just part of the big bad experiment the architects of which we hear nothing of and in this movie those who get through to the exit like kazan did at the end of the first movie are just killed where the bleep is the sense in that that just flippin stupid m glad didn pay to see this br br the production values and acting in cube zero are not too bad but the story and the ideas are so utterly devoid of any inspiration that this movie can only get from me rating of 3 out of 10 ',

 ' trio of buddies sergeants all in the british army carouse brawl their way across imperial india intensely loyal to each other they meet their greatest most deadly challenge when they encounter the resurgence of hideous cult its demented implacable guru now they must rely on the lowliest servant of the regiment the water carrier gunga din to save scores of the queen soldiers from certain massacre br br based more on the three musketeers than kipling classic poem this is wonderful adventure epic worthy entry in hollywood golden year of 1939 filled with suspense humor while keeping the romantic interludes to the barest minimum it grips the interest of the viewer and holds it right up to the sentimental conclusion br br it is practically fruitless to discuss the performance nuances of the three stars cary grant victor mclaglen douglas fairbanks jr as they are really all thirds of single organism inseparable and to all intents purposes indistinguishable however this diminishes nothing of the great fun in simply watching them have glorious time br br it interesting to note parenthetically that mclaglen boasted of distinguished world war one military career fairbanks would have sterling record in world war two mostly in clandestine affairs earning himself no fewer than 4 honorary knighthoods after the conflict while grant reportedly worked undercover for british intelligence keeping an eye on hollywood nazi sympathizers br br the real acting laurels here should go to sam jaffe heartbreaking in the title role he infuses the humble man with radiant dignity enormous courage making the last line of kipling poem ring true he is unforgettable br br montague love is properly stalwart as the regimental major whilst eduardo ciannelli is evil incarnate as the thuggee guru the rest of the cast joan fontaine robert coote lumsden hare are effective but have little to do movie mavens will recognize cecil kellaway in the tiny role of miss fontaine father br br the film picks its villains well the demonic thuggee cult worshipers of the hideous blood soaked kali hindu goddess of destruction was the bane of indian life for 6 centuries ritualistically strangling up to 30 000 victims year in 1840 the british military in cooperation with number of princely states succeeded in ultimately suppressing the religion henceforth it would remain the stuff of novels nightmares ',

 ' crossfire remains one of the best hollywood message movies because unlike the admirably intentioned gentleman agreement which it beat to theatres by few months it chooses to send its message via the form an excellent noir thriller rather than have an outraged star constantly saying it because m jewish isn it it much easier to get the message that hate is like loaded gun across when the dead bodies are actual rather than metaphorical somewhat shamefully the brief featurette on the warners dvd doesn mention that novelist richard brooks disowned the film over the shift from homophobic murder to an anti semitic one but it interesting to note that while the victim is killed primarily because he is jewish there little doubt in sam levene performance that the character is in fact also gay â not mincing caricature but there definitely two lost souls aspect to his scenes with george cooper confused soldier there not much of mystery to who the murderer is even though the killing is carried out in classic noir shadows the body language of the killer is instantly recognisable but then the film has its characters drift to the same conclusion before the halfway point the tension comes from proving it and saving the fall guy br br there an element of ealing films to the gang of soldiers teaming together to get their buddy out of fix you could almost see that aspect as blueprint for hue and cry but the atmosphere is pure rko noir set over one long sweltering night the film has great look filled with deep dark blacks and shadows born as much out of economy as style it cut back on lighting time and allowed director edward dmytryk more time to work with the actors and the excellent cast make the most of the fine script laid back but quietly charismatic robert mitchum robert young maigret like detective gloria grahame tramp and the perpetually creepy paul kelly as her compulsive liar admirer guy who tries on stories the way other people try on ties but the 1946 as reward dmytryk and producer adrian scott found themselves investigated by the huac which itself had notable tendency to target jews so much for crusadingâ ',
 ' this movie basically is very well made production and gives good impression of war situation and its effects on those involved it always interesting to see the story from the other side for change this movie concentrates on group of german soldiers who after fighting in the north africa campaign are send to stalingrad russia where one of the most notorious and bloodiest battles of ww ii is being fought br br it interesting to see the other side of this battle since we mainly just always see the germans simply as the villains in this movie those villains are given an humane face and voice and it sort of makes you realize that the only true enemy in war is war itself and not necessarily those who you re fighting against at first it kind of hard to concentrate on the movie because you always just have in the back of your mind that the german are the evil villains but of course you get accustomed to it quickly and you soon adapt the germans as the main characters of the movie and you even start to care and be interested in them br br the way this story is told isn however the best it hard to keep track of the story at times as it jumps from the one sequence and location to the other the movie isn always logic in its storytelling and features bit too many sequences that remain too vague it also is most of the time pretty hard to keep the characters apart and see who is who it doesn always makes this movie an easy on to watch but than again on the other hand there are plenty enough sequences and moments present in this movie to make it worthwhile and an interesting one just not the most coherent one around in that regard hollywood movies are always better than european movies br br the production values are high and features some good looking sets and locations though the movie wasn even shot in russia itself it helps to create good war time situation atmosphere br br the character are mostly interesting although perhaps tad bit formulaic but don know for some reason formulaic characters always work out fine in war movies and strenghtens the drama and realism it also helps that they re being played by well cast actors all of the actors aren the best known actors around thomas kretschmann was also at the time still fairly unknown actor but each of them fit their role well and gives its characters an unique face and personality br br all in all not the best or most consistent ww ii drama around but definitely worth look due to its original approach of the german side of the battle of stalingrad and its good production values br br 7 10 ',

 ' few would argue that master animation director hayao miyazaki is one of the few to hold this ability br br no too many are focused on john lassiter amazing ability to steal other movies plots turn them into pretty puppet shows and then be lauded as genius but digress br br miyazaki has given us film after film that deals with important mature issues usually ecologically themed and has an intelligent script that even the most jaded viewer who would normally despise any film that was animated could thoroughly enjoy if given the chance still miyazaki almost never forgets who will undoubtedly be in the audience of these movies children br br that said am at loss to think of another filmmaker with this ability where else are you going to have film where three year old my nephew link will sit still throughout the move enthralled 7 year old my niece amber loving it all her own and able to appreciate the star power of frankie jonas and noah cyrus 12 year old my nephew aaron who review was of course it was good everything miyazaki san does is good 32 year old animation fan brought to tears by the powerful directing and gorgeous animation er that would be me and 58 year old woman my mother able to connect with the mother characters and m betting the older charas too and loving the cuteness of the child characters br br and that is what respect most about miyazaki san he seems to speak to his audience in completely different way than the average filmmaker on the surface ponyo could be seen as simple story about little fish girl who gets taste of the human world and wants to join it and the friend she makes there little boy names soske somewhat like the little mermaid but there is an entire different level at play here true to form miyazaki populates his film with intensely strong female characters ponyo mother soske mother the older ladies in nursing home are all genuine characters with minds of their own and extremely strong willed br br but the girl who takes the cake is ponyo herself once she decides that she likes the human world she simply uses her own will to achieve her dreams her father is trying to keep her innocent and keep her magical fish but young ponyo knows what she wants and becomes human out of simply her own determination br br once human she teams up with her friend soske whom she loves very much although maybe not as much as ham soske is asked to be the man of the house at age five when his mother lisa decides she has to help the people at the rest home where she works during typhoon that has been inadvertently caused by ponyo on her quest to become human frankie jonas yes he related to the jonas brothers can we just get past that please gives perhaps the best performance in the film as young soske which is good since he has the most lines his character is also strong willed but also very respectful and friendly characteristics you re not likely to find in child character on this side of the pacific br br in the end ponyo father fujimoto must cope with his daughter decision and his estranges wife wishes to allow her to be human he hopes that ponyo and soske will remember him fondly and once again miyazaki refuses to allow character to become the stereotypical bad guy although miyazaki has for some reason received some criticism for this it is honestly what makes his movies magical and yet relatable no one in real life is completely bad person all humans are various shades of gray and that is exactly what miyazaki does with his characters br br and then there the animation itself in time when cgi would certainly have helped with the copious amounts of effects shots in this film especially the water miyazaki has chosen to incorporate no cgi whatsoever certainly the hand drawn animation was colored by digital means but every film in this was hand drawn and for one was extremely grateful for that the character animation was extremely fluid and there even appeared to be some lip sync going on quite unusual for an anime film the backgrounds seemed to be rendered with colored pencil and had an effect all its own on the audience this is what animation used to look like and what it should look like br br in the end found ponyo to be thoroughly enjoyable certainly not miyazaki best in my opinion that honor is still held by kiki delivery service but still 10 star fun movie for the entire family ',

 ' was unlike most of the reviewers not born in the 80 i was born on may 14th 1994 despite this my life was very much in the style of the 80 when other kids had playstations was playing zelda on my nes etc now this movie holds special place in my heart already despite me being only 15 years old at the time of writing this review because of my 80 style early childhood watched many tv shows and saw many movies that other kids didn see and this movie was one of those and one of the greatest too br br it starts off in the los angeles home of alvin seville simon seville theodore seville and david seville david the chipmunk adoptive father is in rush to get to the airport as he is going on business trip around europe his taxi is almost there and the chipmunks help him pack while they are talking alvin expresses his will to come with dave and to see the world even though technically dave is only going to europe so to alvin apparently only america and europe qualify as the world david is leaving the chipmunks in the care of miss miller much to the displeasure of the boys soon dave is off to the airport and the chipmunks are left at home with miss miller later at local cafã the chipmunks are playing game of around the world in 30 days against the chipettes brittany jeanette and eleanore after losing the game to brittany after having his hot air balloon eaten out of the sky by crocodile alvin get in an argument with brittany about who would really win race around the world two diamond smugglers sitting at nearby table klaus and claudia furschtien overhear their argument and needing safe way of transporting their diamonds over the world decide to fool the children into delivering them for them they set up race around the world where each team will have to deposit doll in their own likeness secretely filled with diamonds at drop offs around the world and receive doll in the opposing team likeness secretely filled with the payment for the diamonds to varify that they were there the winning team would then receive 100 000 dollar reward they do this because they believe that jamal an interpol agent who has been hot on their heels for some times now would never suspect them because they are just kids however this seems to be redundant because on their travels the kids do not have to go through any security checks and are never even questioned about the dolls suspect that neither would klaus or claudia if they had taken the diamonds there personally and so begins great adventure this film is classic and see no reason why anyone would not like it it features great animation and top notch voice acting not to mention the kick ass music pardon my french my favorite song is without shred of doubt the girls and boys of rock and roll an amazing rock song that cannot be topped it also my favorite moment in the film other notable songs include getting lucky kind of suggestive for kid film eh and my mother as well as wooly bully and off to see the world not to mention the main theme of the movie heard during the opening credits performed by the royal london philharmonic orchestra the scene with my mother still brings tear to my eye in relation to the song getting lucky first didn think anything of it but when grew older and learned about life it became clear that that song was little bit suggestive that song along with the fact that the animators insist on the audience knowing the color of the chipettes panties this is especially apparent in the scene in egypt when the chipettes are being chased by the arabian prince men when eleanor leans over the side of the hot air balloon basket and her skirt defies gravity completely while this does nothing to draw from the overall quality of the film it one of those unexplained things like why nobody in the world seems to mind that there are 4 feet tall chipmunks walking around and speaking in incredibly high pitched voices and treat them just like they would any human child anyway bit after that scene the chipettes discover the diamonds in the dolls and decide to go find the chipmunks and get home the direction of janice karman perfects this movie as she and her husband ross bagdasarian jr know the characters better than anyone they even do the voices of the chipmunks and the chipettes ross doing the voices for alvin and simon as well as dave and janice doing the voices for all the chipettes and theodore speaking of male characters that are voiced by female voice actresses nancy cartwright the voice of bart simpson makes an appearance in this movie she plays the part of the arabian prince very small but important role the ending is of course happy one the crooks have been caught the loose ends tied and the film ends when the children dave and miss miller are driving into the sunset alvin complaining about not having gotten his 100 000 dollar reward for winning the race which annoys dave until he finally yells alvin and the screen fades to black br br classic ending by the way hope you found my review of this movie useful and if you haven seen this flick give it watch it worth the money this nostalgic classic from the 80 gets solid 10 out of 10 br  ' as is often the case when you attempt to take 400 plus page book and cram it into two hour film lot is lost here director john madden shakespeare in love takes on an extremely ambitious project and almost pulls it off what we get is charming and emotionally compelling film that seems somehow incomplete br br there is much about this film that is wonderful and fantastic the cinematography by john toll cinematographer for braveheart and legends of the fall winning oscars for both is splendid working with madden the choices for locations on the greek island of kefallonia are superb and the visual images that come from photographing these majestic locations in varying light are lush and beautiful madden also uses numerous greek actors as the townspeople giving the town an authentic feel the soundtrack is also terrific and the mandolin passages and vocals by the italian soldiers are marvelous br br madden does an excellent job of bringing us the italian occupation and the romance which take up the greater part of the film there are numerous sweet and funny moments throughout this segment however by the time the serious battle drama is ready to unfold there isn much film left in the reel and this component is extremely rushed and abbreviated while the battle scenes are well done subsequent to the battle it is obvious that increasingly greater compromises are being made to keep the film from running too long by the time we reach the post war scenes the treatment is merely skeletal another negative is that the dvd is particularly sparse on features br br nicholas cage is charming in the romantic lead as the sentimental captain who seems to have joined the army to sing rather than fight when fight he must cage switches gears seamlessly into man of fierce principle and resolve and somehow remains believable in both personas br br penelope cruz whom the camera loves gives an uninspired performance as pelagia in part this is because cage so dominates the screen but cruz just seems too placid in part that should be emotionally torrential and dynamic she allows the character to be objectified as corelli love interest rather than establishing her as powerful character in her own right br br john hurt gives fantastic performance as the wise old doctor who knows as much about human nature as medicine however christian bale seems bit overwrought and stiff as pelagia fiancã br br rated this film an 8 10 despite some drawbacks this is touching film that is well worth seeing the photography alone is worth the price of admission ',

 ' prey br br aspect ratio 1 37 1 br br sound format mono br br lesbian couple sally faulkner and glory annan living in remote country house are driven apart by the arrival of young man barry stokes who turns out to be flesh eating alien the vanguard of massive invasion br br despite its shoestring budget and leaden pacing norman warren follow up to satan slave 1976 amounts to great deal more than the sum of its meager parts thanks to surprisingly complex script by max cuff apparently his only writing credit faulkner and annan indulge an obsessive relationship whilst living in isolated splendor within the english countryside rendered alternately beautiful and ominous by derek browne eye catching cinematography though annan discovery of bloodstained clothing in an upstairs room marks one or both of these doe eyed lovelies as psychologically disturbed which may explain the absence of their respective families some of whom appear to have lived in the house at one time or another and left under mysterious circumstances stokes unexpected arrival throws the relationship into disarray partly because faulkner has pathological hatred of men and partly because annan is attracted to him creating tensions which result in climactic whirlwind of violence there an extraordinary multi layered sequence in which faulkner attempts to emasculate their clueless visitor by dressing him in women clothing though stokes alien mentality allows him to rise above the intended mockery br br in the early scenes at least the relationship between faulkner and annan is depicted with uncommon grace and dignity but this heartfelt sapphic liaison quickly devolves into crowd pleasing episodes of sex and pulchritude culminating in an explosion of horror when annan allows herself to be ravished by stokes following violent argument with faulkner the closing sequences are quite literally gut wrenching especially annan final scene which appears to have been clipped for censorship reasons in 1977 and never fully restored what remains is still pretty vivid so brace yourselves excellent performances by the three leads bolstered by warren unobtrusive direction which takes full advantage of the stunning woodland locations thereby compensating for the film budgetary shortcomings originally released in the us as alien prey ',

the end of mazursky an unmarried woman they are brave women surrounded by cardboard men and one cardboard man ashok seems to come alive in the last shot we see of him carrying his invalid mother biji he seems to finally take on future responsibility beyond celibacy and adherance to religion br br ms mehta seems to fumble as director however compared to most indian mainstream cinema she would seem to be brilliant as she cannot use her script to go beyond the microscopic joint family she is presenting except presenting glimpse of the chinese micro minority in the social milieu of india she even dedicates the film to her mother and daughter not her father yet her radha reminesces of halcyon days with both her parents in mustard field compare her to mrinal sen adoor gopalakrishnan muzaffar ali and she is dwarfed by these giants given her competent canadian production team and financial resources mehta film of two bisexual ladies in an indian middle class household may be sacrilege to some but merely captures the atrophy of middle class homes that does not seem to aspire for something better than its immediate survival in limited social space kannada malayalam and bengali films have touched parallel themes in india but did not have the publicity that surrounded this film and therefore have not been seen by wide segment of knowledgeable cinemagoers br br ms das ms azmi mr jafri and mr kharbanda are credible but not outstanding ms azmi is talented actress who gave superb performances under good directors mrinal sen khandar gautam ghose paar benegal ankur brilliance notably absent in this film ms das sparkled due to her screen presence rather than her acting capability all in all the film strength remains in the structure of the screenplay which is above average in terms  ' saturday june 3 6 30pm the neptune br br monday june 5 4 30pm the neptune br br few celebrations of ethnic and cultural identity succeed as mightily as carlos saura brilliant interpretation of isaac albeniz masterpiece iberia suite at the approach of its centennial saura drew together an unprecedented wealth of talent from the spanish performing arts community to create this quintessential love song to their homeland the twelve impressions of the suite are presented without narrative in stark surroundings allowing the power of each performance to explode before saura camera creative use of large flats and mirrors moved throughout the set combined with screens shadows fire rain and rear projection add glorious dramatic effects to the varied selections of song dance and instrumental performance photographs of albeniz reappear throughout the program connecting the passion of the music to its great creator saura encompasses all spaniards on his stage from the beautiful elegance of elderly flamenco dancers in traditional costume to children joyously dancing with their instructors ',

 ' 1983 frightmare is an odd little film the director seems to be trying to combine the atmosphere of classic 30s 40s style horror movies with the shock factor of the then exploding 80s slasher genre it isn totally successful mostly due to very obvious budgetary restraints and the less than professional caliber of its cast of young actors but it still has its moments mostly due to the classy performance classier than the movie deserves by the late german actor ferdinand mayne who plays an aging old time horror movie star ala vincent price named conrad ratzoff at the beginning of the movie we meet the has been horror star as he shooting commercial for dentures and we quickly learn that ol conrad is bit of hoity toity prima donna jerk off just when you think he couldn be any more un likable the commercial director berates conrad for blowing take for the umpteenth time and the old goat pushes him off balcony to his death nice huh conrad then visits some fans at college campus horror movie club unfortunately he suffers heart attack in the middle of his speech to them and eventually ends up back at his mansion waiting to die still feisty even at death door he manages to do away with despised business associate by smothering him with pillow before he finally kicks the bucket himself conrad is then laid to rest in true hollywood style in high tech neon tomb with video screens above the casket which will play personal video messages from conrad himself for visitors who enter to pay their respects br br it is at this point that the kids from the college horror movie society decide to pay conrad grave an after hours visit breaking into the tomb and taking his body back home with them for an all night party not exactly my idea of fun but hey these are characters in an 80s horror film logic has no place here the college kids spend the evening having dinner with conrad body seated in place of honor posing for photos with it and even dancing around the room with it before parking conrad and his coffin in the attic planning to return him to his crypt in the morning in the meantime mrs ratzoff distraught over the theft of her husband body has called in psychic friend to try and reach conrad through seance you can pretty much figure out the rest from here since conrad wasn a very nice guy in life it not much of stretch to assume that he won be any friendlier in death psychic lady makes contact with conrad and he re awakens in predictably ticked off fashion then spends the rest of the movie strolling around the corridors of the students ridiculously huge house picking off the young grave robbers one by one this is where the movie falls apart endless scenes of teens wandering around empty hallways saying hello is anyone there are intercut with occasional bursts of violence we do get pretty gnarly decapitation scene which is the highlight of the movie before the last two survivors finally figure out way later than any semi intelligent people would have figured out the same thing but again we re in an 80s horror film that the only way to stop the mayhem is to get conrad body back to its crypt where it belongs the sluggish pacing is padded out with lot of weird lighting and dry ice fog effects backed by soundtrack made up almost entirely of sound effects rather than music thunder moans and groans howls etc that becomes severely annoying after while br br can really recommend frightmare to anyone who didn grow up watching cheap movies like this on late night cable back in the 80s modern horror fans will doubtlessly find frightmare incredibly slow moving and goofy if you came of age in that magical decade however you may get blast of nostalgia from frightmare fans of jeffrey re animator combs may also want to check it out as the future dr west appears in an early role here as one of the unlucky film students br br will advise the reader to avoid the version of this film on the eastwestdvd label paired with roy ward vault of horror and sold at dollar stores because the print quality is terrible m told the film has gotten deluxe release via the fine folks at troma which seems appropriate if you re troma kind of person then frightmare will be right up your alley ',

 ' flying saucer manned literally by crew of about 20 male space explorers travels hundreds of millions of light years from earth to check in on colony founded some 25 years ago on forbidden planet what they find is robot more advanced than anything imaginable on earth beautiful and totally socially inept young woman and her father hermit philologist haunted by more than the demons of the ancient civilization he has immersed himself in br br on the surface this story is pulp scifi murder mystery some compare it to shakespeare tempest but this is stretch and in some ways an insult to the scifi genre stripped of what makes it scifi film sure its the tempest but how many hundreds of films can you say something similar about br br underneath this is cautionary tale about progress and technology and the social evolution necessary for its appropriate and safe use yet the film still proceeds with all the hopefulness for our future that we have come to expect from shows like star trek br br anne francis is not the only reason why this film is best described as beautiful the special effects and even the aesthetics of the backdrops are powerful enough to make the uninspired directing and uneven acting almost unnoticeable if it were not for the goofy retro art deco ness of 1950s sci fi props you might think you were watching 1960s piece br br this is classic of that very special sub genre of sci fi like to call 1950s sci fi and though not in my opinion the best it is certainly must see for anybody interested in sci fi film and special effects the clever plot now rendered trite by its reuse in six or seven episodes of star trek lost in space and even farscape is worth paying attention to and will sustain the interest of most scifi fans trekkers will be particularly interested in the various aspects of the film which seem to have inspired themes of star trek original series aired about 12 years later though they may find themselves disappointed by the relatively mild 1950s sexism and the lack of any kind of racial integration while do not mean to nitpick the lack of social progress manifest in this film was the one major problem had with it br br some will probably see this film simply to catch glimpse of young good looking leslie nielsen in one of his first starring roles unfortunately nielsen performance is only average and at times down right poor especially at the climax of the film walter pigeon though quite excellent in other films over acts his role as well ms francis earl holliman and the amazing robby the robot are the stand out actors in this crowd though on the whole the character actors filling in the ensemble do good job the problems with the featured performances think are as much the fault of the director and the editor as anything though they certainly got most of the film quite right ',
 ' just saw this film on dvd last night and decided to check out the reviews this morning it seems that robot has polarized the critical viewing community here on imdb and given rise to lot of insults and name calling too br br find this somewhat surprising as this film is not great or even good but neither is it terrible or even really bad what this film really is is depressing depressing that the us film goer population is so ready to lap up insipid clichã re heats and acclaim them as spectacular new works this film as retread written all over it from the plot line an uneasy mix of asimov and modern day uber action to smith character smart mouthed cynic with backbone of titanium to the special effects that borrowed from matrix and few others br br robot is sadly quite possibly the perfect action movie for today audience superficial plot insipidly snappy dialog and lots and lots of adrenaline smith is mediocre but we already knew that he seems to be hollywood latest unsuccessful attempt to create black bruce willis the story has lots of holes in it of all sizes but don think most people drawn to this film are critically minded enough to notice perhaps blockbuster by today standards but very movie compared to true winners ',

 ' adenoid hynkel lowly soldier in world war one rises in subsequent years to become the ruthless dictator of toumania he creates an aggressive antisemitic war machine and cultivates little toothbrush moustache sound like anyone you know br br from the safety of hollywood chaplin uses this soapbox to exhort europe to take up arms and defy hitler and mussolini given that the united states in 1940 had more than year of neutrality ahead of it and no strong desire to embroil itself in europe civil strife remember it was hitler who declared war on the usa not the other way round it is surprising that chaplin was allowed to distribute this immoderate polemic br br the story involves on the one hand the the vulgar and repellant hynkel and the reign of terror over which he ineptly presides and life in the jewish ghetto where every single person is friendly humane brave etc etc chaplin is hynkel and he also plays the jewish barber the little hero of the ghetto the tramp in all but name needless to say chaplin writes directs stars composes the music and does the catering br br in 1940 the full truth was not yet known about the third reich and chaplin can be forgiven for having something less than perfect historical foresight but even by the standards of the day he gets hitler badly wrong comedian and sentimentalist chaplin tries to ridicule hitler by making hynkel silly and hapless all this does is to humanise him when hynkel the not very warlike soldier fools around with the big gun and the upside down aeroplane he becomes endearing rather than despicable as dictator he inspects his subordinates technical innovations which don work the parachute hat the bulletproof uniform etc and these passages are meant to make us think that the real life nazis are incompetent and can be swept aside in fact hynkel regime is made cute and likeable by its bumbling bodgery br br in truth chaplin day had already passed when he made this ill considered polemic at heart he was still dinosaur of the silent screen check out the humour with gags like staggering up and down the street semi conscious or the pantomime of the coins in the puddings the hero schultz is meant to represent yardstick of european decency against which hynkel can be judged but schultz looks more like character from operetta than nazi is it in any way believable that schultz figure if such had existed would say to the fuehrer face your cause is doomed to failure because it built upon the stupid ruthless persecution of innocent people and how does schultz come to be in the cellars of the jewish ghetto if he is the object of an exhaustive manhunt why does he persist in wearing his ruritanian uniform chaplin did not yet know the full horrors of auschwitz birkenau or treblinka but the nazi concentration camp which he offers us is hopelessly out of kilter with the grim spirit of the age as usual chaplin thinks in terms of silent comedy set pieces loosely pegged onto the narrative clothes line there is the knockabout scrapping with the stormtroopers shaving man to the accompaniment of brahms and the globe ballet watch for the segment filmed in reverse br br paulette goddard is the unremittingly perfect hannah just as the people of the ghetto are impossibly nice and the jewish haven in osterlich is ridiculously idyllic so hannah is quite literally too good to be true brave defiant resourceful hardworking and of course beautiful she is the canary of judaism in the ghetto cage gee ain i cute she asks after the barber gives her make over too cute by far is the answer she doesn come close to ringing true because chaplin has made her caricature the wouldn it be wonderful speech which chaplin puts into her mouth is typical of the author too wordy too emotionally cloying br br jack oakie is great as napaloni the fascist dictator of bacteria he brings whiff of much needed comic brio to the proceedings but the film underlying weakness remains if napaloni is silly and ineffective how can we fear him and anyway the stuttering stop start of the back projected train is fine chaplinesque example of gag that is persisted with far beyond its comic worth br br and where did the jewish barber acquire that immaculate hynkel uniform ',

 ' the year 2005 saw no fewer than 3 filmed productions of g wells great novel war of the worlds this is perhaps the least well known and very probably the best of them no other version of wotw has ever attempted not only to present the story very much as wells wrote it but also to create the atmosphere of the time in which it was supposed to take place the last year of the 19th century 1900 â using wells original setting in and near woking england br br imdb seems unfriendly to what they regard as spoilers that might apply with some films where the ending might actually be surprise but with regard to one of the most famous novels in the world it seems positively silly have no sympathy for people who have neglected to read one of the seminal works in english literature so let get right to the chase the aliens are destroyed through catching an earth disease against which they have no immunity if that a spoiler so be it after book and 3 other films including the 1953 classic you ought to know how this ends br br this film which follows wells plot in the main is also very cleverly presented â in way that might put many viewers off due to their ignorance of late 19th early 20th century photography although filmed in widescreen aspect the film goes to some lengths to give an impression of contemporaneity the general coloration of skin and clothes display sepia tint often found in old photographs rather than black colors are often reminiscent of hand tinting at other times colors are washed out these variations are typical of early films which didn use standardized celluloid stock and therefore presented good many changes in print quality even going from black white to sepia white to blue white to reddish white and so on â as you ll see on occasion here the special effects are deliberately retrograde of sort seen even as late as the 1920s â and yet the martians and their machines are very much as wells described them and have more nearly realistic feel some of effects are really awkward â such as the destruction of big ben the acting is often more in the style of that period than ours some aspects of victorian dress may appear odd particularly the use of pomade or brilliantine on head and facial hair br br this film is the only one that follows with some closeness wells original narrative â as has been noted viewers may find it informative to note plot details that appear here that are occasionally retained in other versions of the story wells description of the martians â giant head mounted on numerous tentacles â is effectively portrayed when the martian machines appear about an hour into the film they too give good impression of how wells described them both wells and this film do an excellent job of portraying the progress of the martians from the limited perspective primarily of rural england â plus few scenes in london involving the narrator brother the director is unable to resist showing the destruction of major landmark big ben but at least doesn dwell unduly on the devastation of london br br the victory of the martians is hardly surprise despite the destruction by cannon of some of their machines the narrator traveling about to seek escape sees much of what wells terms the rout of mankind he encounters curate endowed with the victorian affliction of much too precious and nervous personality they eventually find themselves on the very edge of martian nest where they discover an awful fact the martians are shown to be vampires who consume their prey alive in very effective scene wells adds that after eating they set up prolonged and cheerful hooting the narrator finally is obliged to beat senseless the increasingly hysterical curate â who revives just as the martians drag him off to the larder cheers from the gallery british curates are so often utterly insufferable br br this film lasts almost 3 hours going through wells story in welcome detail it about time the author got his due â in compelling presentation that builds in dramatic impact word about the acting don expect award winning performances they re not bad however the actors are earnest and they grow on you most of them however have had very abbreviated film careers often only in this film the narrator is played by hunky anthony piana in his 2nd film the curate is john kaufman â also in his 2nd film as an actor but who has had more experience directing the brother henderson is played with some conviction by bernard bauman in his first film the artilleryman the only other sizable part is played by james lathrop in his first film br br this is overall splendid film portraying for the first time the war of the worlds as wells wrote it despite its slight defects it is far and away better than any of its hyped up competitors if you want to see g wells war of the worlds â and not some wholly distorted version of it â see this film ',
