 ' decided to watch this movie because d not seen carol lombard before in any movie m sorry it had to be this one because quite frankly this is dog â and even with jimmy stewart and charles coburn both of whom were great actors br br the problem with the film is simple it tries to put too much too quickly in to story about young lawyer john manson played by stewart who marries jane played by lombard within an hour of meeting her what that clichã marry in haste repent at leisure br br in short the story is series of episodes that show the couples worsening financial status their troubles with john live in mother their struggles to pay the bills john diminished status at the office the arrival of their baby son john jnr unexpected and causing additional friction at home with mother the couples angst about their marriage the baby sickness which worsens thus necessitating an heroic flight by lone pilot in fierce storm to bring special serum to save the child and finally john being accepted as junior partner at the law firm br br how many more clichã situations could the writers include maybe mother dying soon after there wasn much comedy the drama was lacklustre at best the dialog was painful to hear only the acting of the four main players was adequate br br this was the period at the end of the great depression with the usa coming out of its long downturn â during which many people experienced all of the events portrayed in the movie br br so it made sense for selznick to reaffirm good ol home spun american values of family relationships heroism perseverance and initiative â all against the backdrop of the average american family who better to use than jimmy stewart and carol lombard br br and it should be noted that the film was released in early 1939 so it was planned in 1938 â soon after the usa began to get production going for the coming world war ii hence this sort of film was great booster for the general public at that time many of who would soon have to join england in war as many here would know hollywood and washington formed an uneasy alliance before during and after the war br br however m glad saw it â as piece of disguised socio political propaganda but ll have to see other lombard films to gain better appreciation of her acting range br br as another reviewer noted see this one just to say that you ve seen all of stewart movies otherwise don bother ',
 ' br br must admit was expecting something quite different from my first viewing of cut last night though was delighted with the unexpected australian horror gem am true horror fan as true as they come and found cut to not only be the best of the genre australia has ever produced but one of the great parody comedy films of late br br my only concern is that mainstream audiences may not pick up on lot of the comedic elements the film was not overly clever in it application but made me laugh at every turn trying to fit in every possible cliche of the horror genre they could am certain this was intended as humour hoping this was intended as humour br br and of course there was the gore br br the use of the customised garden shears was brilliance besides the expected stabs and slashes in short there was huge amount of variety and creativity in the many violent deaths enough to please even the skeptics of this films worth br br the appearance of both kylie minogue short that her appearance was and molly ringwald was just another reason to see the film both performances were fantastic as well as simon bossell the castle in brilliant role as the jokey technician br br all in all think this movie is one of the best horror products of the last couple or years as well as beautiful satire parody toungue in cheek till the very end br br loved it go see it ',

 ' director don siegel really impressed me with this film it is starkly shot graphic without being visually graphic well acted by all concerned and covers some of the most taboo issues of any day in workmanlike almost expected normalcy hitherto not seen in any other film by this reviewer didn know what to expect sitting down to watch this civil war movie or some kind of 70 soft core peddling with eastwood descending on school for girls in the south but really is is neither of those things but rather and examination exploration and descent into the soul of men and women dark commentary on what is at the core of the civilized as one reviewer previously noted none none of the characters are likable by the film end and yet each one is interesting complex and enigmatic eastwood plays cpl mcburney union soldier found by young pamelyn ferdin you ll recognize that voice as soon as you hear it girl at school for manners headed by geraldine page amidst the chaos that was the civil war particularly in the south soon page teacher elizabeth hartman lovely young seductress carol and even ferdin amy have emotional sexual ties to eastwood each having their own needs and secrets and problems eastwood is not nice man he plays the girls off of each other always trying to get the sexual advantage in the unfolding we get some real interesting things revealed from latent lesbianism to incest the beguiled for me is masterpiece that far exceeded my expectations on every creative front this might be except for invasion of the body snatchers siegel best film it certainly is one of eastwood best real performances page is always so very good and hartman fe5rdin et al excellent the gothic manse set for the school is effectively claustrophobic some of the sexual laced scenes disturbing and what happens to eastwood is leg up on much of the competition for creepy eerie demented film ',
 ' arguably the finest serial ever made no argument here thus far about earthman flash gordon professor zarkov and beautiful dale arden traveling in rocket ship to another universe to save the planet along the way in spellbinding spectacular and action packed chapters flash and his friends along with new found friends such as prince barin prince thun and the awesome king vultan pool their resources together to fight the evils and armies of the merciless ming of mongo and the jealous treachery of his daughter priness aura now she a car this serial is not just cut above most serials in terms of plot acting and budget it is miles ahead in these areas produced by universal studios it has many former sets at its disposable like the laboratory set from the bride of frankenstein and the opera house from the phantom of the opera just to name few the production values across the board are advanced in my most humble opinion for 1936 the costumes worn by many of these strange men and women are really creative and first rate we get hawk men shark men lion men high priests creatures like dragons octasacks orangapoids and tigrons oh my and many many other fantastic things are all of them believable and first rate special effects no way but for 1936 most are very impressive the musical score is awesome and the chapter beginnings are well written lengthy enough to revitalize viewer memories of the former chapter and expertly scored director frederick stephani does great job piecing everything together wonderfully and creating worthy film for alex raymond phenom comic strip lastly the acting is pretty good in this serial all too often serials have either no names with no talent surrounding one or two former talents here most everyone has some ability don get me wrong this isn a shakespeare troupe by any means but buster crabbe does workmanlike likable job as flash he is ably aided by jean arden priscella lawson and the rest of the cast in general with two performers standing out but before get to those two let me add as another reviewer noted it must have been amazing for this serial to get by the hayes office see more flesh on flash and on jean rogers and priscella lawson than in movies decades later the shorts crabbe and unfortunately for all of us professor zarkov frank shannon wears are about as form fitting pair of shorts guys can wear the girls are wearing mid drifts throughout and are absolutely beautiful jean rogers may have limited acting talent but she is blonde bombshell lawson is also very sultry and sensuous and beautiful but for me the two actors that make the serial are charles middleton as ming officious sardonic merciless and fun middleton is class act jack tiny lipson plays king vultan boisterous rousing hilarious symbol for pure joy in life and the every essence of hedonism lipson steals each and every scene he is in the plot meanders here there and everywhere but flash gordon is the penultimate serial space opera and the basis for loads of science fiction to follow excellent ',
 ' perfect movies are rare even my favorite films tend to have flaws rear window looks little stagey at times chris elliot character in groundhog day doesn work the music score in best years of our lives is too cheesy the beginning of nights of cabiria is little too slow but this film is perfectly executed from start to finish br br the script is brilliant the acting is superb all around although reese witherspoon and sam waterston are amazing the whole cast shines the directing and the photography are inspired and the music score is touching without being intrusive like some miramax scores that are too manipulative every sad moment is truly moving every light moment makes me smile this truly is one of the best films have ever seen and wish there were more films like it br br am glad that reese witherspoon has gone on to stardom after this film but am sorry to see that her recent movies are so much more escapist and silly than this serious film which is about real people real feelings and real problems brilliant must see ',

 ' for greta garbo first talking picture mgm wisely chose eugene neill pultizer prize winning 1921 play anna christie br br also wisely the producers backed garbo up with not one but two members of the original broadway cast george marion as anna father chris and james mack as johnny the priest transmuted to johnny the harp for films so as not to offend br br this little change is interesting like too many films accused by those who want movies to be movies and ignore their origins of being little more than filmed stage plays the problem is not the play but the movie makers who wouldn be more faithful to the property by diluting great cinematic stage work so it wouldn offend anyone or opening it up because they could too many lose the very qualities which made the piece worth filming in the first place br br fortunately the respect the studio had for both neill and garbo allowed anna christie to survive the normally destructive process admirably in frances marion generally sensitive screen adaptation wonder of wonders marion even allows the point of the scene where garbo anna reveals her past on the farm to the man she badly wants to marry and the father who sent her there in tact what the league of decency must have thought of that br br the source play greatest problem has always been that chris friend marthy tends to walk away with the first act and then disappears from the last two so that anna can take stage the two sides of the genuinely good woman men don always recognize br br the perfectly cast marie dressler who had cut her teeth on the broadway stage as well before going to hollywood is the perfect balance for garbo anna in this area as well and the fast moving film at only 90 minutes doesn allow us too much time to miss her one of the few benefits from atmosphere being shown rather than eloquently described in the original and screenwriter marion is wise enough to stray from neill to bring dressler back for touching scene two thirds of the way through the film that will remind many of julie laverne second act appearance in show boat br br anna and marthy early scene together on screen 16 minutes into the film taking each other measure and setting up all the tension of the rest of the story is among the most affecting scenes in the entire piece not to be missed br br anna christie is great tragic play and good film drama it hard to imagine that latter day remake which would almost certainly lose the grit and atmosphere of this 1930 remake it was first filmed without sound in 1923 also with george marion original broadway chris could improve on this excellent filming br br the internal scenes hew closest to the play but the exteriors shouldn be missed by anyone with an eye to atmosphere while the background screen work is not to modern technical standards the backgrounds give better glimpse than most films of the era of the actual world in which the screen play is set especially in the new york harbor br br nearly all garbo naturalistic performances of the sound era have held up superbly only the too often parodied death scene from camille 7 years later will occasionally draw snickers because of the heavy handed direction and the parodies but this anna christie together with the variety of her 1932 films mata hari and grand hotel and the sublime lubitsch touch on her 1939 comedy ninotchka garbo laughs surely stand as her best br br neill fans who are taken with this play at the edge of his lauded sea plays should track down the fine world war ii shaped film released in the year before the s entered the conflict the long voyage home 1940 it is almost as skillfully drawn from those sea plays as this one is from anna christie and features youngish john wayne in one of his rare non westerns supporting fine cast of veteran actors showing him the way ',

be to buy stock footage of four young boys playing in grainy slow motion once they re grown it easy to spot the writer director among the four he the quiet contemplative long haired one who is never seen without his composition book tucked in his pants this means that his superb writing talent will be his ticket from hickville to hollywood only there no writing or directing talent on display here  ' lorna green janine reynaud is performance artist for wealthy intellectuals at local club she falls prey to her fantasies as the promise of romantic interludes turn into murder as she kills those was privy to within her dreams ever took place in reality br br if someone asked me how to describe this particular work from franco d say it elegant difficult by now you ve probably read other user comments befuddled by what this film is about since large portion of it takes place within the surreal atmosphere of dream franco mentioned in an interview that he was heavily influenced by godard early in his career as far as film making style and so deciding to abandon clear narrative structure in favor of trying to create whole different type of viewing experience and as you read from the reaction of the user comments here some like this decision others find the style labouring dull and bewildering ll be the first to admit that the film is over my head but even franco himself when quizzed by critics who watched succubus admitted that he didn even understand the film and he directed it some might say that succubus was merely precursor to his more admired work venus in furs considered his masterwork by franco faithful because it also adopts the surreal dreamlike structure where the protagonist doesn truly know whether he she is experiencing something real or imagined in sense like the protagonist we are experiencing the same type of confusion certainly succubus is unconventional film making where we aren given the keys to what is exactly going on and great deal of the elusive dialogue doesn help matters succubus is also populated by beatnik types and poet speak corman film bucket of blood poked fun at my personal favorite scene teases at possible lesbian interlude between lorna and woman she meets at posh party quite bizarre fantasy sequence where mannequins are used rather unusually great locations and jazz score liked this film myself although can understand why it does receive negative reaction loved that one scene at the posh party with lorna wee bit drunk writhing on the floor in gorgeous evening gown as others attending the shindig equally wasted rush her in an embrace of kisses ',

 ' saw zp when it was first released and found it major disappointment its script seemed forced and arch and too fakey 60s it politics too upfront and ridiculous and let face it was still under love spell known as blowup and still haven completely shaken it now the love is twisted up with all sorts of nostalgia it evokes and oh well good luck to me br br but time marches on and time has been kind to zp and time has been teacher to me revisit this film about every ten years and it just gets better and better with age and zp is it own experience and is only really linked to blowup through its creator the late great mr antonioni br br twelve years ago had the great good fortune to see an absolutely pristine print projected at its correct size immense restored by an italian government cultural agency who knows good work of art when they see it and knows the importance of keeping such thing of beauty in good shape to this day remember the gasp from the audience when the first shot of death valley appeared it was like thousand volt visual shock antonioni had intentionally delivered to wake us up to new level of awareness and indeed what follows from that point is an entirely different sort of place br br what is astonishing to me is how this film is coming into its own br br remember the second time around seeing it the early 80s had begun to feel affection towards the film as whole and towards daria and mark in particular whereas before these two seemed like smart alecky shadow version of zefferelli olivia and leonard read romeo and juliet they now were engaging me particularly the girl in her insistent slo motion ality she took her time to live everything everything dies around her br br upon exciting the theater the daylight of reality quickly began to erase my new found enjoyment the encroaching shoulder padded big haired 80s whispered but that a hippie fantasy let it go br br the force of antonioni vision had had realised already worked itself inside of me the first time around so answered 80s with an uh huh and guarded my love secretly possessively and jealously br br but this then is what good art does it lives inside of you and if you wish it has its way and loves you back secretly jealously and possessively and you get changed br br was thrilled to see that turner classic movies had decided to show zp in its march lineup undoubtedly zp must be seen on gigantic screen so that it can truly take you into its constructed environment but hey sometimes even glimpse of the beloved in newspaper photo is no better than no glimpse at all br br today reality hit zp has been withdrawn mysteriously and replaced with the whiney antics of alice restaurant br br so it is still too difficult too disturbing too what br br maybe it that as with all good art it lives while everything dies around it br br peace ',

 ' found this to be surprisingly light handed touch at 1950 culture clash movie john wayne would hardly be one first choice as cultural attache being about as diplomatic with his good intentions as bull run in harrods but this time he was left to play part that was far more passive than his usual bluff persona and he accomplished his task with style the duke was guy who really could act well his facial expressions and body language could be extremely subtle br br despite his considerable presence both as an actor and in terms of screen time he failed to dominate this movie many of his good intentions came cropper he had authority over nobody and the intermittent narrative was provided by the titular geisha to whom he was the barbarian br br the story of american attempts to curry favour with an isolationist japan was one of political intrigue rather than swashbuckling or hell for leather battles cannot comment on the accuracy of its research but the strangeness of the oriental culture to western sensibilities was demonstrated well there was great deal of minutely choreographed ceremony entailing what looked to this observer like authentic costume and props the set pieces were complex and detailed lot of money and thought had been applied to it br br the fractured romance between wayne and his geisha added little extra element and stopped the movie becoming just political or flag waving effort script was good without being too wordy there was great deal of japanese dialogue but the lengthy periods of translation didn interfere with the narrative it was nice to see plenty of genuine orientals on the set whether or not they were japanese couldn say but anyway they looked the part at least the leads were not played by cross dressing caucasians unlike other  ' cinema greatest period started in post war europe with italy neo realist movement during the next 2 or 3 decades that followed france new wavers caught everyone attention and there was always bergman up there on his desolate scandinavian island somewhere making bitter masterpieces but in 1971 luchino visconti brought the art form to full circle geographically speaking with his miraculous work death in venice which might as well be called the death of europoean cinema after the sixties wound down so did the great european filmmakers who with some exceptions generally grew exhausted and passed the torch to new american generation of movie brats coppola scorsese co this movie absolutely feels like grand summing up not just of visconti particular obsessions but of the general attempt of european filmmakers to achieve the aesthetic ideal in movies and rest assured you will find no sterner task master than the visconti revealed here he not playing to the crowd folks either you get behind him and follow along or you get left behind the pacing is challenge slow but never without emotional weight incidents are few and far between but each seems loaded with symbolic significance in sturm und drang cosmos br br we will probably never be in such rarefied company again in terms of the movies one of the century great writers who inspired the tale thomas mann one of the greatest filmmakers directing it visconti one of the greatest actors in the lead role dirk bogarde and swelling almost ceaselessly in the background gustav mahler 5th symphony taking full advantage of mahler ability to inspire romanticism in even the most cynical breast visconti changes the main character aschenbach into decrepit composer from his original persona as writer even making bogarde up to look like mahler geeky mustache specs shaggy hair duck like walk bogarde by the way delivers what is probably greatest performance of an actor in the history of movies it a largely silent performance and the actor has to deliver reams of meaning in gesture or glance difficult trick without mugging like chaplin or merely acting like an animated corpse br br cinema just doesn get better than this ll ignore the complaints from the ritalin addicts out there who say that it too slow but even the more legitimate gripe concerning some of aschenbach flashbacks with that antagonistic friend of his is misplaced the flashbacks fit neatly within the movie thematic concerns e which is the better path to aesthetic perfection passion or discipline and the suddenness and shrillness of these interruptions serve to prevent sleepiness among the viewers of course some viewers will sleep through this movie anyway nonstop stream of mahler and beautiful dying venice would be nothing more than pretty picture but this movie is actually about something and what it mostly about is suffering romantic capital suffering in particular as suffering romantic himself visconti knew whereof he spoke br br spoiler guess if for nothing else see death in venice for its portentous opening credits and for its unforgettable ending with bogarde jet black hair dye dripping off of his sweaty dying head and onto his chalk white face meanwhile off in the distance young tadzio the object of bogarde dying desire stands in the ocean and points toward the horizon like michelangelo sculpture the climatic sequence sums up with agonizing economy everything that the movie is about love lust beauty loss the ending of life set against the beginning of another life and cold death in the midst of warm sunny beauty death in venice is miraculous work of art br br dvd tip as with the simultaneously released visconti masterpiece the damned recommend that you turn the english subtitles on while watching this movie it ostensibly in english but the dvd sound seems muddy and there a lot of italian spoken during the film anyway br br ',
 ' this show is great for many reasons the father and mother can communicate with their kids this day in age its so great to see real family instead of some stuffy overacting family watched this one time and became hooked it so great to see black family on tv worth watching this show left too soon but on its way out it dealt with pregnancy sexy drugs bad dates death etc the best thing about the show was that it dealt with it in real humorous sort of way great show for the family cant tell you how many times have sat up watched this show late at night sometimes and laughed my head off great pg 13 rated show loved everybit of this show ',
 ' this film is where the batman franchise ought to have stopped though will concede that the ideas behind batman forever were excellent and could have been easily realised by competent director as it turned out this was not to be the case br br apparently warner brothers executives were disappointed with how dark this second batman film from tim burton turned out apart from the idiocy of expecting anything else from burton and the conservative cowardice of their subsequent decision to turn the franchise into an homage to the sixties tv series fail to understand how batman returns can be considered at all disappointing br br true it is not quite the equal of the first film though it repairs all the minor deficiencies of style found in batman weaker script that splits the antagonism between not just two but three characters invites unflattering comparisons to the masterful pairing of keaton and jack nicholson as the joker in the first film yet for all this it remains gorgeously dark film true to the way the batman was always meant to be and highly satisfying br br michael keaton returns as the batman and his alter ego bruce wayne tangling with nouveau riche tycoon max schreck christopher walken named in honour of the 1920s german silent actor his partner in crime oswald cobblepot the penguin danny devito in brilliant makeup reminiscent of laurence olivier richard iii and selina kyle the catwoman michelle pfeiffer whom wayne romances both as himself and as the batman the four principals turn in excellent performances especially walken and devito while together keaton and pfeiffer explore the darker side of double identities br br there are some intriguing concepts in this film about the only weakness can really point out is certain limpness to the script in some places which think is due mostly to the way this film is four cornered fight there simply isn enough time to properly explore what going on br br nevertheless this is damn good film highly recommend watching this in conjunction with the first and then weeping for how good the series could have been had it continued under burton and keaton ',

 ' it is always difficult to bring 450 pages book down to three hours film read the book before and found the bbc production dealing with this difficulty in the best way possible the qualities of the book haven been lost the dense and lively depiction of fingersmith patchwork family in london in the 1860s the cold and obscene cruelty in which maud is brought up the characterization of different social groups by different ways of speaking the unexpected and surprising twists of the story the way the film makes the spectators look different at the same scenes when they are told first from sue point of view then from maud one the main actors do very good and especially the growing love between the two women is convincingly developed with first culmination in very tender love scene between the two and finally forgiving all the evil they were ready to do and did to each other because they still love each other br br for each of her books the author sarah waters has thoroughly investigated what life was like in british 19th century while in tipping the velvet it was the world of the vaudeville theaters and the beginning of social movements in affinity the dreadful reality of women penitentiaries and the fashionable evocation of spirits in fingersmith she depicts the public ceremony of hanging people in london and the inhuman treatment of persons supposed or declared disturbed in asylums based on the reading of sources and scientific research this is very well transferred to the film so that the corresponding scenes show high grade of historic truth highly recommend this film production because it offers three hours of colorful victorian atmosphere vivid emotions and suspense ',

 ' if you ve read mother night and enjoyed it so much as did that you just have to see the movie understand that you have to understand fundamental element of vonngut writing that beyond his story lies vonnegut himself and that you can put human mind on the screen his whit and humor just cannot be transcribed by screenplay or even the best acting performance believe that this movie exceeds in asking the key questions that vonnegut poses in his book but those frequent cynical moments of satire found on the page are not found on the screen does this mean that the movie misses the mark of course not in my opinion the movie succeeds because it does not try to recreate the experience of reading the book this is not medium for those too lazy to turn page it succeeds because it takes the fundamental elements of story created by one of america true artistic treasures and presents it in a framework without pretense ve seen other movie versions of vonnegut books where the director obviously tries to channel vonnegut genius and loses grip on his own craft would not place this movie as one of the best ve seen but it stands on its own legs as one well worth watching by taking vonnegut voice out of the movie narration or trying to insert it however it can mother night tells his story brilliantly and preserves the story fundamental lessons without confusion distraction or disappointment ',

 ' meticulously constructed and perfectly played to the ends of the earth is simply astonishing voyage out of our reality and into another age br br based on william golding trilogy these three 90 minute films chronicle the journey towards both australia and experience of youthful aristocrat edmund talbot benedict cumberbatch aboard an aging man war in the early 19th century as he heads for government position down under br br among the crew and hopeful emigrants sharing his passage are tempestuous bullying captain jared harris politically radical philosopher sam neill canny 1st lieutenant who worked his way up from the bottom jamie sives and fleetingly the first brush of love in the form of beautiful young woman joanne page whose ship literally passes in the night br br quite aside from the astonishing degree of physical historic accuracy director david attwood and screenwriters tony basgallop and leigh jackson have canny eye and ear for the manners and stiff etiquette of an earlier time crafting totally convincing microcosm of the napoleonic era br br shipboard life is one brutal monotonous round of seasickness squalor and danger after another and as edmund becomes entangled in the loves hopes and miseries of his fellow passengers he experiences delirious whirl of life hardships man inhumanities and his noblest sentiments br br those who enjoyed master and commander the far side of the world or patrick brian series of novels on which it was based will love this â for everyone else it a whole new world to discover ',
 ' after many many years saw again this beautiful love story thinking about how would half century after react to film which made so many girls cry and sigh at that time when was just an male adolescent trying to understand women behaviors in small city in brazil br br this time however what caught my attention in the film was something very different namely the insistence with which the physician dr han suyin jennifer jones makes clear to the journalist mark elliott william holden her special ethically condition as an eurasian in fact she is constantly putting emphasis on this point in their relationship repeating she is willing to assume her love for him and carry it on in occidental way provided that by doing so she is not betraying her chinese side its seems to the spectator that suyin is eagerly making efforts to establish very subtle conciliation between those two unstable and opposite aspects of her culture for they will immediately engage in overt conflict in her mind at minimum failure in her attempts to control them br br therefore suyin attitudes always leave poor elliott â determined brave and extremely practical man â anxious and perplexed without knowing how much importance to give to her words for him whose love for her is plain and simple the situation is totally clear if we love each other let us make couple and begin immediately life together not so fast is what she seems verbally and non verbally to answer him all the time br br in fact suyin chinese portion would never allow her such level of pragmatism and as she goes on and on reinforcing this much aimed equilibrium between those two worlds inside herself she also frequently signals to him that also very peculiar trait of chinese culture is deeply rooted in her mind namely the constant raids on the real world by invisible beings from an spiritual or non physical world for suyin is always alerting elliott about how dangerous is life not because of any objective and concrete threat as would be the perpetuation of the english colonialism or the eminence of japanese invasion but due to the threats of plenty of cruel and harmful gods and other mystical and mythical beings over the poor fearful and vulnerable human beings br br in fact it looks like whole bunch of chinese deities are permanently on the watch to make people life totally miserable because of that mothers must dress their precious male babies in girls clothes so that they are not taken away by jealous gods everyone should always be ready to make loud noises to send the clouds away in order to avoid their covering the sight of the moon peasants are advised that they should shout loudly the rice is bad the rice is bad to protect their crops from being stolen by deities and in funeral it is recommended that the dead family be isolated from the other people by curtains so that the gods don take advantage of their sorrow and fragility br br in other words suyin introduces us to culture in which the supernatural has real existence as if rather disturbing pantheon of malign and sadistic gods are always on the verge of negatively interfering with the most banal acts in anyone daily life br br as the story takes place in hong kong in 1949 it should be clear that china really was at that time almost semi feudal society while the country from which elliott had come from was not yet dominated by the fierce capitalism that launched by the usa after the first oil shock in 1973 took charge of the whole world therefore at least in one aspect both sides of suyin eurasian personality were still much more innocent than they would be today br br lot of history came into being since those old days as to china the main fact is that after several phases of communist regime the country finally reached in the last two decades the condition of very aggressive economy much more properly described as state capitalism and what happened to that old spirituality that so much enthralled suyin in hong kong in 1949 and with which she used to impress so much an impassioned elliott under that tree on the hill behind the hospital it is gone completely gone in brief if that story took place today elliott would not find it necessary to go to china to propose to suyin in the presence of the third uncle and her entire family in fact both men would now be incomparably closer to one another in their huge pragmatism talking business as usual ',

 ' in nordestina village in the middle of nowhere in pernambuco antã nio gustavo falcã is the youngest son of his mother who had uninterruptedly cried for five years when he is young man he falls in love for karina mariana ximenes seventeen years old teenager that dreams to see the world and becomes an actress antã nio promises karina to bring the world to nordestina and once in rio de janeiro he participates of sensationalist television show and promises to travel to the fifty years ahead in the future or die for love with deadly machine he had invented fifty years later antã nio paulo autran tries to fix what was wrong in his travel br br mã quina is one of the best brazilian movies have recently seen the refreshing and original story is poetic and magic fable of love that will certainly thrill the most skeptical and tough viewer in unique romance the direction is excellent the screenplay is awesome the cinematography and colors are magnificent the cast leaded by gustavo falcã the icon paulo autran and mariana ximenes is fantastic with marvelous lines the soundtrack has some beautiful brazilian songs highlighting geraldo azevedo and rento rocha dia branco if this movie is distributed overseas please thrust me and rent it or buy the dvd because bet you will love the story that will bring you into tears my vote is nine br br title brazil mã quina â combustã xadvel ã amor the machine â the fuel is love ',
 ' based on the best selling novel the dismissal the missing star the latest film by acclaimed italian director gianni amelio is the story of the growing friendship between an older italian maintenance man and young interpreter he hires in shanghai to be his guide through china vincenzo buonovolonta is the maintenance manager at steel mill in italy that has been shut down and the blast furnace sold to china when vincenzo sergio castellitto discovers that control unit in the furnace is defective and potentially dangerous he travels to china to find the steel mill where the part has been sold in hopes of preventing fatal accident br br the film of course is about the journey not the destination to use familiar clichã and on that journey we are privy to an engaging look at china with all its immense beauty and complexity via the outstanding cinematography by luca bigazzi the film takes us to shanghai wuhan chongquing baotou and trip along the yangstze river showing us coastal areas that are scheduled to be flooded when the three gorges dam is fully operative chinese mega project that has resulted in the displacement of 1 2 million people the trip brings the travelers face to face with poverty overcrowded housing and children left to fend for themselves br br the film revolves around the relationship between vincenzo and translator liu hua tai ling who first meet in italy where his impatience with her translations at dinner meeting causes her to lose her job when he tracks her down in shanghai she is working at library and resistant to vincenzo approach looking at his offer to help him in his travels in china as little more than well paying job she reluctantly agrees to accompany him their relationship however grows as they move from city to city her interpretive skills much in evidence to help the bewildered vincenzo who does not own cell phone br br as they slowly open up to each other they expose each other vulnerability and the film delves into their past and present life and how they arrived at their present situation we meet liu son lin wang at the home of her grandmother in china one child policy he is one of the unwanted children who have been hidden since the father of the boy abandoned the family although the meeting between vincenzo and the boy is casual their relationship becomes central to how the story plays out br br castellitto is an excellent actor though one longs for younger enrico lo verso in this role however he is emotionally distant throughout the film his expression rarely changing from far away hangdog expression though tai ling brings great deal of presence to the role her relationship with the much older vincenzo never seemed real to me and the ending seemed to exist only in reality known as the skateboard god tony hawk director actor jay chandrasekhar super troopers beerfest actor luke wilson miami dolphins star jason taylor and director actor mike judge office space the scenes with hoffman taylor and chandrasekhar are among the funniest in the film as it even funnier to see these men as part of the film br br jackass number two is one of the most politically incorrect morally degrading and just plain wrong movies of all time if not the most despite this it is so original and so hilarious that you won care about that you ll be gasping for air laughing so hard you ll be crying and  ' remember the events of this movie the ill fated cruise of donald crowhurst in 1968 in the golden globe single handed around the world yacht race was 13 year old living in england the previous year francis chichester later sir francis he was knighted for his exploits had completed the first solo circumnavigation of the globe remember it mostly because we were given time off school to watch his return on grainy black and white tv and then his knighting by the queen it provoked huge outpouring of patriotic fervor in the uk it all seems so quaint now chichester became national hero but he had stopped half way in australia to re fit his yacht so the next logical step for yachtsmen was to attempt the journey without stopping br br it important to remember that this was world pre gps when communications on land were still pretty erratic never mind in the middle of the ocean now with gps receivers that fit on key chain and calculate position within metre anywhere on earth it hard to recall time when you could go to sea and quite literally vanish as donald crowhurst did br br number of yachtsmen signed up all men back then including mystery man crowhurst essentially weekend sailor crowhurst had not been spectacular success in any previous enterprise including careers in the british army the air force and as an electronics entrepreneur selling navigation aids he wanted to do something big with his life and he saw the five thousand pound first prize well over 100 000 in today money and the ensuing publicity as means of kick starting his business he signed deal with sponsor that proved more watertight than his boat and which meant failure would bankrupt him and soon found himself popular figure with journalists as he prepared for the race now the brits always love the idea of the gutsy amateur taking on the pros think eddie the eagle losing endless olympic ski jump competitions and the amateur riders who regularly start the grand national horse race the public queued up to see him set off but his boat wasn really ready and even as he started the last competitor to leave the uk crowhurst must have known he didn seriously have chance but too much was riding on him to quit br br in the wonderful archive footage we see doubt written all over his poor wife face left behind with their 4 children she is interviewed movingly throughout the film together with one of crowhurst sons she was in no win situation had she attempted to stop him she would have been considered spoiler but afterward she was riven with doubt as to whether she could have saved his life by stopping him faced with the certain truth that his boat was leaking and would never make it through the southern oceans and unable to turn around and face ridicule bankruptcy and ignominy crowhurst devised plan to cheat laid up offshore argentina and brazil out of radio contact he waited for the leaders to round cape horn and start back up the atlantic thinking he could sneak in at the end of the line and pretend he had sailed all the way around the globe he elaborately falsified his logs and made 16mm films and audio recordings to back up his plan but as one after another the other competitors dropped out he realized that in fact he would come in 2nd and his logs would be scrutinized unable to face certain detection his journal suggests he lost his grip on reality and eventually committed suicide his yacht was found he never was br br this beautifully edited film also follows the journey of bernard moitessier an experienced and enigmatic french sailor who was in second place and certain of the fastest journey prize when he abruptly left the race unable to deal with the clamour and publicity he knew he would face and sailed into the wide blue yonder eventually pulling up some 10 months later in tahiti having spent some seven years working at sea myself albeit on very different ships to these well understand the pull of the ocean standing on deck seeing water in every direction to the horizon knowing there a couple of miles of water below you nothing between you and oblivion but thin metal hull without easy access to tv or radio even nowadays on most working ships you feel pretty isolated it possible to truly escape from the responsibilities of everyday life for while there is some thoughtful analysis of what drives people to attempt this kind of very long lonely journey and the effect it has on the human mind most people would think that attempting to raise 4 children is adventure enough but much is made of the need for self discovery in the hardships at sea the search for self br br strongly suspect that robin knox johnston the ex navy guy who won the race and many since probably knew pretty well who he was before he set off which was why he succeeded not just in winning the race but also retaining his sanity en route those who went searching for something profound within themselves may not have entirely liked what they found br br the marvelous archive footage of britain in the late 60s is almost reason enough to watch this did it really look quite that bad don remember it looking quite so dowdy but perhaps we blot out the worst aspects of the past but overall it is an excellently well made and engrossing movie highly recommended ',

 ' at the height of the celebrity big brother racism row in 2007 involving shilpa shetty and the late jade goody condemned on an internet forum those b fans who praised the show after years of bashing racist 70 sitcoms such as curry chips love thy neighbour thought they were being hypocritical and said so it ain half hot mum was then thrown into the argument with some pointing out it had starred an english actor blacked up well yes but michael bates had lived in india as boy and spoke urdu fluently the show detractors overlook the reality he brought to his performance as bearer rangi ram the noted indian character actor renu setna said in 1995 documentary perry croft the sitcoms that he was upset when he heard bates had landed the role but added no indian actor could have played that role as well as bates indeed br br mum was perry and croft companion show to dad army also set in wartime the sedate english town of walmington on sea had been replaced by the hot steamy jungles of india in particularly place called deolali where an army concert party puts on shows for the troops among them bombadier solomons george layton his first sitcom role since doctor in charge camp gunner gloria beaumont melvyn hayes diminutive gunner lofty sugden lah de dah gunner graham john clegg and gunner parkins the late christopher mitchell presiding over this gang of misfits was the bellicose sergeant major williams the brilliant windsor davies who regarded them all as poofs his frustration at not being able to lead his men up the jungle to engage the enemy in combat made him bitter and bullying though he was nice to parkins whom he thought was his illegitimate son then there was ever so english colonel reynolds donald hewlett and dimwitted captain ashwood michael knowles rangi was detractors ignore shafeek also provided what was described on the credits as vocal interruptions similar to the 40 songs used as incidental music on dad army each edition closed with him warbling land of hope glory only to be silenced by shut up from williams the excellent opening theme was penned by jimmy perry and derek taverner br br though never quite equalling dad army in the public affections mum nevertheless was popular enough to run for total of eight seasons in 1975 davies and estelle topped the charts with cover version of that old chestnut whispering grass they then recorded an entire album of old chestnuts entitled what else sing lofty br br the show hit crisis point three years later when bates died of cancer rather than recast the role of rangi the writers just let him be quietly forgotten when george layton left the character of gloria took his place as bombadier providing another source of comedy br br the last edition in 1981 saw the soldiers leave india by boat for blighty the char wallah watching them go with great sadness as did viewers br br repeats have been few and far between mainly on k gold all because of its so called dodgy reputation this is strange for one thing the show was not specifically about racism if white man blacked up is so wrong why does david lean 1984 film passage to india still get shown on television it featured alec guinness as an indian and won two oscars it was derived from jimmy perry own experiences some characters were based on real people the sergeant major really did refer to his men as poofs take the view that if you are going to put history on television get it right sanitizing the past no matter how unsavoury it might seem to modern audiences is fundamentally dishonest mum was both funny and truthful and viewers saw this thank heavens for v s say time to stop this review as williams would say ll have no gossiping in this jungle ',
 ' mukhsin is beautiful movie about first love story everyone probably has one and this is writer director yasmin ahmad story of hers with boy called mukhsin we know that her movies have been semi autobiographical of sorts having scenes drawn upon her personal experiences and it is indeed this sharing and translating of these emotions to the big screen that has her films always exude warm sincerity and honesty mukhsin is no different and probably the most polished ad confident work to date though must add as personal bias that sepet still has special place in my heart br br our favourite family is back pak atan mak inom orked and kak yam though this time we go back to when orked is age 10 the characters are all younger from the movies we ve journeyed with them from rabun to gubra and here sharifah amani sisters sharifah aryana and sharifah aleya take on the roles of orked and mak inom respectively which perhaps accounted for their excellent chemistry together on screen characters and the world that yasmin has introduced us to we come to learn of and understand the family little bit more set in the days when they re still living in their kampung revisited back in rabun where orked attends chinese school and packs some serious combination of punches and you wonder about that burst of energy in gubra well she had it in her since young the perennial tomboy and doted child of the family she prefers playing with the boys in games rather than mindless masak masak with the girls and favourite outings include going with the family to football matches br br the desired to be explored the crossing of that line between friendship and romance both beautiful emotions br br mukhsin does have its cheeky moments which liven up the story and bring about laughter because some of the incidents we would have experienced it ourselves and sometimes serve as throwback to our own recollection of childhood in short those scenes screamed fun we observe the life in typical kampung where some neighbours are very nice while others the nosy parkers and rumour mongers spreading ill gossip stemming from envy there are 2 additional family dynamics seen one from an immediate neighbour and the other from mukhsin own both of which serve as adequate subplots and contrast to orked own br br as always yasmin movies are filled with excellent music and for mukhsin it has something special the song hujan as penned by her father as well as ne me quitte pas aptly used in the movie given that the yasmin movies to date have been centred around the same characters the beauty of it is that you can watch them as stand alone or when watched and pieced together makes compelling family drama dealing with separate themes and universal issues like interracial romance love and forgiveness fans will definitely see the many links in mukhsin back to the earlier movies while new audiences will surely be curious to find out certain whys and significance of recurring characters or events like that pudgy boy who steals glances at orked br br and speaking of whys parts of mukhsin too is curiously open which probably is distinctive of yasmin style or deliberately left as such thought that as story about childhood recollected from memory then there are details which will be left out for sure and subtly felt that mukhsin exhibited this perfectly with not so detailed details and the focus on what can be remembered in significant episodes between the two br br another highly recommended movie and rare one that feel is suitable for all ages bring along your kid brother or sister ',

 ' the film chaos takes its name from gleick 1988 pop science explanation of chaos theory what does the book or anything related to the content of the book have to do with the plot of the movie chaos nothing the film makers seem to have skimmed the book obviously without understanding thing about it looking for theme to united the series of mundane action sequences that overlie the flimsy string of events that acts in place of plot in the film in this respect the movie choas resembles the canadian effort cube in which prime numbers function as device to mystify the audience so that the ridiculousness of the plot will not be noticed in cube bunch of prime numbers are tossed in so that viewers will attribute their lack of understanding to lack of knowledge about primes the same approach is taken in chaos disconnected extracts from gleick books are thrown in make the doings of the bad guy in the film seem fiendishly clever this of course is an insultingly condescending treatment of the audience and any literate viewer of chaos who can stand to sit through the entire film will end up bewildered how could film so bad be made rewritten as novel the story in chaos would probably not even make it past literary agent secretary desk how could at least hundreds of thousands and probably millions of dollars have been thrown away on what can only be considered waste of time for everyone except those who took home money from the film regarding what in the movie every performance is phoned in save for technical glitches it would be astonishing if more than one take succeeded in discarding the good parts of the first films the human protagonists and stealing the rest from other recent sci fi films br br there is not one original use of the either the alien or pred characters the pred actually has little trouble killing aliens by the dozen even though the last movie led us to believe that pred revered the aliens as such deadly foe that they used the killing of one as rite of passage the alienpred is never really developed as fearsome creature its ability to inject parasites into host is ripped from several different movies most recently probably was hellboy where samiel dismembered tongue injected eggs into hellboy or doom where the mutated creatures would leave their tongues behind after they speared victim throat br br simply put we aren given reason to care about anything in this movie there is violence but it doesn shock or surprise and is nothing that hasn been seen in any of hundred slasher flicks the cg is ok and both species of alien are made to look and move as they have in movies past but since the characters are never developed and the acting is so bad we kind of hope that they all die the little girl was probably the best resident evil 2 has nuke aim gunnison way to wipe out the infection and not before yet another stupid scene that is supposed to open the door for further sequels but does it in movie filled with bad scenes the worst may have been saved for last br br sorry for the repetition but everything bears repeating bad script no plot unoriginal action scenes uninspired direction abysmal acting decent x that were wasted because of the many flaws br br don mind going to an indie film and being disappointed the actors and directors and crew are probably getting their careers going and working on  ' in this day and age in which just about every other news story involves discussions of waterboarding images of abu ghraib or tales of forced detentions at guantanamo bay gavin hood rendition is about as up to the minute and timely movie as is ever likely to come out of the entertainment mills of mainstream hollywood it not by any stretch of the imagination perfect film but neither does it merit the caterwauling opprobrium it has received at the hands of critics from all across the ideological and political spectrum br br the term rendition refers to the ability of the cia to arrest any individuals it suspects of terrorist dealings then to whisk them away in secret to foreign country to interrogate and torture them for an indefinite period of time all without due process of law anwar el ibrahimi is an egyptian man who has been living for twenty years in the united states he has an american wife young son and new baby on the way he seems very unlikely candidate for terrorist yet one day without warning or explanation anwar is seized and taken to an undisclosed location where he is subjected to brutal torture until he admits his involvement with terrorist organization that anwar claims to know nothing about br br on the negative side rendition falters occasionally in its storytelling abilities often biting off little more than it can chew in terms of both plot and character the ostensible focal point is douglas freeman rookie cia agent who is brought in to observe anwar interrogation at the hands of egyptian officials the problem is that as conceived by writer kelley sane and enacted by jake gyllenhaal freeman seems too much of naã ve boy scout to make for very plausible agent and he isn given the screen time he needs to develop fully as character we know little about him at the beginning and even less it seems at the end he goes through the motions but we learn precious little about the man within thus without strong center of gravity to hold it all together the film occasionally feels as if it is coming apart at the seams with story elements flying off in all directions similar problem occurs with anwar distraught wife played by reese witherspoon woman we never get to know much about apart from what we can see on the surface gyllenhaal and witherspoon have both proved themselves to be fine actors under other circumstances but here they are hemmed in by restrictive screenplay that rarely lets them go beyond single recurring note in their performances br br what makes rendition an ultimately powerful film however is the extreme seriousness of the subject matter and the way in which two concurrently running plot lines elegantly dovetail into one another in the movie closing stretches it may make for slightly more contrived story than perhaps we might have liked on this subject but hey this is hollywood after all and the film has to pay some deference to mass audience expectations if it is to get itself green lighted let alone see the light of day as completed project br br two of the supporting performances are particularly compelling in the film omar metwally who makes palpable the terror of man caught in real life kafkaesque nightmare from which he cannot awaken and yigal naor who makes surprisingly complex character out of the chief interrogator torturer meryl streep alan arkin and peter sarsgaard also make their marks in smaller roles special mention should also be made of the warm and richly hued cinematography of dion beebe br br does the movie oversimplify the issues probably does it stack the deck in favor of the torture victim and against the evil government forces most definitely one wonders how the movie would have played if anwar really were terrorist yet the movie has the guts to tread on controversial ground it isn afraid to raise dicey questions or risk the disapproval of some for the political stances it takes it openly ponders the issue of just how does nation hold fast to its hard won principle of civil liberties for all in the face of terrorism and fear and just how much courage does it take for people of good will to finally stand up and say enough is enough even at the risk of being branded terrorist appeasing and unpatriotic by those in power the movie also does not in any way deny the reality of extreme islamic terrorism br br thus to reject rendition out of hand would be to allow the perfect to be the enemy of the good rendition may not be perfect but it is good and it has something of importance to say about the world in which we now live and that alone makes it very much worth seeing ',

superficial impersonation of lucy wanted to know more about the real woman behind the clown and rachel certainly gave us that in great depth also didn want to see someone simply doing classic lucy routines therefore was very pleased with the decision by the producers and director to have rachel portray lucy in rehearsal for the most memorable of these skits vitameatavegamin and the candy factory it seems that some of the reviewers didn realize that these two scenes were meant to be rehearsal sequences and not the actual skits this approach thought gave an innovative twist to sketches that so many of us know by heart also thought rachel was terrifically fresh and funny in these scenes and she absolutely nailed the routines that were recreated the professor and the grape stomping in particular there was one moment in the grape scene where the corner of rachel mouth had the exact little upturn that remember lucy having couldn believe she was able to capture that and so naturally tv would not have any idea what lucy was really like in her early movie years think rachel showed natural progression in the character that was brilliant she planted all the right seeds for us to see the clown just waiting to emerge given the right set of circumstances lucy didn fit the mold of the old studio system in her frustrated attempts to become the stereotypical movie star of that era she  ' this has been edited for space br br chan wook park new film is complex film that is not easy to classify nominally horror movie the central character is vampire the film actually has elements of comedy theology melodrama cultural invasion and its analog of viral invasion of body romance and few other things as well it a film that has almost too much on its mind the film takes its own matters and mixes them with classic european literature in this case emile zola thã rã se raquin it an odd mix that doesn always gel but none the less has an incredible power here it is almost 24 hours since saw the film at lincoln center with post film discussion by the director and find my cage is increasingly rattled its not so much what happens is bothersome its more that its wide reaching story and its themes ring lot of bells in retrospect br br the plot of the film has will loved priest deciding that the best way to help mankind is to volunteer for medical experiment to find cure for terrible disease infected with the disease he eventually succumbs and dies but because of transfusion of vampiric blood its not explained he actually survives hailed as miracle worker the priest returns to the hospital where he had been ministering to the sick unfortunately all is not well the priest finds that he needs blood to survive he also finds that he has all of the typical problems of vampire and its no not possible for him to go out during the day things become even more complicated when he becomes reacquainted with childhood friend and his family the priest some of his animal passions awakened becomes taken with the wife of his friend from there it all goes sideways br br an ever changing film this is story that spins through variety of genres as it tells the very human story of man who finds that his life has been radically altered by chance event and finds that he is no longer who he thought he was it a film that you have to stay with to the end because the film is forever evolving into something else its also film that has great deal on its mind and the themes its playing with are constantly being explored in variety of ways br br the film has enough going on that one could and people probably will write books discussing the film br br the two of the strongest parts of the film are its vampiric elements and its romance the vampire part of the tale is brilliant there is something about how it lays out the ground rules and the nature of the affliction that makes such perfect sense that it kind of pushes the old vampire ideas aside sitting in the theater last night found myself amazed at how impressed how well it worked think the fact that it played more or less straight is what is so earth shaking here is vampire who just wants to have normal life it contrasted with what happens later it makes clear that living an existence of hunting humans really isn going to work its not the dark world of twilight or lost boys rather its something else personally think that the film changes the playing field from hip cool idea or dream into something more real and tangible the sequence where the powers kick in is just way cool the romance is also wonderfully handled sure the sex scenes are steamy and well done but it the other stuff the looks the talk the gestures outside of the sex that makes this special love the looks the quiet stares as the forbidden couple look at each other hungering for each other and unable to act the disappointment and heartbreak of betrayal both real and suspected and the mad passion of possible consummation this is one of the great screen romances of all time it perfectly captures the feeling and emotion of deep passionate love and lust if you ve ever loved deeply m guessing you ll find some part of your hear on screen know did the statement just wanted to spend eternity with you has sad poignancy to it it both statement of what was the intention as well as the depth of emotion the tragic romance will break your heart br br won lie to you and say that the film is perfect and great its not as good as the pieces are and almost all of them are great especially the actors who have unjustly failed to hail as amazing the whole doesn always come together the various genres thematic elements and tones occasionally grate against each other frequently was wondering where the film was going hung in there even though the film seemed to be wandering about aimlessly br br liked the film great deal loved the pieces more than the film as whole its been pinging around in my head since saw it and m guessing that it will do so for several days more like or love is irrelevant since this is film that really should be seen since it has so much going on that it will provide you with enough material to think and talk about for days afterward one of the meatiest and most filling films of the year ',

 ' in theory films should be form of entertainment while this excludes documentaries and other experimental forms of film making most movies specially genre films must not only tell it story or message they must entertain their target audience in some way all this just to say that in my opinion bad movie is not movie with low production values or low budget bad movie is one that is boring br br hellborn or asylum of the damned as is known in the s is bad movie simply because it is just not involving and irremediably boring and tiresome while it has very good premise it is just poorly developed and the mediocre acting doesn make things better on another hands the film probably could had been fine or even classic movie but here it is just bad attempt at film making br br director philip jones tells the tale of james bishop matt stasi young psychiatry resident who just got his dream job at st andrew mental hospital but the old asylum seems to hide secret after the mysterious death of some patients and the constant rumors of satanic practices james decides to find out what is going on only to find the incredulity of his boss dr mccort bruce payne who believes that bishop is going as insane as his patients br br while the premise is quite interesting the execution of the film leaves lot to be desired in an attempt of making supernatural psychological thriller jones goes for the easy way out and makes movie filled with every clichã of the genre of course there are lots of great movies that are also filled with clichã but in hellborn every single one is wasted and turned into cheap jump scare to keep things moving resulting in boring and predictable storyline br br the acting is quite mediocre for the most part with one big exception bruce payne gives top notch performance that makes the movie look unworthy of such good acting matt stasi is very weak as the lead character and the rest of the cast make forgettable performances br br despite all this flaws one thing has to be written about hellborn it has visual look very good for the budget and very similar to modern day big budget hollywod horror productions also the make up and prosthetics are done very nicely and the designs for the main antagonist are quite good sadly the rest of the special effects are awful and outdated making huge contrast with the make up prosthetics br br hellborn is movie with few good things outnumbered by its serious flaws with terrible results hardcore horror or movie fans may be interested by its premise but it is boring and tiresome experience 3 10 ',

 ' amicus made close to good half dozen of these horror anthologies in the 70 and this from leading horror scribe robert bloch is one of their best efforts there are four stories all worthwhile but two sweets for the sweet and method for murder distinguish themselves as highly effective journeys into fear br br in sweets christopher lee plays an impatient widower whose lovely daughter chloe franks becomes resentful of his neglect and brutish intolerance so she sculpts voodoo doll with which she expresses her distaste for his methods franks is beautiful figure of mischievous evil and delivers one of the greatest child performances in horror film since martin stephens in the innocents this installment is directed with great subtlety and the final outrage occurring off screen is moment of purest horror br br method of murder is about horror novelist denholm elliott who is menaced by one of his own creations the creepy dominic this episode is striking for its simplicity and stark terror dominic may or may not be real so director peter duffell has great time playing with our expectations the brief shots of dominic reflected in pond or seen as fleeting phantasm in meadow are truly haunting br br the original poster art featuring skeletal figure clasping tray holding peter cushing severed head was rich enticement for punters fixed on fear ',

 ' prison is not often brought up during conversations about the best eighties horror films and there a good reason for that because it not one of the best but as you delve past the classic films that the decade had to offer this is certainly among the best of the lesser known smaller films the film does have some connection to blockbusters for start it an early directorial effort for renny harlin the capable director behind number of action films including die hard 2 cliffhanger and deep blue sea and secondly we have an early role for lord of the rings star viggo mortensen the film is not exactly original but the plot line is interesting we focus on prison that has been reopened after number of years this was the prison where man named charles forsyth was sent to the electric chair after being framed by the prison governor naturally the spirit of the dead man is not resting in peace and when the old execution room is reopened the spirit of the dead convict escapes for vengeance br br the film is not exactly the shawshank redemption but it does take care to build up its various characters and while the main point of the film is always the horror the prison drama behind it all does make for an interesting base this is good job too because other than the basic premise the film doesn really have plot to go from and we solely rely on the interaction between the characters to keep things interesting the horror featured in the film is at times grotesque but it never over the top which might actually be the reason why this film is seldom remembered being released in decade of excess the murders themselves are rather good and imaginative however and provide some major highlights as the film goes on we start to delve more into the back story of the vengeful convict ghost and while it fairly interesting some things about it don make sense and it drags the film down little still everything boils down to an exciting climax and overall have to say that prison is film well worth tracking down ',

 ' de palma technique had hit its high maturity by the time of this film which is wonderful showcase of his classic techniques though unfortunately as with many of the films written by de palma himself the story serves the meta more than the interests of putting forth an emotionally compelling tale br br the story opens with crazy scene in which angie dickinson masturbates in shower while she looks at her husband she is then grabbed and raped while he husband stands obliviously nearâ and the whole thing is revealed to be angie fantasy as he husband is pumping mindlessly away at her in bed she has short scene with her son dead ringer for harry potter which concludes with joke that she ll tell grandma that he is playing with his peter she then goes to her therapy session where she complains about her dead marriage before attempting to seduce her therapist michael caine he refuses and she is hurt and feeling unattractive and unfulfilled br br then begins bravura 22 minute nearly wordless sequence that is perhaps the highlight of the film among the many things de palma gleaned from hitchcock is the understanding of film as purely visual medium of telling storiesâ and in typical de palma fashion he turns this into way to show off his formidable skill the problem for me is that in this instance one begins to feel that scenes are being needlessly protracted simply to further show off the director skill br br the sequence begins with angie at an art museum she watches strangers all involved in sexual or family activities then begins to get turned on to man sitting next to her de palma very skillfully tells an extremely complicated narrative without single word about angie attraction embarrassment retreating and finally finding and submitting to the stranger in the back of taxi cab all set to wonderfully lush score by pino donaggio who also scored carrie br br in the second part of the sequence angie has slept with the guy and gets up to return to her husband again de palma crams ton of narrative in without word of dialogue uttered as angie realizes that she doesn have her panties that her husband is already home and no doubt wondering where she is that she has probably contracted venereal disease and that she has lost her engagement ring somewhere in the shuffle it all very admirable but one begins to feel little strung along as we are forced to do things like take long elevator ride down from the seventh floor then up again almost in real time br br spoilers from here on out when angie reaches the seventh floor again she is killed by big woman with blond hair the woman hacks away at her until she reaches the ground floor when the door opens and nancy allen sees her there there is wonderful slow motion sequence as nancy reaches into the elevator angie reaches up toward her and the killer blade is held poised to slash nancy hands then follow some electrifying shots as nancy looks up and sees the killer in the elevators convex mirror it all good and by the time we have some dialogue again you think woah that was just 22 straight minutes of purely visual narrative or maybe you don but do br br younger dennis franz has great part as sleazy and tough new york detective who would rather that everyone else do his work for him he interviews michael caine making the outrageous implication though it passes as commonplace that angie wanted to be killed angie son is there as well and he hooks up with nancy and they set about to spy on caine therapist and find out who the killer is br br once again there is strong tie to hitchcock film in this case psycho just as obsession is re working of vertigo you have woman who we are supposed to understand is secretly slut who gets killed in the first 30 minutes in an enclosed space in this case an elevator rather than shower then the relatives of the deceased conduct an investigation which reveals that the killer is man who dresses as woman to kill de palma even throws in doctor at the end who explains the psychology of the whole thing br br it is very interesting but at the same time viewer can begin to feel bit jerked around and that is my primary reservation about this film it is definitely essential viewing and showcases some of de palma greatest setpieces but that feeling that the story is running solid third behind the need for de palma to show off and his somewhat unseemly sexual fantasies makes it hard to look back on this one with whole hearted affection br br check out other reviews on my website of bad and cheesy movies cinema de merde cinemademerde com ',
 ' just got around to seeing monster man yesterday it had been long wait and after lots of anticipation and build up m glad to say that it came through and met my expectations on every level true you the whole thing scream late 80s and loved the exaggerated colors it obvious that monster man was done on relatively low budget but much like cabin fever sorry keep comparing the two it actually works theatrical release because this is everything that jeepers creepers should have been thank god for lions gate ',
