 ' film like crossfire puts another film that spreads around its social consciousness e the recent film crash almost to shame not necessarily because either one puts forth its message of intolerance is rotten more significantly although d wager crash throws the hammer down much more thickly in comparison with this but because of how the storytelling and contrivances never get much in the way like with crash maybe it not really necessary to compare the two as crossfire is in its core all deep into the film noir vein like its going out of style it was interesting actually to see what the director edward dmytryk said on the dvd interview where he mentioned that the budget for the photography was significantly lower on purpose so that more could be spent on the actors and the schedule went through at very brisk quick pace but then what comes off then as being incredible about the picture is that you would think looking at many of the lighting set ups that it took lot to do just for small scene like when robert mitchum keeely first goes in for questioning under the captain robert young the contrasts of shadows seamlessly in the room is exquisite that there are many other lighting set ups that go even further with so little marks this as something essential in the realm of just the look of the noir period just take look at shot of characters on stairwell the bars silhouetted against them and see what mean br br but back to the substance part of the film it really story that consists of murder mystery but one that we as the audience don take long to figure on the answer it calculated risk with this then that characters could be too thin just to prop up the worthwhile message against anti semitism but dmytryk direction of his top shelf cast along with really terrific script by john paxton fleshes out the characters least of which for what they should have to not seem too thin alongside the message and what would noir be then without some attitude to go along with dialog it may already be there in the lines but he helps make the character with good edge for his scenes br br then there also robert ryan who excels at montgomery as man who you know you don like much at first just through his s demeanor but you re not totally sure about either then once it starts to come clearer ironically through subjective view point of the suspect mitchell george cooper at the apartment of the soon to be deceased samuels his performance becomes great balancing act of being full of crap and also rather frightening in his blind way it a good performance when also countered with cooper who has actual personal issues that he faces and comes forward with regret and humility it really after the film ends that one thinks about lot of this however and while you re watching the film it more about getting into the dialog and the flow of the scenes and in the sometimes stark overpowering camera moves on the actors so the message is in way secondary not that it isn an important one especially for the time period coming right off of ww2 but years later its seeing the actors even the ones that don get the big marquee status like gloria grahame as ginny the femme fatale of the picture if it could ve had time for one which it doesn and william phipps as leroy the hick working off one another that sticks much strongly in the compacted screenplay br br dmytryk is also very wise in choosing to limit the musical score is powerful too as for very long stretches we hear nothing and mostly when it does come up it incidental to the character surroundings he could ve just as easily gone with added musical notes on some dramatic scenes for emphasis most specifically the opening audience grabber into the film by sticking clear of that and getting the right attitudes and nuance in camera and cast it uplifts standards in genre material to very fine memorable level my favorite scene would probably go to finley story about an irish immigrant he tells to leroy where all such elements come into place well it might not come in very high at the top of my favorite noirs and d still throw down murder my sweet as the director masterpiece in this kind of picture but it assuredly higher in quality than something of the level too ',
 ' lion king 1 1 2 is very fun and addictive sequel don expect the production values of theatrical release but do expect the highest quality of direct to video release br br it is set up as timon pumba begin watching the original lion king in darkened theater and abruptly switch tracks and begin narrating their own story this is done with frequent comedic interruptions for example during one particular tense moment home shopping commercial pops on and chagrined pumba realizes he has sat on the remote these little moments pepper the movie and whether you find them entertaining or not will greatly depend on your sense of humor if you are particularly bothered by movies that deliberately remind the viewer is watching movie than this may not be your cup of tea br br animation is the best they ve invested in the disney dtv line and is integrated almost seamlessly with the original material the newer independent material uses lot of the artistic style of the original the voice talents are all well performed though couldn help thinking of marge simpson every time heard julie kavner br br many of the jokes in the movie will be well recognized by viewers as recycled over the generations but are presented more with the familiarity of comfortable quirks of old friends than annoyingly repetitive br br the music has made me realize how much enjoyed and miss good musical integrated with disney feature the toe tapping opening feature of dig tunnel is well choreographed and hilarious timon and pumba take on the lion king opening sequence and their introduction to paradise are also amusing the only problem was the reprise of the dig tunnel at the end of the movie switching its lyrics and tune from defeatist to uplifting br br story line is pretty well done and the integration of new plot elements is done almost perfectly though the final bit during the hyena chased stretched the storyline credibility little the new story doesn seem to handle saccharine or emotionally charged moments to well and does better when it is resorting to full comedy br br overall worth purchasing if you like all the bonus features that come with typical 2 disc set then go for it for the penny pincher who still is willing to invest on good flick wait until it drops four or more dollars and go rent it right away br br damion crowley ',

 ' film that is so much 30 warners film in an era when each studio had particular look and style to their output unlike today where simply getting audiences is the object br br curitz was one of the quintessential warners house directors working with tight economy and great efficiency whilst creating quality working methods that were very much the requirements of director at warners studio that was one of the big five majors in this era producing quality films for their large chains of theatres br br even though we have setting of the upper classes on long island there is the generic warners style embedded here with narrative that could have been torn from the headlines another example is the when the photographers comment on the girls legs early in the film and she comments that they re not the trophies gives the film more working mans down to earth feel for these were the audiences that warners were targeting in the great depression ironically columbia and universal were the two minors under these five majors until the 50 when their involvement in television changed their fortunes they would have made something like this very cheaply and without the polish and great talent curtiz has created from an excellent script film that moves along at rapid pace whilst keeping the viewer with great camera angles and swift editing br br thank heavens there is no soppy love interest sub plot so the fun can just keep rolling along ',

my hiney realised that was glad this movie was finally done do not know why so much good actors participated in this narrow minded stereotyping propaganda movie but pity them this represents country cares ',

 ' ghillie remake of the telugu okkadu is thankfully clarified version of the original it packs the same punch and dharani true to his cinematic brilliance delivers it with style and panache flagging vijay career with the entry of the likes of surya and vikram on the fray got the much needed uplift with this movie this might well prove to be the best movie vijay has ever been on considering the choices he has been making since then the hard working actor seems to have lost his bearing what with talented new entrants being accepted both by the industry and public alike br br the tightly snug script which runs at neck break speed revolves around velu willful youngster aspiring to make mark in the game of kabaddi popular game among boys in india the events following the chance encounter with muthupandi his rescue of the girl in distress and how he juggles with the aspirations of his friends and his own forms the fulcrum and end of the movie vijay fits as t into the role and essays subdued and believable portrayal of the boy next door br br trisha has more than stereotyped tamil heroine mantle to play the role is far more complex than just girl in trouble with limited dialog trisha exploits her occasional muted expressions and subtle vulnerability to add color to the role this is classic case of cover page girl coming of age to become professional actress trisha became my personal favorite after this movie br br the movie ends on predictable lines although one has to credit the director for keeping the audience guessing on many things including trisha change in decision to leave the country prakash raj deserves word of praise for providing the perfect counter weight for vijay role his almost indomitable stature in the role of villain and the apparent chinks in the hero armor form perfect ploy for keeping the audience guessing br br overall this is great movie that deserves at least single viewing give it clear 8 out of 10 ',

 ' at risk of sounding slightly sacrilegious on first viewing m kind of inclined to put this right up on par with shaun of the dead now given view simon pegg as an unquestionable comedy genius realise this is rather big claim and to what extent you agree with that last statement may be good preliminary gauge of whether fido will appeal to you br br in way the comedy picks up where shaun left off except we re back in the original 1950s living dead era stereotypical middle american small town the zombie wars are over and zombies themselves are becoming more well adjusted useful members of the community this so we re informed at the outset is largely thanks to the scientific advances made by the good people at zomcom nice play on romantic comedy perhaps br br the beauty of the film lies in its dead pan depiction of respectable neighbourhood maintaining core values while making place for zombies and the special hazards they pose the charm and balance with which it does this is near enough perfect themes you might expect from more mainstream kitsch comedy come through the veneer of good clean living keeping up appearances repressed emotion muddled parental values social decorum and the plight of the alienated individual br br it a story told with happy heart and wide appeal that is brought to life vividly by the film all round strong cast it one of those works where it really shows through that everyone involved got kick out of taking part it also fun imagining what billy connelly learning his script must have been like br br so in conclusion it is probable you will appreciate the humour of this film unless your father tried to eat you ',

don always take you where you expect to go there are twists and turns that add depth to this film of course there is plenty of outright comedy but there is much subtle humor here as well br br there john ventimiglia who imbues his character with lovable child like quality no matter what he does you just gotta love louie br br both these actors are excellent in their individual characters with imperioli you ll want to hug him and bring him home to mom ventimiglia well you won know whether you should slap him or bring him home and not to mom br br there are other stand out performances as well the character of rita is played by drena deniro yes robert daughter the audience adored her in talking with the others who saw the film it was fun to discuss whether it was albert or louie who was their favorite of those two but everyone loved rita br br is this film perfect no can say that it is there were many times wished the director had had bigger budget to work with there were some scenes that cried out for more budgetary freedom give this guy decent budget to work with and believe you are going to see film that will make you stand up and notice br br the ending sequence was bit of victim of budget yet budget or no budget the ending screen shot in my opinion brought together the talent of actor and director into memorable emotionally effective scene br br ',
 ' but had to see just how bad it could get the plotline was thin to begin with but it just kept getting worse female genetic engineering grad student uses her research on accelerated mitosis to artificially create male because biological weapon used in ww3 killed off 97 of the worldwide male population the surviving men are either high prices gigolos in back alley clubs or crazed lunatics in criminals because they are dangerous beasts that cannot help there genetic predisposition to violence the propaganda machines have been in full swing scaring women into believing all men are rapists and murderers this has led to lesbianism being the norm the fall of christianity female only reproduction via cloning and oh yeah world peace among other implied results all of which seem unlikely given that only 30 years had elapsed since the war adam stumbles from one bad situation to the next all the while being genetically programmed to be non violent and unable to really do much on his own the first person through nel eyes and we always were privy to her thoughts that totally unique touch was completely lost in the new version they also tried to make nel much more of heroine the original nel was not bad person but she was bitter person could she be otherwise after sacrificing 11 years of her life to selfish old woman and spiteful sister and she liked to moan and she lost her temper this one was almost too good to be true this was never more apparent than in the climax of the movie where the writer had obviously been watching ghost one too many times br br 7 they changed the history of the house and it occupents too much there was no abigail crain the daughter of hugh whose legend loomed large in the original versions there was no companion and there was no nursery there was also no grace wife of the original doctor and hugh crain wives died in totally different ways these changes changed the story way too much don know whether the producers of this movie should  ' as fan of wm faulkner since college was especially pleased to see intruder in the dust and for other reasons my grandfather also named clarence brown as was the director grew up in the oxford area having been born near there in 1888 we attended week long family reunion at oxford in july 1964 mere 15 years after filming the movie it still looked mostly like it does in the film but was going thru period of civil rights upheaval then as the site of ole miss my recollection is of its being nice little college town that summer but was just an 18 year old college sophomore and white was just then beginning to see the injustice of segregation and prejudice but still had long way to go anyhow the movie is well worth watching but the filmmakers must have had to walk tight rope to get it done there and would love to know more about that story br br now days oxford is larger more modern college town with all the ills that go along with such things and hope to return again to see how it must have changed socially in the last 40 plus years juano hernandez should certainly have been nominated for an oscar that year but hollywood was still to bigoted itself to let that happen other faulkner stories have been filmed so look for them and compare one of the best was pbs treatment of the barn burner from about 1985 or so starring tommy lee jones it really captured the intensity of rural southern whites that faulkner wrote so incisively about so often ',

 ' some unsuspecting films carry message that resonates in the hours and days after viewing such is the case for carol journey el viaje de carol beautifully crafted 2002 film from spain based on the novel boca de noche by ã x81ngel garcã xada roldã who also adapted the book as screenplay war and its consequences are not new subject matter for films but when that war theme plays in the background as subtle driving force to develop characters especially children who must face adult life influenced by the games of adults the result is different and more tender examination of the coming of age film genre br br carol clara lago is 12 year old spanish american youngster from new york who with her critically ill mother aurora marã xada barranco returns to her aurora home in 1938 at the height of the spanish civil war home that has been left deserted by her father don amalio ã x81lvaro de luna since his wife death carol father robert ben temple is fighter pilot who has sided with the republicans against franco and is rarely with his family aurora has past she left her lover alfonso alberto jimã nez to marry robert and alfonso in turn married aurora cold sister dolores lucina gil carol is an independent girl who remains aloof to all but her grandfather don amalio until she meets others her age but not of her class tomiche juan josã ballesta and his two friends at first resent carol but as events develop carol and tomiche are bonded by what feels like the first awakenings of love when aurora dies of her illness carol must live with alfonso and dolores and their daughter blanca luna mcgill yet turns to her grandfather for support and to her mother best friend and teacher maruja the always radiant rosa maria sardã xa0 to understand the disparity between classes and the senseless war that keeps her beloved father from her side through series of incidents carol and tomiche learn the rigors of becoming adults facing more traumas in brief period of the war than most of us experience in lifetime the ending though sad is uplifting as carol journey to maturity is complete br br the film is shot in galicia and portugal and contains some extraordinarily beautiful settings captured with gentle sensitive lighting by cinematographer gonzalo berridi and enhanced by the musical score by bingen mendizã bal director imanol uribe understands the fine line separating pathos from bathos and in electing to concentrate the story on the children involved he makes an even stronger statement about the futility and cruelty of war the cast is exceptional the stars clearly are young clara lago and juan josã ballesta but they are supported by the fine veteran actors in the adult roles this is visually stunning work with lasting message and should find much larger audience than it has to this date grady harp ',
 ' the most important thing about this movie is the brilliant performance by daniel day lewis and hugh conor as christy brown guineas artist and fighter who despite of her physical condition overcame all the odds as person who did work with patients with cerebral palsy can assure you that their performance were shockingly convincing the enormous support that christy got form his family low income working class dubliners encouraged him to do the impossible and this picture depicted this support brilliantly have not read the book but the dialogs were written wisely to capture christy brown witty arrogant personality do recommend this movie to everyone especially to classic movie lovers ',

jules tells vincent that the only thing she did worthwhile was pilot vincent asks what the hell is pilot and jules goes into very well description of what tv pilot is well the way they make shows is they make one show that show called pilot then they show that show to the people who make shows and on the strength of that one show they decide if they re going to make more shows some pilots get picked and become television programs some don become nothing she starred in one of the ones that became nothing now to stretch on what jules was talking about there are billions of television shows  ' in his first go as hollywood director henry brommell whips an enthralling yarn that is all of penetrating relatable marital issues with melancholic authenticity and lacing such with an equally absorbing subplot of father son hit man business the film is directed astutely and consists of wonderfully put together cast as well as swift family conscious screenplay also by brommell that brings life to an otherwise fatigued genre as bonus panic delivers subtle acerbic humorâ an unexpected undeniably charming and very welcome surpriseâ through its bumbling unsure of himself low key star whose ever cool state is enticing especially given his line of work br br the forever great william macy again captures our hearts as alex unhappy torn middle aged husband and father who finds solace in the most dubious of persons young attractive equally messed up 23 year old named sarah neve campbell whom he meets in the waiting room at psychologist office where he awaits the therapy of dr josh parks john ritter to discuss his growing eagerness to quit the family business that his father donald sutherland built alex whose lust to lead new life is obstructed by the fear of disappointing his dictating father strikes an unwise fancy for sarah which ultimately leads him to understand the essence and irrefutable responsibility of being husband to his wife and more importantly to him good father to his six year old son sammy played enthusiastically by the endearing david dorfman br br henry brommell brilliant panic is something of rarity in hollywood seldom seen with the exception of 2002 road to perdition since its conception in 2000â it weaves two conflicting genres organized crime family drama into fascinating warm hunk of movie viewing that is evenly strong in either directionâ and it one that will maintain its exceptional infrequent caliber and gleaming sincerity for ages to come ',
 ' after perusing the large amount of comments on this movie it is clear that there are two kinds of science fiction movie goers there are the ones who are well read extremely literate and intelligent they know the history of the genre and more importantly they know to what heights it can reach in the hands of gifted author for many years science fiction languished in the basement of literature considered my most critic to be little more than stories of ray guns and aliens meant for pre pubescent teenagers today well read fan knows well this history and knows the great authors asimov heinlein bradbury and ellison who helped bring science fiction out of that basement in doing so they created thought provoking intelligent stories that stretched the boundaries and redefined the human condition this well informed fans are critical of anything hollywood throws at them they are not critical for it own sake but look upon each offering with skeptical eye as they should as hollywood record has been less than stellar to these fans the story must take supreme importance they cannot be fooled by flashy computer graphics and non stop action sequences when the emperor has no clothes they scream it the loudest br br the second type of science fiction movie goer has little knowledge about the written aspect of the genre look at many of the above comments that state well haven read the book or anything by this author their total exposure to science fiction is from movies or the scifi channel they are extremely uncritical willing to overlook huge plot holes weak premises and thin story lines if they are given healthy dose of wiz bang action and awesome special effects they are in effect willing to turn off their critical thinking skills or maybe they never had them for the duration of the movie case in point robot while supposedly based on asimov short stories and named after one of his novels it contains little of what asimov wrote and even less of what he tried to tell us about humanity and our robotic creations those of you that will run out and buy robot will be very much surprised this movie isn even based on that story at all br br the film has enormous plot holes that at some points are stretched to the limits of credulity won point them out won spoon feed you you need to practice you thinking skills and discover them for yourself the characters which are named after many of asimov characters do not possess the critical intelligence that was hallmark of his stories the plot itself with all it action sequences goes against everything that the author stood for his belief that humanity possesses the capacity to solve problems using their minds not their fists is vital to understanding his vision of the future in short other than the name their is very little of isaac in anything about this movie there will always be those uncritical e unthinking who will state the movie doesn have to be like the book due to the medium movies sometimes require that changes be made but what about case where the movie never even tried to stay close to the book or books from the start what if all they took from the written work was the title this begs the question why tarnish great body of work by slapping it title on your vacuous piece of crap save money and don buy the rights to the works title it something else don use the character names believe me no one will accuse you of plagiarism in fact it won matter what you title it to the unread moviegoer who accepts everything you throw at him but it will upset those who read who think who are unwilling to simply let you give them pretty light show br br robot like much of hollywood take on the genre pushes science fiction back down into that basement it lived in years ago hollywood could not do this alone it takes an uncritical mindless audience that will accept puerile dredge like this ',

 ' the influence of hal hartley in adrienne shelly i ll take you there is not overt but clearly has ties to his work shelly has acted in two of hartley films not only does her film exhibit very tight narrative but the hyper stylized and extreme characters strangely render human emotion in very real light though this film is not ironic on the whole thank god the small and subtle ironies that pepper the piece allude to the bitter truths in love and loss with beautiful cinematography and soundtrack straight from the seventies ll see you there is great indie film that doesn stoop to postmodern irony when dealing with the woes of love and the reality of human emotion br br the film begins with bill life falling to pieces not only has he sold his best friend ray beautiful country home but his wife rose has left him in order to join ray in the retreat all washed up bill wallows in his own gloom and doom until his sister lucy played by the director adrienne shelly brings him all kinds of surprises self help book and date for her traumatized brother br br the unwilling bill tries to refuse but the sudden appearance of bernice at his door leaves him no choice no doubt bernice initially superficial demeanor and ridiculous hairstyle detract from his ability to rebound with her however her pseudo hippie qualities annoy him so much that he lashes at her on their first date and bernice is so traumatized by his derogatory remarks that she attaches herself to him forcing herself upon him to what end we are not aware except for maybe the fact that she is psycho and who better to play the psycho than ally sheedy br br aware that bill desperately wants to see rose bernice offers her car but on the condition that he take her somewhere first on the way she proceeds to hold bill prisoner with his own gun pinkerton detective no less an imbroglio of angst resentment redemption passion and violence ensue as bill and bernice find themselves on their way to the country home of ray and rose of course with few stops along the way ',
 ' when in 1982 the thing came out to theaters everywhere it had cold reception and very poor box office results becoming almost failure in john carpenter career as horror director however time has proved that the thing was definitely not failed project and that the disappointing commercial results were not the film fault nowadays john carpenter the thing has gained the appreciation it rightfully deserves and is considered by many horror fans as horror classic and not without reason as this new version of john campbell jr story who goes there previously adapted as the thing from another world is closer to the original tale and keeps pessimistic feeling of dread and high doses of suspense in masterfully crafted study about paranoia br br the plot of the thing begins in the winter of 1982 in u research station located in the remote territories of antarctica when the members of the crew notice norwegian helicopter coming their way the two apparently insane pilots of the helicopter are trying to kill husky dog who makes its way into the american base after the norwegians are killed accidentally the americans try to figure out what made them to be insane soon they ll discover that the husky dog the norwegians were hunting was not normal dog but creature able to mimic every living creature and not only that it has tremendous hunger br br director john carpenter earned place in history when in 1978 he directed the seminal slasher halloween where suspense and atmosphere were above gore and shock the thing could be seen as an evolution of that style as even when carpenter makes great use of rob bottin special effects which were labeled by critics as repulsive on its day the film still focuses more on atmosphere and suspense rather than in the violent and very well done displays of gore the feeling of loneliness as well as the bad karma between the members of the crew increase the feeling of paranoia as anyone could be the thing even our main character j macready kurt russell ending in situation where nobody can be trusted br br this plot element was more faithful to the concept of the source novel and was blatantly ignored by the previous version not completely bad thing just big difference making this version feel less like remake and more as new conception of the source novel bill lancaster script handles the characters with brilliant domain giving us enough to distinguish them but not too much to completely trust them making them an essential factor in the film haunting feeling of dread that keeps running through the movie the mystery and the suspense are at the max as never one can tell who is the thing and who is normal enhancing the paranoia and unpredictability of the plot with excellent results br br the cast is very effective and their performances as whole so effective that one can almost feel the bad feelings between their characters as real carpenter regular collaborator kurt russell as macready carries the film and through his eyes we witness the madness and the horror the research station becomes as the situations goes worse definitely one of his best performances wilford brimley is also terrific as dr blair scientist that goes insane after discovering the thing purposes br br the thing is film so wonderfully crafted that its flaws tend to go unnoticed although they exist the most notorious being the very low key and at times unappropriated score by ennio morricone it not exactly bad but it just feels out of place at some scenes and it not one of the best works by the legendary composer also due to some misshapes with the special effects some scenes were left out that actually fill some small plot holes although nothing of big importance or actually annoying br br when talking about john carpenter films most people will almost instantly name halloween as his favorite film but personally would go with the thing as consider it carpenter greatest achievement so far and one of the most interesting and actually scary horror films ever made would go as far as to call it one of the finest films ever made 10 10 ',

 ' samuel fuller is hardly one of america great directors m not sure he qualifies as one of hollywood great craftsmen but he certainly ranks up there with the best of hollywood true professionals who were willing to march to their own music during the time he worked for hollywood studios he knew how to take an assignment shape the middling material handed to him and then turn it quickly and efficiently into something usually better than its parts on time and on budget pickup on south street is case in point on the surface it one more of hollywood early fifties anti commie movies complete with appeals to patriotism hard boiled hero and slimy and copiously perspiring bad guy fuller turns this bag of hollywood clichã into taut exciting drama with any number of off kilter twists the hero skip mccoy is three time loser petty crook with soft fingers who doesn change his stripes until the very end the girl in the caper candy has level of virtue that would be easy to step over if you re so inclined one of the most appealing characters moe williams is stoolie and in an unusual approach to hollywood battle against commies the appeals to patriotism fall on deaf ears the hero isn motivated by anything so ennobling he just wants payback for personal reason and winds up becoming at least for now good guy br br plus all the actors were mostly assigned to fuller by the studio he had to make do richard widmark by now had established his presence as an actor and star but jean peters is surprise she gives fine portrait of woman sexy and dumb and no better than her boy friends or her clients want her to be and richard kiley who later would become two time tony award winning star on broadway is convincingly slippery and cowardly it hard to remember that he was the actor who inflicted on us mean introduced to us the impossible dream from man of la mancha br br more than anything else this tale of pickpocket who picks purse in subway car and finds himself with microfilmed secrets instead of cash pursued by the feds and the commies moves straight ahead with great economy the whole enterprise with classic noir look only takes 80 minutes to tell the dialogue with fuller as screenwriter has that party corny partly pungent hard boiled pulp fiction style that muffin you grifted she okay one character says to skip about candy fuller moves us just fast enough from scene to scene to keep us hanging on what will come next then fuller throws in the character of moe williams all of sudden the story ratchets up to whole new level of interest part comedy relief and part sad inevitability br br the thing like best about the movie is how the opening exemplifies fuller talents and strengths in 2 minutes and 15 seconds starting right after the credits fuller is able to instantly power up the movie to establish for us what the story is about and to show us what kind of characters skip and candy we re going to be involved with and he does this with so much enticing curiosity in that hot packed subway car that we can just about feel fuller setting the hook to catch us br br says glenn erickson in my opinion one of the best of movie critics in what should be an inconsequential story sam fuller defines his peculiar view of americanism from the bottom up stiff necked aggressive self interest that when fully expressed recognizes what wrong and what right and isn afraid to fight for it as always in his work the individuals who fight the hardest for their country are the ones least likely to benefit from the effort he right and it makes for movie still vivid after 55 years ',

 ' waited until the 4th of july to write this because well because it just feels right to be doing it on this day br br in 1924 w griffith needed hit he had not had big one since orphans of the storm 1921 he been working steadily since then but his movies had been smaller in scope and had failed to hit the right chord with audiences he was planning film about patrick henry when he was contacted by members of the daughters of the american revolution dar who asked if he might expand his ideas to encompass more of the american revolution this movie is the result by the time he had finished he had 14 reel history lesson and there wasn a trace of patrick henry anywhere br br we all know the story of the revolutionary war but griffith threw in love story with patriot farmer nathan neil hamilton falling in love with tory aristocrat nancy montague carol dempster leading lady for griffith for many years complicating matters is the fact that nancy father hates nathan well not just nathan he hates all rebels it does not help matters when during skirmish on the streets of lexington someone jostles nathan arm causing him to discharge his gun and accidentally wound nancy dad br br paralelling the love story is the mostly true but partially embellished story of capt walter butler lionel barrymore renegade british officer who feels he owes allegiance to no one with thousands of indians form the six nations on his side he hopes to crush the colonials and become monarch of his own empire br br comparisons with birth of nation 1915 are inevitable the montague family might just as well be the cameron from the earlier film while nathan could be part of the stoneman family the sequence of the battle of bunker hill is staged very similarly to scene in birth of nation with the attacking army in this case the redcoats storming trench packed with patriots the only thing missing is henry walthall charging across no man land to stuff flag into the muzzle of cannon amazingly enough the battle scenes in america seem to lack the energy of the battle scenes in birth and fail to draw the audience in something is clearly missing it isn scope w billy bitzer camera work is quite good maybe what is missing is dare say it sincerity br br the brutality of capt butler and his men is well underscored although much of it happens in long shot or offscreen don expect any heads to be lopped off in closeup like we saw in intolerance 1916 in one scene butler second in command capt hare louis wolhiem gouges out the eyes of captive colonist we see only the beginning of the deed for the remainder the camera focuses on hare face as he obviously has good time doing this lionel had been working with griffith on and off since 1912 story goes that he approached griffith for work and w knowing the reputation of his famous family said am not hiring stage actors to which lionel replied and am nothing of the kind sir he makes very good and quite believable villain louis wolhiem appeared with lionel older brother john three times in sherlock holmes and dr jekyll and mr hyde both 1920 and later in the tempest 1927 as capt hare his wild staring eyes and disheveled hair not only mark him as villain but make you think he is quite mad also br br neil hamilton later remarked that america was his first time on horseback and was scared to death he hides his displeasure very well though and we can believe he was quite the equestrian by the time shooting was over mr griffith was very much in love with carol dempster and at one point asked her to marry him she refused and soon left his stock company after which her star status gradually waned br br speaking of horses one accidentally amusing moment which had to be unscripted came during the depiction of paul revere ride he rides his horse right up on the front porch of family to announce to arms the regulars are coming but as he tries to leave the horse cannot negotiate the steps backwards and stumbles spilling his rider on the ground am amazed griffith did not do another take br br so is america classic yes don wait for july 4th to see it it is enjoyable anytime ',

similar and even sometimes get them confused logan is unrealistically rich and hands out millions like they re dollars nobody that rich ve also noticed that every character on the show is mean to that stacy girl who does nothing but act nice to them that not funny that mean and it just influences young girls to act mean to totally nice people finally the school itself adds the frosting to the unreal cake by providing the students with 5 star amenities such as scenic location sushi bar hot lounge equipped with free soda machines pool jacuzzi movie theater and the allowance for boys and girls to freely go into the other sex dorm rooms at most boarding schools if boy were to go into girl dorm or vice versa they would be expelled br br in conclusion zoey 101 was poorly written and should have spent few more years in the drafting process ',
 ' 2005 was one of the best year for movies we had so many wonderful movies like batman begins sin city corpse bride history of violence coming up we also got brokeback mountain king kong but if this year the only great movie that came out was everything is illuminated then we wouldn miss all this year has brought the first movie as director of the talented liev schreiber is delightful heart warming touching drama that also brings one of elijah wood best roles he is perfect as jonathan curious man that heads for ukraine to find the woman who saved his grandfather in world war ii liev schreiber who also writes the movie conducts masterpiece with memorable scenes and lot of funny quotes this here is genuine mixture of comedy with drama bringing movie that will be commented years from now serious oscar contender everything is illuminated is powerful original and why not say illuminated movie but there one thing you should remember while entering the movie leave normal behind this is special 9 10 ',
 ' according to john ford lyrically shot fictional biopic of abraham lincoln life his greatest faults may have been an obtuseness with woman and an ability to dance in the worst way ford camera has only praising views to reveal of mr lincoln early life but for what the film lacks in character complexities it makes up for in beauty and depth of vision uncharacteristically beautiful compositions of early film what could have been series of gorgeous still frames ford has unique eye for telling story the film sings of the life of hopeful young man henry fonda plays the contemplative and spontaneously clever lincoln to tee one of his best roles br br the film concerns two young men brothers on trial for murder that both claim to have committed in classic angry mob style the town decides to take justice into their own hands and lynch the pair of them until honest abe steps into the fray he charms them with his humor telling them not to rob him of his first big case and that they are as good as lynched with him as the boys lawyer what follows seems to become the outline for all courtroom murder dramas thereafter as abe cunningly interrogates witnesses to the delight and humor of the judge jury and town before he stumbles upon the missing links br br the film plays out like many john ford movies do tablespoon of americana dash of moderate predictability hint of sarcasm that you aren sure if you put in the recipe or if ford did it himself despite the overtly hollywood feel of the film and overly patriotic banter alluding to lincoln future presidency the film is entirely enjoyable and enjoyably well constructed if you can take your drama with grain of salt ',

 ' this review is dedicated to the late keith moon and john entwistle br br the original drum and bass br br there seems to be very little early who footage around these days if there is more then bloody good music br br we all know of the other acts on the bill the doors their last ever show weeks before jim morrison died moody blues hendrix taste free and many more the point being that whoever were there it was the who that the majority had come to see this show was one year after the great hippie fest of the 1960 woodstock the film and record had come out and so had the who greatest work to date tommy the ever hungry crowd wanted taste to be able to experience their own unique event to be able to grove and love in the knowledge that this gig was their own to do this you needed the best of what rock roll had to throw at the hungrily baited crowd br br at two clock in the morning in late august 1970 the c announces ladies and gentlemen small rock roll band from shepherds bush london the oo br br john entwistle body suit is of black leather on the front is the out line of human skeleton from neck to toe roger dressed in his traditional stage outfit of long tassel and long flowing hair keith in white shirt and jeans as pete had his white boiler suit and doc martins that he preferred to wear br br the who never stopped their onslaught of high energy rock for over two hours performing theirs and other artists greatest tracks such as young man blues shaking all over and then as on queue keith baiting the crowed to shut up it a bleeding opera with tommy the rock opera the crowed went wild this is what they had come to hear and the who didn disappoint straight into overture and never coming up for air until the final note of tommy can you hear me  ' what if platoon of i from the japanese army were to be send back in time 400 years right in the middle of the feudal wars that led to the formation of the tokugawa shogunate great pitch right the movie does exactly what it says on the tin br br thankfully the writers didn bother to explain the usually ridiculous in sci fi movies scientific mumbo jumbo of time transport no how or why they just did however the time transport sequence itself is trippy as hell and quite beautiful if not bit dated not as silly as one would imagine br br the rest of the movie follows the premise to t but while it loses bit of steam with the various subplots that follow the i arrival to medieval japan it picks up with devastating battle sequence undoubtedly it the main order of the day the whole concept and by extension the movie itself was probably originated from this simple pitch what if i equipped with the latest in modern warfare were to fight samurais and boy does it deliver br br the main battle sequence that spans more than half an hour is probably one of the best of its kind in 70 action war movies not only is it relentless and exhausting in pace and length it also terrific mish mash of styles and techniques that only unique premises like i samurai can deliver mean where else would you get the chance to feature tanks ninjas complete with shuriikens helicopter and samurais in the same shot the i platoon led by lieutenant iba tears literally through hundreds of extras gunning them down with machine guns mortars grenades and tanks br br this mish mash of styles is with one foot firmly rooted in the sprawling jidai geki epic of kurosawa kagemusha or hiroshi inagaki samurai banners while the other is in western action and war movies there are stylistic touches like the wonderful slow motion shots and bloody violence that bring sam peckinpah or enzo castellari circa keoma to mind japanese cinema has always been influenced by westerns and other hollywood works and vice versa and i samurai effortlessly turns this east meets west melting pot into an exciting film br br the film makers thankfully take the whole thing seriously and the movie benefits immensely from it not that tongue in cheek mentality is completely absent it just that it doesn try to pander to so bad it good audiences that enjoy laughing at their movies the budget was probably hefty as it is evident in the hundreds of extras elaborate costumes very decent for production that is not traditional jidai geki and special effects the camera work and editing are all top notch almost better than movie with no higher artistic ambitions deserves br br it not withouts its flaws either of course there are many song scenes where all sorts of 70 japanese rock disco and country songs play over montages there a bonding scene love interest scene war is hell scene etc the songs themselves are pretty lame and corny and detract from the whole thing although it clocks at whooping 140 minutes it flies like bullet for the most part still some scenes flashbacks and subplots in the first half could have been clipped for tighter effect br br the cast also deserves mention featuring such prominent names as sonny chiba isao natsuyagi goyokin samurai wolf tsunehiko watase the yakuza papers and hiroyuki sanada all of them hitting the right notes ',

 ' warning does contain spoilers br br open your eyes br br if you have not seen this film and plan on doing so just stop reading here and take my word for it you have to see this film have seen it four times so far and still haven made up my mind as to what exactly happened in the film that is all am going to say because if you have not seen this film then stop reading right now br br if you are still reading then am going to pose some questions to you and maybe if anyone has any answers you can email me and let me know what you think br br remember my grade 11 english teacher quite well his name was mr krisak to me he was wise beyond his years and he always had this circuitous way of teaching you things that perhaps you weren all too keen on if we didn like shakespeare then he turned the story into modern day romance with modern day language so we could understand it our class room was never room it was cottage and we were on the lake reading book at our own leisure time this was his own indelible way of branding something into our sponge like minds br br begin this review of vanilla sky with description of this brilliant man because he once gave us an assignment that has been firmly etched in my mind like the phone number of long lost best friend and it finally made some sense to me after watching the matrix now if didn know better would have thought that the wachowski brothers were really just an alias for my teacher mr krisak but giving them the benefit of the doubt we ll assume it wasn him but that was the first time this assignment was anything more than impalpable br br he had asked us to prove to him and to ourselves that were real show me how you can tell that you are real this got the class spouting off all of the usual ideas that m sure you can imagine everything from pain to sense of touch to sense of loss to sense of hunger were spouted off to our teacher to prove to him that we were real after every scenario that we gave him he would come back with the one answer that would leave us speechless br br what if you are nothing but someone else dream br br what if you were someone else dream what messed up question that is this was question scenario posed to us about 15 years ago before the astronomical use of the internet and rapid advancement of computers how possible could it seem back then but if you look at today technology now ask yourself what it you were part of someone else dream br br another brilliant but surreal film this year david lynch mulholland drive explored similar areas but vanilla sky goes deeper than any other film could hope to in short this is one film that will literally if you let it blow your mind from all of the possibilities that surround you br br open your eyes br br tom cruise plays david aames young hot shot righteous full of himself publisher and owner of several magazines he inherited this from his father and although he has talent and business savvy his board of governers the seven dwarfs think he is rich dink born with silver spoon in his mouth they feel he has done nothing to deserve the pinnacle of success that each and every one of them believes should go to them br br early in the film we meet one of david gorgeous toys named julie gianni played with pernicious but bombastic perfection by cameron diaz david and julie play good game both claiming they are just there to use each other and are not the slightest bit interested in monogamous committed relationship this is the type of relationship commensurate with david other flings he had in the sexual prime of his life and although both talk good game we can tell that only one is really telling the truth br br next we meet brian shelby played with stroke of genius by kevin smith good buddy jason lee brian is writing book that david is going to publish but they are also very good friends this is something that david has very little of in his life and you can sense real caring for one another early on in the film brian has one famous line that he keeps telling david over and over again and that is the sweet ain so sweet without the bitter he goes on to tell him that one day he will find true love and not just this part time lover status that he seems to perpetrate with all of the floozies who inhabit his bed for night or two br br at david huge birthday bash so huge that the likes of steven spielberg wish him happy birthday brian enters with his date sofia sorrano played of course by penelope cruz with what has to be the best performance of this year by an actress this is bash by invite only and at first david and sofia seem intrigued with one another and in typical david fashion despite his best friend being there he begins to flirt with sofia to complicate things julie shows up uninvited and begins spying on david david then spends the night with sofia but they only talk and draw caricatures of one another there is no hanky panky the next day as david is leaving sofia apartment he is greeted by julie who offers him ride and from there well think we have all seen the commercials br br that is all will really say about the plot because from here the film teases us with what is reality and what is blurred perception we are introduced to character played by kurt russel and few other shady characters that all play part in this labyrinth like haze there is subtext of death and possible panacea like cure alls that may or not be able to create the possibility of eternal life this is just one of the intriguing possibilities the movie offers us but it doesn end there br br like many movies seem to thrive on today this film has secret sixth sense may have began this craze but look even further back and you can maybe thank angel heart for starting the craze regardless of how it originated vanilla sky has one of it own surreptitious gut busters and what makes this one so much fun is that the film gives you many obvious clues along the way but not enough to give you an apodictic solution to the gauntlet of truth and lies you have just put yourself through have seen this film four times and every time it has been because want to see if there is something more can pick up something more can understand to be able to work your mind in the theater to enable it to open up to new possibilities is something rare in film all of the ersatz so called best pictures of the year have been good but nothing spectacular they lack substance beautiful mind was intriguing but flat the royal tenenbaums was interesting but uneven vanilla sky is rarity because it is film that leaves you yearning for more yet guarantees your satisfaction because the film and those that made it care about it know this film has received mixed reviews but just think that those who don like it don quite understand it br br this is what film making is supposed to be like this is what film is supposed to do to you it is supposed to make you feel something most of the other films this year have been just empty spaces this one isn br br 10 out of 10 the best film of the year would love to see this get nominated for best picture and would love to see cruz up for best actress diaz for best supporting cruise for best actor and jason mewes should be shoe in for best supporting actor cameron crowe should there as well none of this may come to pass and that is shame this is one film that should not be missed br br and on final note am quite sure mr krisak would like this film and maybe this is the one film that may answer his question can you prove you are real or are we just figment of someone imagination are we artificially transplanted for someone else bemusement this is film that spawns more questions than it does answers and m sure that is just fine with him br br open your eyes ',

 ' skullduggery is strange strange film based on the novel ye shall know them by vercors to unleash criticism at the film feels really unkind since it is movie that deals with earnest themes like humanity and pleas for upright moral standards and tolerance but in spite of its honourable intentions and its well meaning tone skullduggery simply isn a very good film for me the main problem is the terribly disjointed narrative which can make its mind up how best to convey its message the first half of the movie is like watching standard jungle expedition flick of the tarzan ilk later it teeters into sci fi fable by the end it slips into courtroom melodramatics the differences in tone between each section of the movie are too great too jarring to overlook they stick out like sore thumb and remind you constantly that you re watching muddled disorganised movie br br an archaeological expedition into the jungles of new guinea is led by adventurer douglas temple burt reynolds one of the main archaeologists involved in the excursion is attractive lady scientist dr sybil greame susan clark after an arduous trek they stumble upon tribe of strange ape like creatures these primitive long lost people are covered in hair and have survived for centuries without being in any way touched or influenced by the developments of modern man there is some evidence that they may the ancestors of early man â the missing link in the evolution of apes into humans or perhaps race of humans who simply look and behave differently from usual or even race of animals that have begun to develop human characteristics the archaeologists call the tribe the tropi and are initially thrilled by the implications of their discovery but things take devastating turn when nasty opportunist vancruysen paul hubschmid declares his intention to exploit the tribe and their idyll on behalf of developers he questions whether the tropi are truly human and takes his argument to the courts where he hopes to be granted legal backing so that his own greedy ambitions can be continued br br this was very early film in reynolds career and he actually unbalances this movie by acting like he in comedy while the rest of the cast take it all very seriously not that reynolds can be blamed â he has an impossible role asked to play charming adventurer who really belongs in tarzan flick his character and the film are not relevant to each other clark fares much better as the earnest lady archaeologist and there are nice supporting roles for british actors edward fox alexander knox and wilfrid hyde white major shortcoming in skullduggery is the lame and ineffective make up used to give the tropi their strange hairy appearance rather than making the actors look like believable hominoids the stuck on hair merely makes them look unintentionally comicalâ and that just not the right idea we re meant to feel great sympathy for these creatures but that awfully hard when they look so unconvincing skullduggery is failed attempt to tell story that could have been poignant philosophical and stimulating the honourable intentions are there for all to see but the end result doesn do them justice worthy failure it might be but failure nonetheless ',
 ' why is it that in the 50s and 60s italians made so of the best movies and then during the 70s and 80s made nothing but zombie and cannibal movies probably because art films didn make any money the cannibal movie unlike the zombie movie which was created by americans and exploited by italians is purely italian creation designed as mondo exploitation showcase and to make as much money as possible away br br in plotting similar to read ripped off from ruggero deodato seminal cannibal classic cannibal holocaust woman janet agren receives word from the police that they ve received 8mm film from her sister she gone missing in africa and it suspected that the tribal ritual depicted on the film may have something to do with it mel ferrer as professor of somethingoranother tells her that man named jonas ivan rassimov has started jonestown like cult in new guinea and that where the sister is the woman hires guide robert kerman to take her through the jungle to find the cult and her sister and wouldn you know it the jungle is full of cannibals br br one sentence should sum it up if you ve seen on cannibal movie you ve seen them all mostly because these films steal shamelessly from each other lenzi copied cannibal holocaust to make this film and retooled this to make cannibal ferox deodato copied parts of this for hit and run and because they all share the same material they all feature the same traits awful photography boring scenery terrible dubbing overacting and exploitation exploitation exploitation genre fans will have ball since everyone in it is genre veteran rassimov and kerman have scenery eating contest agren exists solely to be naked raped or in peril plenty gore for all the sickos out there the cannibals who do actually appear to be native cannibals eat lunch  ' what we have here is downright brilliant piece of early 80 incompetence that will render even the biggest connoisseur of trash cinema completely speechless wizards of the lost kingdom is very cheap and cheesy fantasy sword and sorcery adventure that doesn have an actual plot but does eagerly shamelessly borrows elements from other films writer ed naha and hector olivera who watched enough similar type of movies to know that they needed handful of essential characters but probably figured that all the rest would follow automatically in order to make fantasy adventure you need one super evil villain preferably with black cape one young hero in training one lone warrior one amiable type of furry pet one wise midget living in the woods optional and whole colorful collection of hideous demons enslaved dwarfs and winged gargoyles to serve as filler the story is phenomenal and so original with simon the young son of wizard having to flee from his beloved kingdom after the evil magician shurka takes over the power and killed the king simon wants to go back and save the people but therefore he needs his powerful ring which he lost during his escape simon befriends lone warrior kor the usually cool dude bo svenson who clearly needed the pay check who assists simon during the long and devastating journey full of ordeals dangerous encounters and magical showdowns admittedly it doesn even sound too bad thus far but that merely just because excluded all the deliciously inept little details simon has best friend named gulfax for example gulfax is an albino version of chewbacca and evokes incontrollable chuckles whenever he opens his poodle snout to yelp something incomprehensible the obstacles during journey back home are hilariously irrelevant to the plot and simply serve as padding footage to cover up the lack of actual content simon has nightmarish visions inside the tent of suspicious forest nymph kor settles an old score with the pig faced nemesis whose sister he refused to marry and there the supposedly horrible suicide cave where you can only sing your way out of but the absolute most unequally brilliant sequence â not just of this film alone but in the history of cinema â involves the resurrection of four zombie warriors simon awakes the legendary courageous warriors hoping they will assist them in their battle but the rotting corpses only take few steps complain about how tired they are and return back to their graves that it so much for the zombie sub plot best sequence ever could go on listing unintentionally hilarious little details for several more paragraphs but you get the idea wizards of the lost kingdom is tremendously messed up so bad it good film word of advice do not watch this joyful piece of junk alone invite friends preferably the dope headed types with wicked sense of humor and watch it in group it will be night to rememberâ ',

 ' beforehand notification m sure someone is going to accuse me of playing the race card here but when saw the preview for this movie was thinking finally have yet to see one movie about popular african influenced dance be it popular hip hop moves breaking or stepping where the main character was black woman ve seen an excessive amount of movies where non black woman who knew nothing about hip hop comes fresh to the hood and does mediocre job of it breakin breakin 2 save the last dance step up but the black women in the film are almost nonexistent that always bothered me considering so much of hip hop african influenced dance and breaking was with blacks and latinos in massive amounts in these particular sets and it wasn always men who performed it so felt this movie has been long time coming however the race does not make the film so also wanted it to carry believable plot the dancing be entertaining and interesting to watch br br pros really enjoyed this film bringing jamaican culture can recall ever seeing popular mainstream film where all the main characters were jamaican had believable accents and weren stereotypical with the beanies the steppers family friends and even the thugs were all really intelligent realistic people who were trying to love live and survive in the neighborhood they lived in by doing something positive even when the audience was made aware that the main character sister chose an alternate lifestyle it still didn make the plot stereotypical was satisfied with the way it was portrayed loved the stepping the romantic flirty relationship going on between two steppers the trials that the main character parents were going through and how she dealt with coming back to her old neighborhood and dealing with crabs in barrel respected that she was so intelligent and active at the same time and so many other sistas in the film were handling themselves in the step world they were all just as excellent as the fellas don see that in too many movies nowadays at least not those that would be considered black films br br cons m not quite sure why the directors or whoever put the movie together did this but question whether they ve been to real step shows whenever the steppers got ready to perform some hip hop song would play in place of the steppers hand feet beats at real step show there is zero need for music other than to maybe entertain the crowds in between groups and then when hip hop songs were played sometimes the beat to the song was off to the beat of the steppers hands and feet it was awkward was more impressed with the stepping in this movie versus stomp the yard another great stepping movie because the women got to represent as fierce as the guys in stomp the yard meagan good got all of few seconds of some prissy twirl and hair flip and the deltas let out chant and few steps and were cut immediately even when there were very small scenes the ladies tore it up especially in the auto shop and it was without all that music to drown out their physical music know soundtracks have to be sold but the movie folks could ve played the music in other parts of the film br br m not keyshia cole fan so every time saw her all kept thinking was is it written in the script for her to constantly put her hand on her hip when she talks she looked uncomfortable on screen to me thought they should ve used host like free or rocsi instead deray davis was funny as usual though also groaned when found out that the movie was supposed to be in the ghetto like stepping couldn possibly happen anywhere else hollywood as usual however only couple of people were portrayed as excessively ignorant due to their neighborhood and losers which mainstream movies tend to do br br would ve given this movie five stars but the music playing killed it for me definitely plan to buy it when it comes out and hopefully the bonus scenes will include the actual step shows without all the songs ',

 ' 1904 the north african nation of morocco is hanging onto tenuous independence as the various european powers france germany britain russia spain and now the united states are vying for influence in the region the sultan marc zuber is weak puppet his uncle the bashaw vladek sheybal who is being manipulated by the french and germans is the real power behind the throne enter berber chieftan raisuli sean connery the leader of the rif tribe and the last of the barbary pirates who kidnaps an american missionary eden pedecaris candice bergen and her two children and takes them hostage back in the us president theodore roosevelt brian keith threatens to go to war over the issue pedecaris alive or raisuli dead seeing the issue as the perfect way to exercise his big stick diplomacy though secretary of state john hay john huston is not so confident however the raisuli has less sinister plans for the pedecarises who are more than capable of handling themselves in any event br br john milius great historical film based very loosely off of true story e pedecaris was middle aged man is wonderful bit of escapism it has some amazing action scenes witty well written script fine cast enjoying themselves with the material and does not overstay its welcome like say pirates of the caribbean or the lord of the rings movies it not really an epic film in the strictest sense but it one of the best pure action movies ever made br br while the historical context is shaky the storyline is interesting and as some reviewers point out it is even more pertinent today than it was when made as president roosevelt says america is like grizzly bear fierce strong but little blind and reckless at times at the time of the film setting america has just been propelled onto the world stage as superpower following their resounding victory in the spanish american war and roosevelt seizes this incident as way to prove america worth in real life it didn quite work out that way but allegorically it works well while written from right wing perspective milius screenplay is pretty accurate in assessing america and its place in the world he admires roosevelt and his method of big stick diplomacy and correctly recognizes in the words of roosevelt that while america may be feared and respected they ll never be truly loved by the world no matter what they do and there are some scenes like roosevelt target shooting of european leaders and the almost comic surprise attack by marines on the bashaw palace which show america reckless and violent side while others the climactic showdown with the germans show their heroism br br the historical political context of the film is of course merely meat on the bones of what is essentially rousing action adventure film there are some brilliantly done action scenes such as raisuli rescue of the pedecaris from double crossing tribesmen which features some of the best swordplay in any film the opening entrance of the raisuli and the aforementioned march and attack of the us marines are brilliantly done bravura set pieces and the final battle which combines elements of lawrence of arabia and the wild bunch while major historical fantasy three way battle between germans americans and the rifs is superbly staged adrenaline pumping sequence br br the excellent cast gives some wonderful performances everyone seems to be having fun time with the film and it shows sean connery is surprisingly convincing as berber with scottish accent but manages to pull off his interesting well drawn and chivalrous character who comes to respect his hostage and abhors modern uncivil warfare candice bergen an actress whom ve never been fond of gives fine performance as the feisty eden pedecaris who is every bit as tough as her captor brian keith is an amazingly convincing tr you really feel he must have been like this an athletic blustering yet practical and intelligent man with an admirable sense of self the scenes of roosevelt boxing and target shooting while discussing foreign policy are some of the greatest bad ass moments in movie history and who can forget lines like why spoil the beauty of the thing with legality john huston provides solid support as the weary cautious hay acting as perfect foil to the much more impetuous roosevelt br br among the fine supporting cast the best are geoffrey lewis as samuel gummere the cynical ambassador caught in the middle of the political intrigue and steve kanaly as the gung ho marine captain who cheerfully advocates and carries out military intervention as the blunt and simple solution to the whole complex situation other familiar faces such as vladek sheybal nadim sawalha roy jenson larry cross marc zuber and darrell fetty also do fine work no matter how small their role spaghetti western fans will recognize antoine saint john fistful of dynamite as the german general and aldo sambrell as one of raisuli tribesmen br br the wind and the lion is all around wonderfully done adventure film it has something for everyone wonderful gun and swordplay lot of humor tough feisty heroine and her two cute children nice if unconsummated romance and an interesting if fanciful political historical context it not masterpiece but hey it wasn trying to be give the wind and the lion stirring nine stars and my highest recommendation ',
 ' nothing about this movie stands out as either being great or terrible br br in the end that is what kills it the blandness is just not good can say expected better from will smith but definitely did from kevin james of the king of queens but hey m getting used to saying that lot lately this film attempts to make its mark as witty romantic comedy but it never hits the bull eye in fact it never hits anywhere within the target the allergy scene is disturbing the fact that kevin james can dance is something that wouldn exactly catch anybody off guard and is therefore in movie like this not funny this movie constantly tries to win your heart but always with the wrong ploy at the wrong time some parts are okay but m searching my brain for examples but really think this movie should be avoided ',
 ' can say enjoyed this as much as the big lebowski or raising arizona and felt little slighted but brother is an enjoyable film worthy of some good laughs and taste of the coens brisk twisted sense he talks in real life find that amazing tim blake nelson was also good of course george clooney who assume is not the best at feigning accents judging by his decision to chuck the idea of working with regulars like holly hunter in short but sweet role and john goodman also on screen for short time but steals every minute of it br br though don normally dig country music liked the title song man of  ' first let get it out of the way yeah this film steals lot from darkness falls 2003 the plot for darkness falls goes something like this the tooth fairy murderous woman who hides her face due to disfigurement kills people who look at her out of revenge in the tooth fairy 2006 the disfigured tooth fairy who yeah hides her face unleashes her furious vengeance on just about anyone little too similar to be coincidence br br but what must be asked is this if you re going to directly steal the exact plot from movie why choose something as mediocre as darkness falls sure it made few bucks at the box office but that was strictly for the fairly okay theatrical experience the film delivered low budget straight to video movie will not have that same effect and it didn br br as watched the opening 15 20 minutes of the film my expectations actually rose there seemed to be at least some production value the story didn seem terrible just blatantly ripped off past the first scene we get an okay cast of characters including an ex doctor with secrets played by that guy who looks like busey and some hot veterinary student jenifer from argento masters of horror jenifer after those few minutes however the film just slowly goes down the drain it serves all the basic horrible clichã including but not limited to some crazy old person with an unheeded warning the buff dumb jock the psychic and the stripper with the heart of gold br br one of the biggest problems this film had was its inability to stick with target audience it kind of like the filmmakers wanted to change the tone for whatever character was on screen at the time when the adults were on screen it had more mature feel when star the stripper and whatshisface the jock were on screen the dialogue went down to more stupid err immature level when the kid was on screen it felt like an episode of are you afraid of the dark only less scary br br technically the film is all over the place the visuals range from fairly good to plain boring the writing is subpar as is the acting for the most part on the plus side there some excessive gore at parts including fairly cool yet painfully predictable woodchipper scene and pretty vicious nailgun scene also if you re looking for bit of the sexy stuff there a brief topless scene but if you want to see this chick topless there are better films to do that other than that there not much to bother with when it comes to this film br br if you re huge fan of darkness falls do those exist maybe you can check it out to see the story done in different way but that about the only reason can find to see this one br br final verdict 3 10 ap3 ',
 ' d waited for some years before this movie finally got released in england but was in many ways very pleased when finally saw it there are lot of great things to the film for start the acting its not something have all that much need for in horror picture but the people in this film all put in fine work this and the constantly gripping and interesting script with nice sorta lovecraftian feel to it give the film real solid backbone add to this the doses of surreal nightmare imagery and occasional gruesome gore and the films winner it has my favorite kind of gore too supernatural and splattery also the characters of marcus the angry bodybuilding transsexual and daisy his mentally retarded lover plaything are genuinely freakish and unnerving at times and give far out anything goes sense of morbid grown up craziness which works well with the frequent freudian overtones this is one of the most impressive recent horror movies far more shocking or out there than anything hollywood can produce my only gripe was that wanted the ending to be darker in tone but it still works so on the whole d really recommend this to serious horror buffs ',
