 ' warning contains spoilers br br written by husband and wife wally wolodarsky who also directed and maya forbes this indie film is one of the better romantic comedies in recent memory br br jay mohr takes break from playing smarmy weasels to be the nice guy faced with the fact his fiancã wants to bed other people and he allowed to do so too julianne nicholson who was so good in tully plays spunky and vulnerable with great gusto too bad she doesn get the recognition she deserves br br good supporting performances help immensely too lauren graham who made last year bad santa memorable plays the jaded cynical sister to perfection bryan cranston the dad on tv malcolm in the middle gets few funny raunchy moments and andy richter plays genial guy who falls for single mother helen slater in credible albeit familiar role as mousy woman br br what surprised me most about seeing other people was how funny it is there are some genuine laughs here ed first attempt at meaningless sex gets some great lines and there a mã nage trois that elicits one of the most truthful reactions from man as the male fantasy gets tweaked br br the film premise isn unusual but liked that it was alice nicholson who thought of it much to the chagrin of ed mohr given the genre you know that no matter how good her intentions are alice plan is doomed we see how the couple works through this strange situation initially alice and ed are turned on by the idea but then the human element sets it br br appreciated forbes and wolodarsky not turning this into cheap sex romp yes there sex and nudity but there also are real emotions at work here the other people alice and ed befriend don want to be the objects of casual sex they have feelings too in one case too many feelings br br granted some scenes run one joke too many the richter slater subplot isn necessary and alice does something truly uncharacteristic but that forgivable because mohr and nicholson generate such tremendous intimacy and honesty check out the scenes where ed rummages through alice underwear drawer or his reaction to her announcement about ending the experiment that no matter how much we might enjoy their little game we root for this couple to succeed br br unfortunately this film got little if any publicity and limited release hollywood studios whose romantic comedies often veer on the unfunny turgid and unsurprising would do well to learn from this intelligent and funny film ',
 ' what terrible movie it represents perfectly the state of degenerateness of french society where the most elementary respect for wholesome values and traditions has completely disappeared the plot is nonsensical the movie is not funny at all and the characters are completely shallow and uninteresting to say the least the direction and the cinematography are very poor and uninspired catherine deneuve is as bad an actress as she always was even when she was directed by bunuel in belle de jour the rest of the usually good cast vincent lindon line renaud jean yanne seem completely lost in an ocean of vulgarity platitudes and restlessness cannot help to draw parallel with the wonderful james ivory le divorce with its thoughtful depiction of french and american mores its superlative cinematography and stellar cast put to good use having watched le divorce you can feel kind of empathy with the french regardless of their foibles belle maman leaves you with only nauseated contempt for its morally bankrupt and clueless protagonists ',

 ' very great movie br br big love story lots of sword fighting huge battle scenes heros and villains real history br br few in the west know much chinese history chin zchaundi founded china the country is in fact named after him some are familiar with the terra cotta army recently unearthed this is historical epic of how he ended the period of contending states and unified china he founded dynasty that only last 14 years but it was immediately replaced by the han dynasty that permanently defined chinese civilization ever since br br chin or the king of zheng as he was known before he founded the empire was roughly contemporaneous with scipio hannibal and fabius in the west the parallel roman world dominance west and east worlds was achieved without single towering personality like chin it would not be for another century before the west produced caesar the nearest comparable western figure br br chin is shown very sympathetically here in the beginning but he develops over the course of the film into ruthless despot history only records the ruthless despot part but the sympathetic beginning leaves room for real character development over the course of this long film the famous story about the meeting with the assassin is as true as any two thousand year old anecdote can be gong li is lovely she is the emotional core of the story it all makes for great movie making ',
 ' saw this movie partly because of the sheer number of good reviews at netflix and from it leaned valuable lesson not lesson about ethnic diversity however the lesson learned is don trust reviews br br yes racism sucks and people are complicated but the people who actually need to see this movie are going to be the ones who are the least drawn to it and least affected by it if they do see it the only reason that can think of for the number of good reviews is that it being reviewed by people who aren used to thinking or who ve seen their first thought provoking movie and somehow think that haggis invented the concept in fact he basically made this film which should be called racism for dummies as emotionally wrenching as possible seemingly to give people who don spend lot of time thinking the impression that they ve discovered some fundamental truth that never been covered in film before zen and the art of motorcycle maintanence it not an after school special for the unthinking masses cut into bite sized overwrought ham fisted pieces to make it easier to swallow without too much introspection br br it as if they portrayed everyone as being the worst possible extreme simply to make us happy that we re such good people because we don identify with the characters let face it people nobody identifies with these characters because they re all cardboard cutouts and stereotypes or predictably reverse stereotypes it well acted even if the dialog is atrocious and cleverly executed so much that you don think to ask where the beef until you can tell the film is winding down the flaming car scene was well executed like much of the movie but went nowhere in the end br br the messages are very heavy handed and from the behind the scenes blurb the producers were clearly watching different movie because there is very little to laugh about in this movie even during the intended funny parts have to stress that this is not entertainment more like high school diversity lesson call it the blood on the highway of racism they could even show this in high schools if it weren for the side nude shot of jennifer esposito br br in this film everyone a jerk and everyone learns lesson except for michael pena who gets the best role but the most predictable storyline br br this is bad film with bad writing and good actors an ugly cartoon crafted by paul haggis for people who can handle anything but the bold strokes in storytelling picture painted with crayons br br crash is depressing little nothing that provokes emotion but teaches you nothing if you already know racism and prejudice are bad things ',

mistress of the dark was an 80 tv icon who had her own late night show on cable she hosted and presented classic american horror films many of them campy while providing her own quips and humorous remarks actress cassandra peterson has to this date ridden on that success in 1988 her first film was released playing herself she stuck hosting monster movie shows but longs for her own show in las vegas and make big money her agent manny proves disappointment it not long before she inherits mansion from deceased relative pet dog and book of recipes she comes to claim her inheritance in small nevada town she was on her way to vegas and became lost and soon stirs things up in the sedate community outspoken conservative town council woman chastity pariah edie mcclurg soon sees her as threat audiences familiar with the elvira show on cable truth be told this is funny and feel good movie the script is chalk full of all kinds of jokes some bad some good lots of sexual innuendo visual jokes and overall campiness e the hilarious last scene in which elvira has finally got her own strip show in vegas this film is cult classic of sorts catering to elvira fans you couldn enjoy this film  ' the movie storyline is pat and quaint two women travel through the middle east and discover themselves unfortunately if you are looking for movie about the middle east and central asia this is absolutely terrible br br the producers of the film either did no research or were unbelievably lazy when filming it to begin with and most glaringly incorrect the nuristanis as they were known in the thirties and indeed since the 1890s and their forceful conversion by abdul rahman shah of aghnaistan were not nomads in fact they have not been nomads since the aryan invasions of central asia over three milenia ago br br second the city that is filmed as tehran is not tehran which is understandable however the geography of the area around the city could not be more strikingly different than the city of tehran which is surrounded on all side by large mountain range which predominates all of the cities views br br third persian despite the fact it is spoken in iran and afghanistan is never heard in movie when there are native speakers who do not speak in german they speak in arabic the persian guards at the border in fact say to each other ma hadha rujal this is not man and not in mard nist as it would be in persian also the love song between the indian princess and one of the main characters is obviously in spanish while talking in the garden one of the main characters says that the quran uses the words ferdos and jehaan and makes some reference to drugs afterwords these words certainly never appear in the quran as they are persian for paradise indeed ferdos and paradise are very distant cognates between our languages and world respectively though jehaan is admittedly close to jehennan which is hell in arabic when they encounter the nomads in the desert the language spoken is also arabic this despite the fact that there are no native speakers of arabic in iran and afghanistan and its use is primarily religious with some use in education at that time br br when they are stopped in iran before they reach the afghan border the people they encounter are wholly unlike any iranian group their tents are typically bedouin with carpets decorating the walls and high profile in iran it is also extremely uncommon for people to wear turbans unless they are cleric the language spoken is clearly arabic from the initial greeting of ahlan wa sahlan when they do reach kabul the desert they find themselves in is sandy totally unlike the rock dirt that is found in the arid parts of the hindu kush mountain range there is an absence of the light green scrub that covers the ground in the summer and spring the area is also not wholly consumed by the extreme mountains of the mountain range that won its name the indian killers because of its difficult and limiting ground br br in short the story line is the only thing in this movie that holds any water and it is still weak and common place it lacks any real draw to it being merely the tale of two women trying to learning about themselves as they get to nuristan however even that is still born and no real development is felt leaving the characters in the end just where they were in the beginning and nothing has changed except that world war two has broken loose in short this is really bad movie that would have rated at one star except for the good footage of bedouin and the deserts of the levant even if they are misnamed ',

 ' man really wanted to like these shows am starving for some good television and applaud tnt for providing these opportunites but sadly am in the minority guess when it comes to the cinematic stephen king as brilliant as king writing is the irony is that it simply doesn translate well to the screen big or small with few exceptions very few the king experience cannot be filmed with the same impact that the stories have when read many people would disagree with this but m sure that in their heart of hearts they have to admit that the best filmed king story is but pale memory of the one they read the reason is simple the average king story takes place in the mind scape of the characters in the story he gives us glimpses of their inner thoughts their emotions and their sometimes fractured or unreal points of view in short king takes the reader places where you can put panavision camera as an audience watching the filmed king we re left with less than half the information than the reader has access to it not too far stretch to claim that one becomes character in king story they read whereas one is limited to petty voyeurism of that same character when filmed for as long as king writes hollywood will try shooting everything that comes out of his word processor without any regard to whether or not they should don blame the filmmakers for trying but it takes an incredible amount of talent and circumspection to pull off the elusive stephen king adaptation that works the task is akin to turning lead into gold or some arcane zen mastery oh well better luck next time ',

on the streets to discuss such matters as committing himself and life after the scene inside the theatre was so bad towards the climax we could hear people behind us loudly challenge the hero iq is he stupid can he just use his siren or lights on busy madras road kamal the cop on police jeep chases guy on bike just like any ordinary dude can he just use his gun the guy on bike starts on foot and we have fully geared kamal in hot pursuit for considerable amount of time m not voting in favour of the later but m just trying to explain the mood inside br br 9 gore violence if wanted to watch women being raped their throats getting slashed more women getting raped and thrown into the bushes with excruciating authenticity would sit at home and rather watch police report or kuttram the use of  ' jessica ghost story is as the name implies ghost story the theme is meant to be horror but comes across closer to comedy br br woman comes who was brutally murdered comes back from the dead this constitutes what this movie attempts to pass off as plot there is really nothing more to it the movie comprises of series of loosely connected scenes involving guy who had an affair with this woman prior to her death br br immediately from the opening scenes this movie has the appearance of straight to dvd effort unlike gems such as vacancy 2 the movie has no sense of direction or creativity and certainly gives straight to dvd movies bad name the direction is as poor as can be with complete lack of suspense scares or tension even the drama elements are hopelessly handled and represent something more boring than even the worst soap opera you may have had the misfortune of enduring br br the acting across the board is absolutely abysmal with no one actor involved managing to show even the slightest potential of successful acting career br br many of the individual scenes are incredibly long with very long pauses between dialogue exchanges m not exaggerating br br the only reason give this movie rating of 2 rather than 1 is because some of the poor acting combined with even worse dialogue made for few unintentional laughs stress the word few in that sentence this is not overall one of the so bad it good movies like camp blood or the nail gun massacre if you want to laugh hysterically watch those movies if you want to see proper horror movie about ghosts watch the legend of hell house the changeling ringu the eye original korean version the grudge one missed call or phone br br advise anyone who has had the good fortune of avoiding seeing jessica ghost story to keep up the good work just forget this movie exists don spare thought for it ',

briefly planned and then executed in heavy handed and dumb way that just makes it look cheesy we do not get to see them arrive to some dramatic music perhaps they have to get through security to get  ' lucio fulci made lot of great films throughout his career and the way that many of them featured bucket load of gore lead to him earning the title the godfather of gore while don torture duckling was made before fulci became well known amongst gorehounds and isn all that gory it certainly gritty and nasty little thriller and for my money the best film that fulci ever made don torture duckling really is head and shoulders above lot of the giallo genre in terms of production values and unlike many of fulci later films everything about this giallo is great the plot focuses on small rustic community where dead bodies have began turning up the murders are even more shocking because the victims are just young boys shortly after the police convict an innocent man of the crimes reporter named andrea martelli arrives in the village and decides to start investigating the murders on his own martelli soon encounters various suspects including sexy young lady named patricia sinister priest and local witch who enjoys making wax effigies and sticking pins into them br br while this film may not feature loads of gore it does have two of fulci nastiest sequences to make up for it the nastiest involves woman being brutally slaughtered by group of men in cemetery while the image of man falling from cliff and hitting any number of rocks on the way down is liable to turn some stomachs don torture duckling features an absolutely great italian cast barbara bouchet personal favourite of mine is incredibly sexy in her role as patricia and gets to flex her acting muscles more than she did in many later films tomas millian is excellent as usual while the rest of the cast is well fleshed out by likes of irene pappas florinda bolkan and marc porel the cinematography on display is stunning and fulci really gives the viewer the impression that he puts lot of care and effort into every scene the story plays out slowly and it always interesting as fulci never allows the film to stray too much from the central plot line there isn a great deal of mystery towards the identity of the murderer but fulci almost manages to keep us guessing right up until the end and don torture duckling does climax on high overall it a shame that fulci didn make more films like this don torture duckling is his out and out best work and insist that every giallo fans sees it ',
 ' the white warrior is definitely one of if not steve reeves weakest films set in 18th or 19th century russia steve plays cossack warrior who tries to over run mad man russian czar by running up mountain side with his rebel band in goofy looking russian white tunic for the most part the great reeves physique is hidden in goofy knee length tunic with an even more sillier looking russian hat br br the action is rather minimal with only good wrestling scene from the mid waist up that shows off the great reeves physique this is an apparent attempt by the producers to move reeves out of the sword and sandal genre into another historic era with poor results the dialogue from the script is hard to understand at various points and only commentary from the narrator allows the viewer to understand what is really happening from scene to scene would image reeves regretted making this film but in an attempt to try and get out of his toga and sandals and tribune armor it helped launch him to other historic characters such as morgan the pirate and the thief of baghdad ',

based is from an era where real names can be used in way this film is all smoke mirrors even though it was released in 1946 it was filmed shortly after casablanca ingrid bergman is at her most radiant in this movie as brunette br br she plays beautiful woman who is trying to trade on her beauty to get rich husband today that is gold digger but in this social era she is desirable the kind of woman who makes all the men want her all the old snooty society types talk of her avoid her while wishing they were her ingrid is at her best plays this role well br br some sympathy for ingrids character is raised in the new orleans section of this film as she manages to get decent belated tomb for her scandalized mother as part of the settlement by her relatives to get her to leave new orleans the snooty family of relatives there are so scandalized by her that they will do almost anything she asks to get her to leave town br br gary cooper is good in this film though he already appears to be aging bit to play dashing texan bachelor gambler he pulls it off well considering that handicap which he appeared older than he was due to his real life chain smoking flora robison as ingrid maid got nominated for an oscar as supporting actress in this film jerry austin as cupidor was over looked in many ways for his role but is the only comic relief in the film does it well br br when the film moves to saratoga it depicts accurately how important saratoga was in that era like the sequence when bergman walks to the saratoge spring to get some of the sulfur water which everyone considered so healthy then when she drinks some she forces herself not to make face and comments how good it is that she must have more br br the real history is the railroad battle which really occurred on the rail line in tunnel new york which is the actual saratoga trunk the film title is derived from this battle actually happened in 1869 between agents for andrew carnagie p morgan the line was the economic key to the country in 1869 connecting coal country the east coast the references to it are throughout the film are very real there is even some dialog describing carnagie as scot though the reference is vague unfamiliar to anyone not knowing the history around the battle br br the railroad line the railroad tunnel in tunnel new york zip code 13848 still exist although the film was shot in california the real tunnel is about 1 mile long it is still part of key freight line today years after this occurred grew up there gary cooper line in the film while he is riding the train into the tunnel is right it is still mighty pretty country ',

 ' cinderella is one of the most beloved of all disney classics and it really deserves its status based on the classic fairy tale as told by charles perrault the film follows the trials and tribulations of cinderella good girl who is mistreated by her evil stepmother and equally unlikable stepsisters when royal ball is held and all eligible young women are invited read the king wants to get the prince to marry cinderella is left at home whilst her stepmother takes her awful daughters with her but there is fairy godmother on hand br br the story of cinderella on its own wouldn be able to pad out feature so whilst generally staying true to the story otherwise the fairly incidental characters of the animals whom the fairy godmother uses to help get the title character to the ball become cinderella true sidekicks the mice jaq and gus are the main sidekicks and their own nemesis being the stepmother cat lucifer their antics intertwine generally with the main fairy tale plot and are for the most part wonderful admittedly the film does slow down bit between the main introduction of the characters and shortly before the stepsisters depart for the ball but after this slowdown the film really gets going again and surprisingly since cinderella is the most worn down story of all time probably ends up as one of the most involving disney stories br br the animation and art direction is lovely all of the legendary nine old men animated on this picture and mary blair colour styling and concept art she also did concept art and colour styling for alice in wonderland peter pan the three caballeros and many many others manage to wiggle their way on screen the colours and designs are lovely especially in the fairy godmother and ball scenes as well as in those pretty little moments here and there br br overall cinderella ranks as one of the best disney fairy tales and comes recommended to young and all that embodies the disney philosophy that dreams really can come true ',

 ' in many ways the filmic career of independent film making legend john cassavetes is the polar opposite of someone like alfred hitchcock the consummate studio director where hitchcock infamously treated his actors as cattle cassavetes sought to work with them improvisationally where every element in hitchcock shot is composed immaculately cassavetes cared less for the way scene was figuratively composed than in how it felt or what it conveyed emotionally hitchcock tales were always plot first narratives with the human element put in the background cassavetes put the human experience forefront in every one of his films if some things did not make much sense logically so be it br br one can see this even from his very first film 1959 shadows filmed with 16mm hand held camera on shoe string budget of about 40 000 in manhattan with cassavetes acting workshop repertory company and touted as an improvisatory film the story is rather simple as it follows the lives of three black sibling manhattanites benny ben carruthers trumpeter and no account hugh hugh hurd washed up singer and lelia lelia goldoni the younger sister of both the film three main arcs deal with hugh failures as nightclub crooner and his friendship with his manager rupert rupert crosse benny perambulations in an about manhattan with his two no account pals and lelia lovelife first with white boy tony anthony ray who does not realize light skinned lelia race even after bedding her then with stiff and proper davey davey jones who may be misogynist br br in the first arc nothing much happens except dark skinned hugh gets to pontificate on how degraded he feels to be singing in low class nightclubs and opening shows for girly acts he dreams of making it big in new york or even paris but one can tell he is the type of man who will continue deluding himself of his meager skill for the one time we actually get to hear him sing he shows he a marginal talent at best that rupert keeps encouraging him gives us glimpses into how destructive friendships work but this is the least important of the three arcsâ while this film is better overall than say martin scorsese first film decade later who that knocking at my door another tale of failed romance and frustrated new yorkers it has none of the brilliant moments acting wise nor cinematographically that that film has it also is not naturalistic for naturalism in art is very difficult thing to achieve especially in film although the 1950s era manhattan exteriors at ground level is gem to relive while shadows may indeed be an important film in regards to the history of the independent film circuit it certainly is nowhere near great film parts of it are preachy poorly acted scenes end willy nilly almost like blackout sketches and sometimes are cut off seemingly in the middle all in all it a very sloppy job especially the atrocious jazz score that is often out of synch with the rest of the film as cassavetes proved that as director at least in his first film he was good actor the only reason for anyone to see shadows is because cassavetes ultimately got better with later films and this gives clue as to his later working style br br the national film registry has rightly declared this film worthy of preservation as culturally significant this is all in keeping with the credo of art cassavetes long championed as typified by this quote ve never seen an exploding helicopter ve never seen anybody go and blow somebody head off so why should make films about them but have seen people destroy themselves in the smallest way ve seen people withdraw ve seen people hide behind political ideas behind dope behind the sexual revolution behind fascism behind hypocrisy and ve myself done all these things so can understand them what we are saying is so gentle it gentleness we have problems terrible problems but our problems are human problems that this film is culturally significant is true but that truth is not synonymous with its being artistically significant it is in the difference between these two definitions where great art truly thrives ',

is much more classy and stylish than it has any right to be still the opening is by far the best thing about the entire movie as it shows how in the year 1840 samurai sword master catches his wife committing adultery he decapitates the two lovers before doing some hara kiri ritual suicide through disembowelment cut to present day when the american ambassador in japan welcomes befriended family and drives them up to the same house where the aforementioned slaughter took place nearly one and half century ago from then onwards this becomes seemingly routine haunted house flick yet the utterly retarded and implausible script still makes it somewhat exceptional let start with the good aspects namely the original japanese setting and the presence of the delicious susan george who is my all time favorite british horror wench well together with britt eckland linda hayden and ingrid pitt the bad aspects simply include that the screenplay is incoherent imbecilic beyond repair and full of supposedly unsettling twists that only evoke laughter the restless spirits of the house soon begin to entertain themselves by perpetrating into the bodies of the new tenants and causing them to do and say all sorts of crazy stuff the spirit of the massacred adulterous woman particularly enjoys squeezing into susan ravishing booty and transforming her into lewd seductress in this possessed state she even lures the american ambassador outside to have sex in the garden of high society diner party full of prominent guests so strictly spoken it not really evil that dwells in the house just trio of sleazy ghosts with dirty minds and far too much free time on their long dead hands obviously these scenes are more comical than frightening especially since the light blue and transparent shapes remind you of the cute ghost effects that were later popularized in ghostbusters the house where evil dwells is probably the least scary ghost movie ever throughout most of the running time you ll be wondering whether director kevin connor who nevertheless made the excellent horror films motel hell and from beyond the grave intentionally wanted to make his movie funny and over the top like motel hell maybe but then again everyone in the cast continues to speak his her lines with straight and sincere face so guess we are nevertheless supposed to take everything seriously and feel disturbed the house where evil dwells is never suspenseful or even remotely exciting and it doesn even contain any grisly images apart from the massacre at the beginning am fully aware of how shallow it sounds but the two scenes in which susan george goes topless are the only true highlights well those and maybe also the invasion of cheesy and ridiculously over sized spiders or are they crabs in the daughter bedroom how totally random and irrelevant was that if you ever decide to give this movie chance notwithstanding its bad reputation make sure you leave your common sense and reasoning at the doorstep br br trivia note for horror buffs keep an eye open for the demon mask that was also pivot piece of scenery in the brilliant japanese horror classic onibaba ',

 ' have had the opportunity to catch this independent film and was impressed with it despite the lack of excitement in the plot the acting was very good by everyone involved amy madigan played the part of guilt ridden mother who is tired yet well intentioned and determined to make up for her younger daughter condition yet in the process she has neglected her older sister who is more interested in playing with her savant syndrome sibling and living in world of escapism br br the men in the movie are very powerful in their secondary roles christopher lloyd in very understated role shows us why he has such versatility he plays teacher who is dedicated to his profession and literature research yet starved for meaningful relationship he and madigan connect very well in their scenes together yet both know nothing more can come from their friendship their wordless goodbye is nothing short of brilliant an acting lesson for aspiring performers br br and in small role fred savage is fun to watch br br you can tell why this movie was based on play it probably very good on stage on screen it not particularly exciting but it nonetheless very thoughtful and powerful in its subtleties ',
 ' still the definitive program about the second world war the world at war isn just long but also very informative the series contains 26 episodes each episode lasts for about 45 min and includes the events leading up to and following in the wake of the war most episodes are about the war in europe and there are several episodes about the war in the pacific other episodes include information about the wars in africa burma the atlantic and the home fronts of germany great britain united states and soviet union there is one episode that dedicated to the holocaust the series starts off with the episode new germany 1933 1939 and tells about the rise of the nazis in germany and german territorial gains prior to the outbreak of war the series ends with the episode remember the war influence in post war world remember is fitting episode to end this great program every episode begins with short introduction and then with opening credits the credits are accompanied by powerful music theme there are many fitting music pieces throughout the series each episode is like mini film the footage is fantastic and so is the way it was put together in addition some of the footage is in color the information included also makes the episodes memorable and entertaining br br the series was produced by jeremy isaacs for thames television uk commissioned in 1969 it took four years to produce such was the depth of its research the series was narrated by laurence olivier one of the most famous and revered actors of the 20th century the series interviewed leading members of the allied and axis campaigns including eyewitness accounts by civilians enlisted men officers and politicians amongst them albert speer karl donitz jimmy stewart bill mauldin curtis lemay lord mountbatten alger hiss toshikazu kase arthur harris charles sweeney paul tibbets traudl junge and historian stephen ambrose jeremy isaacs says in the making of the world at war that he sought to interview not necessarily the surviving big names but their aides and assistants the most difficult subject to locate and persuade to be interviewed according to isaacs was heinrich himmler adjutant karl wolff the latter admitted to witnessing large scale execution in himmler presence br br the world at war is often considered to be the definitive television history of the second world war some consider it the finest example of the documentary form in list of the 100 greatest british television programmes drawn up by the british film institute in 2000 voted for by industry professionals the world at war ranked 19th the program has everything that the viewer needs to know about the war after watching few episodes liked the series so much that tried to watch the remaining episodes one after the other ve seen some of them several times there are two other great documentary series that know of that may be of interest to the viewer one is called the great war 1964 that about world war the other is called cold war 1998 that about the cold war obviously ',
 ' have seen the sea within today and loved it the actors of the movie are wonderful specially javier bardem of course but thought that belã rueda would have better role lola dueã as clara segura and specially mabel rivera perform excellent interpretations and cannot forget celso bugallo and joan dalmau brother and father of the protagonist br br there are two technical aspects loved very much aguirresarobe photography and the score by amenã bar himself liked the song negra sombra dark shadow by luz casal with music of carlos nãºã ez br br in short think that the spanish academy should choose the sea within in order to compete in the oscar awards liked other spanish productions such as almodã³var bad education but amenã bar film is much better than them the sea within deserves all the awards ',
 ' m not huge fan of lucio fulci films most of his 80s gore films had their moments but often came across as second rate dario argento imitations with the exception of the entertaining zombi which was george romero imitation didn really enjoy them know italian horror often disregards the plot but the storyline and characters in his films were just far too thread bare even by the standards this is why don torture duckling surprised me its actually very well made film with an engrossing murder mystery its possibly the best giallo ever made only seriously rivaled by dario argento entries into the genre and unlike fulci previous giallo lizard in woman skin this never drags br br fulci direction here is quite good he keeps the story moving at good pace and maintains the viewer interest throughout also the conclusion to the mystery comes as complete surprise to the audience plus he adds some clever touches such as the upbeat soul music during particularly disturbing graveyard beating sequence overall the violence here is restrained and only used when necessary for the story the acting is good for the most part also full of familiar faces from 70s italian exploitation cinema both thomas milian and barbara bouchet are super cool throughout the only weak link is florinda bolkan whose performance is just far too over the top its the only laughable aspect of the film don torture duckling definitely comes with my recommendation and may be good introduction to the giallo subgenre as whole 8 10 ',

 ' rock star 2001 out of four br br by blake french br br rock star is the story of nobody who becomes propelled into fame only to realize living his dream is not the way he imagined it we have seen all this before in better movies but this human story does capture the world of rock and roll with brutally honest and insightful edge it garners recommendation because of its visualization of the atmosphere the script by crazy beautiful director john stockwell portrays the hard core universe with memorable images it doesn explain what it is about it shows us br br rock star originally titled metal god stars mark wahlberg as chris izzy cole pittsburgh office supplies salesperson who dreams of becoming bobby beers the fiery lead singer for the heavy metal rock group steel dragon although chris already sings for his own tribute rock group called blood pollution instead of writing his own songs he insists on performing only those by steel dragon and only in the exact way they perform them his group becomes irritated with chris obsessions and gives him the boot br br tthis devastates chris as well as his supportive parents and faithful girlfriend emily jennifer aniston from tv friends he then receives phone call it the steel dragon band they have seen chris tapes and want him to replace the recently fired lead singer in an instant chris rockets into the dizzying world of sudden stardom from the biggest rock fan to the biggest rock star unfortunately it not as rewarding as he expected br br ta true story inspired the rock star concept an ohio supply salesman tim ripper owens really did replace rob halford the lead singer in judas priest after initially singing for tribute band the rest of the film is probably fiction although most of what happens must represent the experiences of many other bands the film details the various ordeals of being rock star it explores the aspects of touring personality differences the danger of drug abuse and violence struggling relationships sexual freedom dishonesty and the extreme measures of the producers all to please the fans and keep popularity high br br have seen all of mark wahlberg movies and this is the first that has earned my affection wahlberg former singer model has made movies like fear boogie nights three kings and most recently tim burton lacking remake planet of the apes am starting to admire the young actor more and more although he has not performed in many successful films he has taken many chances and done variety of roles rock star is his best film to date can think of many actors who could have convincingly portrayed chris cole struggles and aspirations wahlberg truly makes rock star rock br br jennifer aniston lights up the screen as well she creates chemistry rich relationship with chris that induces audience participation it tragic of what happens to their relationship we care about these characters great deal br br during the film concert scenes director stephen herek who also directed holy man and the live action version of 101 dalmatians creates gripping atmosphere he captures the scenes with an intense urgency and raw unmistakable energy the musical numbers provide the film with the best most involving scenes br br unfortunately herek cannot sustain the energy and zest throughout at the three quarters mark he looses the spark as the movie becomes dull and unpleasant understand where the story needs to go in order to portray the negative side of fame but this movie loses everything it previously had going for it in almost famous much better film about rock and roll there is certain amount of interest and life in even the most sorrowful scenes here it feels as if the filmmakers lose their passion br br the message comes bit too late and suddenly in the story the film turns into morality tale that wants to provide us with sappy destination the filmmakers might as well stop everything appear on screen and say now audience the moral of the story isâ we understand the theme but it too instantaneous the personal discovery for chris must be gradual br br fortunately all of this happens in the last twenty five minutes of the film hardly enough to completely destroy an entire eighty five minutes of reasonably good feature rock star is not great movie see almost famous if you want remarkable film about rock and roll but for marky mark it a turning point in his career br br ',
 ' just found out before writing this review that komodo vs cobra and another movie called curse of the komodo were both directed by the same guy jim wynorski that might explain why they are films of nearly identical premises they both feature military governed island colonel whose concerned more about covering his tracks than the lives of his employees people racing to get to chopper that is conveniently lying in field somewhere on the island and giant komodo dragons created through genetic experiments running amok what differences are there well the intruders on the island are now capitalists wanting to expose the government secret and there a giant cobra on the island as well hence the title komodo vs cobra even though the conflict between the two monsters is hardly relevant to the story komodo vs cobra is more or less what you expect given its title and its channel origin the sci fi channel although every now and again you will find one that for one reason or another may appeal to you liked movie called komodo hardly doubt this one will br br komodo vs cobra is not only boring film but it also one of the least enthusiastic sci fi flicks ve seen in long time in some of these movies there is an air to them that indicates the filmmakers were giving at least certain level of effort but see very little here that indicated again by it just being rehash of curse of the komodo the cgi for the monsters look as if they came straight out of second rate video game the cinematography and misc en scene is poor the acting ranges from passable to poor the action scenes are dull and then there are some parts that are frankly put unforgivably bad see lot movies where person will shoot gun many times without reloading and can deal with this but in this movie where michael parã takes single thirty eight handgun and fires it approximately fifty times nonstop without reloading onceâ well at first laughed but even then it just became tiring that would be the action monster appears people scream parã fires nonstop without reloading his gun once throughout the entire picture and somebody gets eaten br br komodo vs cobra is very bad movie the only thing in the movie that screenplay she was given michelle borth managed to pull off surprisingly good performance and it just appalls me that an actress as good as her can get stuck in film as junky as this she obviously to jail from there however the film slows down lot and beast stable ends up being more of drama than the previous two films that not to say that there isn still plenty of action scorpion still spends lot of time in revenge mode and the film isn exactly short on general sleaze meiko kaji once again reprises her role as the sinister title character and it another understated almost wordless performance her screen presence is great however and she manages to have menacing presence despite being only small physically the plot structure for this film is similar to the other two in that it all builds into crescendo of revenge there are more people who have angered scorpion in this film than in the previous two so this section takes up fairly large part of the film there a few surreal  ' neil simon the odd couple set up model for many of his later plays felix unger and oscar madison were the unsuitably paired roommates in the original the former being picky and neat the latter being slovenly and loose simon would rewrite less successfully the play in the 1990s as the new odd couple with female roommates he made it mixed couple woman with her daughter and man in the goodbye girls he also gave it an additional twist in 1973 with the sunshine boys broadway hit starring jack alberson and sam levine as al lewis and willie clark the aged semi retired vaudevillians here the apartment problem is reduced to teaming of two men who can stand each other the 1976 film starred walter matthau as willie and george burns as al br br in actuality al probably does not think totally badly of willie willie is pathological on the subject of al first al had little habits such as accidentally spitting slightly when pronouncing words beginning with the letter and slightly jabbing willie with his index finger on stage secondly al retired when his wife died willie was not ready to retire and has been forcing his nephew and agent ben richard benjamin to try to get him jobs in commercials but willie can remember lines unless they are funny and keeps flubbing them so he rarely is able to stay to the end of rehearsal for commercial br br ben is asked to get the two back together for live scene of their most famous sketch on television show about american comedy he does bring al to see willie and the sparks begin flying as neither can figure out what the other is doing and this is just in rehearsal on top of that willie is insisting on changes minor ones but they throw off al such as saying enter when al knocks on the door the initial rehearsal is failure but ben manages to get them to the taping of the show the question is if they will complete the scene in the finished program or will willie wring al neck br br the three leads matthau burns and benjamin do very well with the one liners frequently reminiscent of vaudeville patter example chest pains m getting chest pains uncle willie every thursday come here and get chest pains so come on fridays benjamin strives to prove his deep affection for his uncle although matthau rough outer shell makes it difficult he only smooths down when he discusses the glory days of vaudeville matthau has little better grasp on reality at first than burns who seems senile by his repeating himself but in actuality matthau sense of rejection by the world that once applauded him make him less willing to behave properly burns is not senile he takes things slowly but he seems far happier in accepting his retirement br br call this final voyage of discovery for our modern lewis and clark al and willie transcend their old skits as they gradually end up realizing that they have more in common in their old age than they thought even the irascible willie admits that al may be to him pain in the ass but he was funny man br br burns was not the original choice for the part of al lewis supposedly dale of the team smith and dale jack benny was benny probably would have done good job but ill health forced him out he died in 1975 burns whose last involvement in any film was in the solid gold cadillac in 1956 as the narrator turned in such fine performance that he got the oscar for best supporting actor and was to have career in movies in the next decade in such films as oh god oh god you devil and going in style he died in 1996 age 100 having proved that he was more than just brilliant straight man for his wife gracie allan ',

 ' before seeing this was merely expecting another mediocre soft core copy of the much imitated emmanuelle series starring sylvia kristel it was really surprising how good this one turned out to be it actually has story and it is very romantic indeed what makes yellow emanuelle so good is it leading heroine the beautiful and exotic chai lee she plays her character emy wong so sweetly that the viewer just has to feel something for her when her dreams crash down around her emy wong is much respected doctor statuesque with regal quality she comes from an important old family where ancient customs are still practiced emy will remain virgin until she is married to man she has never met the beautiful doctor seems ok with this arranged marriage it is simply how it is done in her world however she does not plan on meeting and falling in love with the british pilot who ends up under her care in the hospital where she works emy decides to do away with custom and she gives herself to her western man but only after very long courtship as doctor wong is anything but an easy woman her pilot george is good guy and promises to marry emy so that she doesn lose her respectability and place in her rigid society neither one counts on third party one ilona staller who destroys their relationship through series of vicious games emy is made to believe that she has been abandoned by her man that he only played game with her in order to sleep with her her place in society is gone she has been debased the film takes surprisingly dramatic and depressing turn as this proud elegant woman gives up her career as well as sweet relationship with her caring father and succumbs to life of drinking and prostitution was surprised to find myself so engrossed in this operatically tragic tale was on the edge of my seat when george blows back into town and unknowingly walks into hotel where his beautiful emy is working as prostitute classic drama imagine many viewers were bit frustrated by all this drama one would expect lots of sex and nudity here but there is not much and when there is it is totally non exploitative and very artsy and soft core if you are fan of the first emmanuelle with sylvia kristel than you most likely will appreciate this lesser known classic was especially impressed by the extra attention to details the whole segment where emy takes george to her fathers house on the island is really nice her father shows george and the viewer his impressive collection of bonzai trees he has whole miniature forest built out of these amazing trees totally unexpected after catching it on late night cable tv years ago spent much time searching the internet for copy of the film when finally got it found that the video version was longer more sex no more melodrama for the dvd release there is subplot about george suddenly keeling over with some unknown deadly disease actually preferred the cable version better am glad that this rare gem has been released finally on dvd must also mention the beautiful cinematography and the bizarre and catchy 70 soundtrack while watching this one you just get the feeling that you are watching something very rare and quite special recommend it to thoughtful viewers who don need sex and violence to maintain their interest ',

dysfunctional texas family that includes big brother kyle who is insecure weak wounded very alcoholic played by robert stack in very touching vulneable performance and his sluty sister marylee played in an extreme manner by dorothy malone ms malone performance is telegraphed to us via her eyes which she uses to show us her emotions which mostly consist of lust for rock hudson and jealousy for lauren bacall malone is the only actress ve ever seen in movies who enters room eyes first now don get me wrong her performance to say the least is an absolute hoot and is one of the supreme camp acting jobs of the 1950 but it is also terrible because as likeable and attractive as malone is she not very good actress and she not capable of subtly or shading her performace is of one note she does get to do wicked mambo and in great montage as unloving daddy played by the always good robert keith falls to his death climbing staircase sirk mixes it up with an almost mad malone doing orgasmic dance as she undresses stack who should have won an oscar malone who won the award but shouldn have are the real stars of the film the ones who set all the hysteria both sexual otherwise in motion while the real stars of the film hudson bacall fade to grey brown which are the colors that they are mainly costumed in hudson who was better actor then given credit for plays the childhood best friend of stack and the stalked love interest of malone who moans groans over rock through most of the film but hudson wants no part of her and instead is in love with bacall who is married to stack no one is very happy no one is happy for very long the stack bacall marriage falls apart big time after year and stack pretty much drinks himself into oblivion because he thinks he is sterile and can give bacall baby to prove that he a man sirk who was very intelligent man and had long fascinating career both in films and theatre in germany ended his hollywood career at universal in the mid 1950 with series of intense vividly colored women movies or melodramas although they were mainly adapted from medicore or trashy source material in sirk hands they became masterpieces of the genre sirk had wonderful sense of color design which he brought to play in these films filling his wide screen spaces with characters who played out their emotional lives among weird color combinations lighting make believe shadows and lots of mirroed reflections in written the characters are always peeking out of windows listening at doors or sneaking around so in the end after much violence an accidental murder miscarriage more sirk ends the movie with final startling scene of reborn and reformed malone in man tailored suit sitting at desk foundling miniature oilwell ',

 ' based on the true story of two young americans who sold national secrets to the soviet union in the height of the cold war falcon and the snowman wants to be both suspenseful and philosophical and winds up falling short in both departments it less le carrã than who cares br br timothy hutton stars as christopher boyce former seminarian who disgusted by watergate and the middle class values around him is probably the wrong guy to be hired by company running spy satellites for the cia sean penn plays his drug dealing pal daulton lee who makes himself boyce courier delivering secret files to the soviet embassy in mexico city an offbeat synth jazz score lack of sympathy or emotional attachment for anyone and lots of scenes of guys getting angry in rooms all combine to deaden what could have decent moral dilemma thriller br br it really penn movie despite the second billing his character gets to talk turkey with the russians while hutton plays with his pet falcon hutton looks like they woke him up five minutes before they called action with penn it a crapshoot whether you get brilliant performance or an over the top one here it a bit of both but more the latter especially in the second half when lee switches from coke to heroin he screeches he snorts he crashes russian embassy parties he gets pummeled with telephone books he spits at himself in mirror big goober he must have been saving for paparazzi don know who my friends are anymore he cries out it exhausting to just watch him br br penn seems to have modeled lee somewhat on dustin hoffman ratso rizzo from midnight cowboy complete with overly nasal line readings and constant eye shifting john schlesinger directed this film as well as midnight cowboy but he seems to have had another hoffman film in mind the graduate throwing up scene after scene of boyce and lee poolside trying to decide how to live their lives in their gilded cage too bad no one suggested plastics br br from the opening shots news footage of american decline juxtaposed with boyce and his bird falcon makes clear it is message movie though the message itself is far from clear probably because the characters never come into focus is boyce supposed to be an idealist or is he just mercenary hutton and schlesinger don seem to know which makes it harder for us meanwhile opportunities to establish some suspense like boyce stealing documents from the top secret black vault where he works or lee playing games with the russians are interrupted by jump cuts to scenes of the pair with their families and friends it the normalcy of the story that schlesinger finds interesting but it the least interesting aspect for us br br good stuff it interesting to see film that works the 1970s vibe so early as this one referencing maria muldaur and tang dorian harewood memorable in full metal jacket has nice turn as boyce paranoid colleague gene who shows boyce how to make margaritas with shredder but has some serious nam issues beneath his partying exterior macon mccalman is also fine in totally different way as the no nonsense boss who gives boyce his high security job david suchet as the russian embassy official who deals with lee makes for fascinating blend of menace and amiability br br but falcon and the snowman stands or falls on the the question of the two title characters and neither the actors nor schlesinger are able to mine much in the way of answers worse after more than two hours in their alternately feral and catatonic company you don really want answers you just want those credits to roll ',

 ' before start my review here is quick lesson in australian slang which may help you with viewing the movie and understanding some of the other reviews from australia and overseas br br in australian slang thongs are pair of rubber sandals not to be confused with the same american word that pertains to butt revealing underwear stubbies are brand of australian short stubby is small can sized bottle of beer and stubby holder is foam insulator for small bottle of beer br br if you love black comedies about smalltime criminals then you will love this movie unfortunatley lot of people on imdb with weak stomachs and no appreciation of dark humour have reviewed this movie which unfortunately makes this movie appear to be more mediocre than what it is lot of reviewers have also compared it to lock stock and pulp fiction while it is the same genre it is completely different and original style br br lot of reviewers have also panned this movie for using heath ledger characters dead brother to open and guide the narrative for this movie without watching the movie closely enough to realise that his brother was killed by the same villain that wishes to kill heaths character this is explained midway through the movie but not clearly enough for most to understand br br this movie is also reminiscent of lock stock and reservoir dogs in that it is the director writers debut feature and for debut feature it rates as well as these two movies as matter of fact like lock stock and reservoir dogs rate this movie as 10 10 for director writers debut unfortunately unlike tarantino and ritchie jordan fails to live up to expectations in his subsequent movies like ned kelly br br this movie is one that you should definitely add to your dvd collection and is one that holds up to several viewings quite easily ',

years so production began and very small bits and pieces on the shoot and the actors involved were released until the shoot wrapped then the announcement of title change no longer would this new sequel be titled slumber party massacre iv but cheerleader massacre instead was bit disappointed but having different title would be very small price to pay for film had waited so long to happen was still extremely intrigued and on the edge of my seat to see it br br maybe month ago some very advanced copies of the film were released to some extremely lucky viewers who got to see the film months before its release date few reviews leaked on the net and judging by them began to become apprehensive on jim wynorski cheerleader massacre br br tonight got to see the film for the first time in full length and am still scratching my head as read in another review cheerleader massacre is definitely not new installment in the slumber party massacre series but slasher flick all on its own and bad one at that br br before get into the specifics of the film let me first state what an enormous fan of jim wynorski films am always thought him to be true camp genius with winner almost every time yes his movies are made on shoestring budgets and don contain the most top notch acting around but they re fun nonetheless they are what they are campy movies you watch when you want to have good time from sorority house massacre ii to hard to die to chopping mall jim has produced the goods on more than one occasion one of the reasons why was excited that this film would be his latest project br br cheerleader massacre does not in my opinion reflect any of the films had seen this director writer create in the past firstly the production was extremely inexpensive and the film was actually shot on videotape something had never seen jim do before the actors were mediocre to say the least and the story is almost laughable the killer is also extremely stupid and reminds you more of your cuddly old grandpa rather than an escaped lunatic br br of course the film is littered with female nudity this is jim wynorski movie we re talking about folks but some of the boob shots seen here almost seem like they were done for time there is an extremely long shower scene containing the cheerleading coach that seems to go on forever and it greatly reflects shower scene in jim sorority house massacre ii the girl even bathes herself almost in the exact same way br br cheerleader massacre is also extremely cliched to say the least the opening scene is literally something we ve all seen in hundreds of past slasher flicks guy and girl making out on the verge of consummating their relationship when you guessed it they re hacked to pieces br br brinke stevens who ve never really considered to be tremendous actress in the first place also gives one of her stiffest and forced performances in her small cameo we re talkin possible cue cards here she recalls some incidents her character endured by the killer seen here twenty years ago to the police while footage of the original slumber party massacre plays why was footage from the original film used if it was definitely not new spm have no idea there is also two explosions seen in this movie that am almost certain were recycled from other films br br not only does this film recycle footage from past films but it also recycles the scores from other films as well some of the music used in humanoids from the deep which was also recycled prior for the coroner can be heard throughout the entire film there are at least two more as well that cannot identify but am certain have been used before br br after sitting through this film horrendous acting ridiculous story non existent gore special effects and camcorder like quality am having some serious concerns toward mister wynorski career has the man who delighted audiences with films in the past finally lost his niche only time will tell oh and let not forget his newest film new installment in the sorority house massacre films now titled final exam think m seeing pattern here ',

 ' some of the background details of this story are based very very loosely on real events of the era in which this was placed the story combines some of the details of the famous leopold and loeb case along with bit of aimee semple mcpherson br br the story begins with two mothers shelley winters and debbie reynolds being hounded as they leave courtroom the crowd seems most intent on doing them bodily harm as their sons were just convicted of heinous thrill crime one person in the crowd apparently slashes winters hand as they make their way to waiting car br br soon after they arrive home they begin getting threatening phone calls so reynolds suggests they both move to the west coast together and open dance school the dance school is success and they cater to incredibly obnoxious parents who think their child is the next shirley temple one of the parents of these spoiled kids is multimillionaire who is quite smitten with reynolds and they begin dating life appears very good but when the threatening phone calls begin again winters responds by flipping out behaving like she nearing psychotic break and she retreats further and further into religion listening on the radio to sister alma almost constantly again and again you see winters on edge and it ultimately culminates in very bad things won say more as it might spoil this suspenseful and interesting film br br in many ways this film is lot like the bette davis and joan crawford horror films of the 1960s like whatever happened to baby jane straight jacket and the nanny while none of these are exactly intellectual fare on kitsch level they are immensely entertaining and fun the writing is very good and there are some nice twists near the end that make it all very exciting winters is great as fragile and demented lady and reynolds plays one of the sexiest 39 year olds ve ever seen plus she can really really dance br br my only concern about all this is that some might find winters hyper religiosity in the film bit tacky like cheap attack on christianity at first felt that way but when you meet sister alma she seems sincere and is not mocked so took winters religious zeal as just sign of craziness which assume is all that was intended br br by the way this film is packaged along with whoever slew auntie roo another shelley winters horror film from 1971 both are great fun and quite over the top  ' forest of the damned starts out as five young friends brother sister emilio richard cambridge ally sophie holland along with judd daniel maclagan molly nicole petty andrew david hood set off on week long holiday in the middle of nowhere their words not mine anyway before they know it they re deep in forest emilio clumsily runs over woman frances da costa along with badly injured person to add to their problems the van they re travelling in won start they can get any signals on their mobile phones they need to find help quickly so molly judd wander off in the hope of finding house as time goes by darkness begins to fall it becomes clear that they are not alone that there is something nasty lurking in the woods br br this english production was written directed by johannes roberts having looked over several other comments reviews both here on the imdb across the internet forest of the damned seems to divide opinion with some liking it other not personally it didn do much for at all the script is credited on screen to roberts but here on the imdb it lists joseph london with additional screenplay material whatever that means the film is your basic backwoods slasher type thing like the texas chainsaw massacre 1974 with your basic stranded faceless teenage victims being bumped off but uses the interesting concept of fallen angels who roam the forest kill people for reason that are never explained to any great deal of satisfaction then there stephen played by the ever fantastic tom savini who is never given any sort of justification for what he does is he there to get victims for the angels if so why did he kill andrew by bashing his head in the story is very loose it never felt like proper film the character are poor the dialogue not much better the lack of any significant story makes it hard to get into it or care about anything that going on having said that it moves along at reasonable pace there are couple of decent scenes here br br director johannes doesn do anything special it not particularly stylish or flash film to look at there a few decent horror scenes the tom savini character is great whenever he on screen although why didn he hear judd breaking the door down with an axe while escaping with molly it a shame when he gets killed off there are couple of decent gore scenes here someone has their head bashed in there a decapitation someone gets shotgun blasted someone throat is bitten out someones lips are bitten off someone is ripped in half there is also fair amount of full frontal female nudity not that it helps much br br technically forest of the damned is ok it reasonably well made but nothing overly special or eye catching this was shot in england wales it quite odd to see an english setting for very american themed backwards horror the acting is generally pretty poor save for savini who deserves to be in better than this horror author shaun hutson has an embarrassing cameo at the end proves he should stick to writing rather than acting br br forest of the damned was pretty poor horror film it seems to have fans out there so maybe m missing something but it not film have much fondness for apart from one or two decent moments there not much here to recommend ',

 ' watching john cassavetes film opening night was reminded of something that quentin tarantino said once in an interview about personal experience in being creator of art or acting he referred to an example of say if he ran over dog while on his way to act in play that it wouldn be the end of his life but that it would affect him and that without doubt he would have to bring that experience with him on stage even if it was light comedy otherwise as he said what am doing couldn help but think of his words when watching gena rowland character myrtle gordon who for almost whole week or so goes through very similar scenario there is more to this in cassavetes film of course since it about how the theater works around star actress what emotion and human nature mean when looking at playing character and how one lives when all one has like myrtle gordon is the theater br br near the beginning of the film after exiting performance myrtle is signing autographs and one such fan named nancy comes up to her favorite star and pours her heart out to myrtle it a touching little moment but it doesn last as she has to get in the car pouring rain and all she then watches in horror as the girl who stood right next to the car as it drove off gets hit by another car in an auto accident she not sure really what happened but then finds out the next day that in fact the girl did die from the hit from then on she sort of stunned by this even after she thinks it out of her system at first this shows in small ways like when she rehearses scene with her fellow actor played by cassavetes and can seem to stand being hit she blames it on the lack of depth in the character the writer what do you think the play lacks hope says myrtle but then nancy starts to show up to her an apparition that to myrtle is all to real until she suddenly gone br br cassavetes as in the past films is after search for what it means to have emotion to really feel about something and feel it or the lack thereof and how it affects others around the person this isn exactly new ground for rowlands who previously played woman on the edge of herself in woman under the influence in that case because of alcohol nor would it be alien territory for costar ben gazzara who just came off starring in killing of chinese bookie but the actors express everything essential to their characters in every scene cassavetes doesn tell them how to get from to in scene and he doesn need to there a mood in cassavetes film that trumps the sometimes grungy camera work you know myrtle for example should be content somehow even if it isn with the plot but she haunted and is unsatisfied with her character lack of depth and the tone of the play aging who goes to see that she asks the playwright and it starts to affect those around her too br br the question soon becomes though not what is the usual conventional dramatist would make the conflict will she be able to go on stage will the show go on this isn important for cassavetes even if it there as is the question will she be alright perhaps going through such grueling play as the second woman could help her work out her personal demons and her losing her grip on reality seeing sara and attacking her in front of total strangers who wonder what the hell is going on or will the play lack of hope strain everything else wrong with her the depths rowlands makes with her character are intense and harrowing and that it expected doesn mean it any duller than woman under the influence if anything it just as good as that film at being honest about person in this profession and consequently the other performances are just as true from gazarra to nancy played by subtle laura johnson cassavetes answers to his own posed questions aren easy br br one of the real thrills of opening night along with seeing great actors performing an amazing script is to see cassavetes take on the theater the way he does we see the play performed and it apparently real play and we only know slightly what it about when we see the actors on the stage performing it we wax and wane between being involved in what melodrama is going on relationship scuffling and affairs and the occasional slap and domestic violence and the improvisation of the actors wondered watching how much really was improvised how much cassavetes allowed for the other actors to do in the scenes where myrtle starts to go loopy or in the climax is completely smashed he on the stage too so it must have been something for them to work it out beforehand and let what would happen happen br br it funny startling chilling and edge of your seat stuff some of the best theater on film scenes ever put in movie and we see the lines between actor on stage actor on film actor with actor blur together wonderfully opening night is potent drama that is full of frank talk about death and madness reality and fiction where the love is between people and really finally what does acting mean ',
