 ' next to the slasher films of the 1970s and 80s ones about the walking dead were probably the second most popular horror sub genre while slasher films had black christmas and halloween to get the whole thing going zombie flicks had george romero dead films and unsurprisingly soon after the success of his first two in the series other directors wanted to cash in lot of italian directors were especially interested such as lucio fulci who brought us zombie year after romero dawn of the dead known as zombi in italy and some other countries and it was there that fulci film was known as zombi 2 apart from the walking dead it has no relation to romero film but is good film in it own right it was big success in europe and 9 years later sequel was born br br pros lots of beautiful lush scenery awesome score the acting isn exactly good but the cast is game and seem to be enjoying the experience after kind of slow start the pace moves along like that of an action flick plenty cheese and unintentional hilarity for bad film lovers good job on the make up effects lots of blood and some decent gore br br cons virtually plot less nothing you haven already seen before blatantly rips off some things from the first couple of return of the living dead films cardboard characters hasn aged too well due to the bad 1980s rock music not that m saying all rock music of that period is bad clothing and overall feel of the movie br br final thoughts first of all this is not true sequel to fulci cult classic in fact don know if it was ever meant to pick up where that film left off for those that don know fulci was ill during production and ended up leaving and was replaced with bruno mattei mattei films are pretty laughable but like this film many are good campy fun and that all this film really is just something to watch for fun br br my rating 3 5 5 so bad it good rating 2 5 serious rating ',
 ' first saw this film over 25 years ago on british tv and have only just caught up with it again last week on dvd copy bought off ebay had remembered the musical sequences the colour and the gorgeous fashion plate poses and clothes but the plot is weaker than the earlier anna neagle michael wilding film spring in park lane and maytime doesn stand up so well to the passage of the years but michael wilding is joy in the film charming funny debonair appears to be having great fun and on top of his form worth watching for him alone anna neagle appears little matronly beside him and little too old for the part she plays but by the end of the 1940 their film partnership was well established with the cinema going public spring in park lane had been top hit for 1947 and big money maker in his autobiography wilding wrote at length of his great regard for herbert wilcox the director and instigator of this london series of films ',
 ' saw this movie again as an assignment for my management class were to mainly comment on the different management styles and ideas on quality of the product did rent this one back in the eighties and remember it to be good but not great movie ve always liked michael keaton style and delivery he was perfect fit for the movie br br am surprised to see some of the low ratings for this movie grant you yes it no oscar winner but it does have decent comedic value it more of subtle comedy rather than all out comedy farce also find some of those that felt this was an inaccurate film on cultural and business differences beg to differ grant you again that there are lot of generalities and dramatizations but then again this is hollywood film not documentary from what ve read about differences between automakers on both sides of the pacific at that time many of the principle ideas were accurate for the time br br some of the basic differences were that japanese workers made to feel as part of the company as whole teamwork was emphasized they perhaps made the company above all else where american workers had more of management verses labor type of relationship the individual was more important than the company ll probably get some hate email over that comment m sure br br another difference was how quality was viewed and whose responsibility it was to fix in many japanese plants defects or problems are examined and fixed at the time it is discovered rather as one character in the movie put it it was the dealers meaning car dealer problem br br many of these things are probably dated but m sure some are still around as many us car makers are still struggling to keep up with the japanese if one is more interested in the subject of american european and japanese automakers can recommend book that studies this subject in more detail and was done around the same time period the book is called the machine that changed the world by james womack daniel jones and daniel roos it about study of automakers during and before the time period that this movie covers parts are bit dry but think you ll find that it backs up much the movie also ',

 ' leland follows the story of leland fitzgerald ryan gosling disaffected teenager who has apparently murdered severely retarded peer the brother of girl he was dating the issue is not whether he did it or not â leland admits to it straight away â but rather why interestingly rather than crime drama leland becomes character story examining why people do what they do â not necessarily the easiest ground to till br br and leland features the required indie group of screwed up people aside from the title character there also pearl don cheadle who is his teacher at the juvenile correctional facility and who sees straight off that leland is different we meet leland distant and egotistical father kevin spacey in an extended cameo who never seems emotionally stirred in any way by what his son did but the real flavorings come out when we immerse ourselves in the pollards the family of the retarded child first there leland girlfriend becky jena malone drug addict who can keep herself clean her sister julie michelle williams perhaps the most normal person in the film who merely seeks to get away from it all and allen harris chris klein young man who lives with the pollards and is julie boyfriend lastly there ryan michael welch whom all the others call goofball who cannot communicate and seems barely aware of his surroundings br br leland focuses primarily on its eponymous protagonist but the movie slowly â occasionally too slowly â burrows into everyone lives asking the chief question why do people do what they do while leland discusses it openly in journal pearl allows him to keep examining notions of good and bad and personal responsibility all the characters at some point in the film face moment where they must make the fundamental choice of their own happiness or another perhaps the most basic choice any human can make and the movie takes good look at what goes into those choices and the consequences of them br br in the beginning of the film you re simply struck by the depth of the cast spacey cheadle gosling michelle williams even chris klein â these are people who for the most part tend to elevate any film they are in and putting them all together makes for heady brew for space in the middle the film seems to stall sputtering along as it unfolds it looks for while as if it will be content merely to ask questions and not supply any answers but when we arrive at the home stretch and the movie starts to hit its stride and come together leland becomes quietly powerful piece of film making leland explanation of the world and his actions in the end bring every story into focus and all the investment you ve made in the film pays off br br saying ryan gosling is excellent is like saying sunny day is nice at this point in his career it redundant â this is one of the finest young actors working today and it is pleasure to watch him craft what could have been an unlikable character into thought provoking protagonist gosling employs such subtlety here that it hardly seems like acting he has to face off most of the film opposite don cheadle whom we know has the goods and he not only holds his own he elevates cheadle game as well cheadle himself is in top notch form imbuing pearl with fully rounded humanity â for good and bad spacey is kind of one note but that the character and he handles it excellently was surprised by chris klein with this level of acting thought he would be buried in the mix but he gives probably the turn of his career so far terrific work all around br br leland is bit of downer and again it draggy in spots but it finishes strongly and leaves lasting impact on the viewer on this one anyway there also subtle commentary on racism in the film in leland first day in juvenile hall class he the only white person in the room that like much of the movie is very effectively handled wouldn go so far as to call this required viewing â some might find it too slow or too odd â but thought it was one of the better films ve seen in while far stronger and more satisfying than most fare out there d recommend it â with the above caveats â if for no other reason than to watch gosling further perfect his craft ',

 ' on the heels of the well received and beloved coming of age film classic concerning the lives of teenagers as they headed into adulthood george lucas american graffiti we have cooley high an adaptation of sorts by one eric monte co creator of the popular 1970 cbs sitcom good times br br cooley high was and is viewed as black version of american graffiti instead of central california as in american graffiti we have the black slum of chicago cabrini green as the backdrop for the story here instead of america in 1962 cooley high is situated in 1964 the movie stars welcome back kotter lawrence hilton jacobs and glynn turman as the movie main protagonists and its main characters it has garrett morris playing the principal who tries to keep jacobs and turman characters named coceise and preach out of trouble great deal of the time br br you know would like to say that cooley high is worthy comparison piece to american graffiti or that it is great film on its own but can the problem lies with the fact that the producers of the film couldn or wouldn hide the sad underside of black life in america having the film in the cabrini green part of chicago doesn help things br br neither does the crass gross attempts at humor here when coceise is looking for letter of intent from college he finds his little brother has thrown down toilet when the gang visits the chicago zoo one of the gang named pooter has manure thrown on him by an ape when the turman character preach is being chased by two hoodlums in the school hangout dirty and depressing place to eat food in much less meet people at he opens the door of the girls bathroom while girl is relieving herself as he escapes through the window of the same bathroom the high school the homes of the characters the bathrooms just about everywhere in the film displays the unfortunate look of urban decay and poverty br br if that wasn enough there was the rough display of humor in the film the use of violence and profanity in the film cooley high may be an coming of age film but it is hard and rough coming of age film with little or none of the wit and liking of the use of nostalgia that made people like and appreciate american graffiti so much br br motown records had hand in making the film the company music was part of the film soundtrack but even here you get sense of same old same old as one has heard these songs before million times over not that they weren great songs within themselves but black music of that time period was more than just motown especially in chicago the song nearing the end of the movie by the spinners c cameron was not all that impressive there have been better motown ballads that have been done by better motown artists than cameron without question br br the last part of the film showing where the characters went to pay homage to the film cooley high aimed to be american graffiti it shows that preach an intelligent but underachieving student went to hollywood and became successful television writer eric monte may have patterned himself as turman character the last shot of film show preach running away from coceise funeral held on dark rainy afternoon and back ',

get within 100 of someone as beautiful as maclaine but in this hollywood movie it the other way around maclaine is absolutely nuts about frankie boy but he couldn care less sinatra plays his cool shtick much too often in his movies and it is rarely credible dean martin is kind of miscast he isn miscast as card player but rather because of the accent which simply doesn suit him maclaine is charming as ever but she plays caricature and this reliance on caricatures is one of the basic problems with the film the main characters are all some sort of stereotypes out of bad or seen it all before movies and cheap novels frankie is the cool cat who comes back to town to get all the women and he couldn care less about his writing which predictably eventually garners recognition martin is sleazy but friendly card player maclaine is the dumb but very likable bimbo frankie blond love interest is snotty literary expert frankie brother is the successful guy who married into his wife business and has lousy marriage and so on clichã br br the story contains couple of coincidences which are little too far fetched for my taste frankie just happens to bump into his niece in locale his niece just happens to be meters away from her daddy when the latter kisses his secretary for the first time and then there is the awful stupid ending br br in it drunk guy bent on killing frankie boy somehow manages to find him in carnival of all places the place is utterly crowded with the typical noise and chaos plus it happening in the evening and yet the guy somehow finds frankie in spite of being drunk as doorknob and shoots at him but guess who he kills maclaine she jumps in front of the bullet to save frankie clichã which comic book writers might cringe at this utterly pathetic over dramatic and annoying ending certainly cannot please any even semi intelligent viewer and this happens on the same day that maclaine and sinatra got married the writer of this nonsense seems to have read crappy dime novels his whole life how else is the writing of this movie to be explained there is even card game in which brawl ensues with frankie martin vs some clichã caricatures out of the writer vivid imagination it was like damn western suddenly another dumb thing is the way sinatra was crazy about the boring snotty nosed bimbo and pretty much ignored maclaine as the movie progresses we find out that sinatra finds maclaine to be too dumb for him just as the blond bimbo finds sinatra to be too low class for her there is certain snobbism and disdain to be detected in the script regarding maclaine maclaine is treated as worthless by everyone while the blond bimbo is treated as princess and an intellectual the ironic truth is that the latter character comes off as rather dumb and not at all as intellectual her behaviour comments and opinions are mostly clichã silly confused pretentious and primitive at least maclaine character knows that she maclaine is dumb there is another irony that didn fail to notice sinatra had trouble finding an ending for his latest story much like the writer of this movie and that why he came up with the corny crappy finale br br the film basically has solid cast and the photography is nice but the script though sometimes okay relies to heavily on silly nonsense instead of on reality based characters and events br br if you re interested in reading my biographies of shirley maclaine and other hollywood intellectuals contact me by mail ',

only occasionally manifest rather she seems to have slight golden glow yes yeats br br the locations gave us view of london that is welcome departure from the usual londonscapes the catherine character is so powerful and menacing that thank my lucky stars that our paths never crossed wouldn have had chance br br the original basic instinct attempts at censorship must briefly comment on the original 1992 film set in san francisco beautiful city worthy of this film it is outstanding from the music to the locations to the sets and so on paul verhoven pulled striking performances out of the cast and crew br br that the main baddie was woman did not escape the scrutiny of bay area gay and lesbian activist groups attempts at censorship were vehemently denied swell these philosophical pygmies demanded editorial control over the script insisting on re writes that would promote their political and psychiatrically driven agendas example sanctimoniously alleging sexism and misogyny they demanded that the lead role be switched from bad girl to bad guy br br on locations in san francisco the gentle tolerant activists did their best to sabotage filming of the scenes with noise flashing lights and other tactics the executive producers mario kassar and andrew vajna vowed to fight any efforts to restrict the artistic freedom guaranteed in our democracy and obtained restraining orders against the disruptive tactics br br blowback thanks to the fulminating activists the film got huge national press coverage millions of dollars worth of free advertising their calls for viewers to boycott the film resulted in backlash that had customers waiting in long lines wherever the film was launched it also received widespread critical acclaim it was in the words of the reptilian hackett in network big titted hit sorry gentle reader just couldn resist that one yes it a gibe br br in conclusion believe that both basic instinct 1 and 2 with their brilliant musical scores aesthetics and acting are works of art br br that deserve protection under our constitution ',

 ' most of the bad reviews on this website blame hood of the living dead for one or more of the following reasons 1 it is low budget movie with virtually no acting 2 it was so bad it made me laugh 3 it is something could do myself won even discuss the first point because it is very subjective matter whether you like low budget and independent stuff or not must say however that still fail to understand people renting such movie as hood of the living dead and then looking surprised when they realize it is not as polished and cute as romantic comedy with lindsay lohan or matthew mc conaughey as for the second point really don see what so wrong with laughing personally like to laugh and love movies that make me to be they comedies or horror flicks when in hammerhead saw this girl stepping into puddle and the shark man came out of it to eat her just cracked up and was grateful that the director made such stupid scene and gave me ten seconds of pure fun honestly laughing just makes me feel good while it seems that many people writing reviews see it as bad bad thing if you only want to feel sad and scared while watching movie hood of the living dead and low budget flicks are definitely not for you but please don come and tell us that you find them laughable we already know it this is most probably why we decided to watch the movie in first place however it is the third point that leaves totally baffled just several years ago people were lining up out of theaters to see blair witch project which is way more rudimentary boring plot less and bad acted movie than hood of the living dead and takes itself way too seriously too moreover half million people go on youtube every day to see the short films of lonelygirl15 which is certainly something everyone with cute girlfriend room and webcam could do not to talk about all of the even more amateurish videos you can find there why don people blame those clips for bad acting and non existing plot think it is one of the best things of our times that everyone with affordable technology and bunch of friends can make their own movies and share them with people that have similar interests and feel certain admiration for people who spend their weekends with their friends making honestly bad yet refreshing piece of trash like this rather than shopping at the mall or playing video games alone leave aside your biases and your desire to sound like smart film critic by attacking movies and you ll see that hood of the living dead can bring you almost as much fun as it did to its makers if you have taste christ vampyre slayer and habit ',

 ' had mixed feelings for les valseuses 1974 written and directed by bertrand blier when started watching it but ended up liking it would not call it vulgar dumb and dumber is vulgar the sweetest thing is both vulgar and unforgivably stupid would call it shocking and offensive can understand why many viewers especially the females would not like or even hate it it is the epitome of misogyny or so it seems and the way two antiheroes treat every woman they meet seems unspeakable but the more think of it the more realize that it somehow comes off as delightful little gem am fascinated how blier was able to get away with it the movie is very entertaining and highly enjoyable it is well written the acting by all is first class and the music is sweet and melancholic actually when think of it two buddies had done something good to the women they came across to they prepared woman in the train the lovely docile blonde brigitte fossey who started her movie career with one of the most impressive debuts in renã clã ment forbidden games 1952 at age 6 for the meeting with her husband whom she had not seen for two months they found man who was finally able to get frigid marie ange miou miou exited and satisfied they enlightened and educated young and very willing isabelle huppert in one of her early screen appearances their encounter with jeanne moreau elevates this comedy to the tragic level in short am not sure d like to meet gã rard depardieu jean claude and patrick dewaere pierrot in real life and invite them over for dinner but had good time watching the movie and two hours almost flew it was never boring ',

 ' find it heart warming and inspiring that the writing team behind such hopelessly mainstream hollywood movies like indiana jones and the temple of doom american graffiti and howard the duck would begin their career with low budget exploitation horror film like this perhaps as testament to the talent that would earn willard hyuck and gloria katz an oscar nomination later in their respective careers messiah of evil has potential but sadly becomes frustrating exactly because it can muster the film making prowess to pull it off br br the premise involves young girl who travels to small coastal town in search for her painter father who went missing while back it doesn take long for the fragmented narrative to abandon all hope and dive headlong in disjointed absurdity and for while it works admirably well to the point where you begin thinking that maybe messiah of evil needs to be reclaimed from the schlocky gutter of 70 exploitation as an example of artful mystery horror br br the surreal non sequiturs keep piling on as the daughter stumbles upon young couple in seedy hotel room who are in town to conduct research on the local legend of the blood moon scruffy and half mad alcoholic played by the great elisha cook jr in perhaps the best scene of the movie who warns her about her father only to be reportedly found dead in an alley eaten by dogs little later the blind old lady that owns the local art gallery and who has inexplicably removed all of her father paintings from the shop and last but not least retarded murderous squirrel eating albino br br part of the movie charm is precisely this brand of bargain basement artsy surrealism that defies logic and genre conventions every step of the way whereas with lynch it is obviously the mark of talented creator with messiah of evil the boundaries between the intentional the unintentional and the didn really expect it to come out this way but it good enough wrap scene blur hopelessly br br take for example the double narration that flows in and out of the picture in drug addled feverish stream of consciousness way one coming from the daughter as she wanders from place to place in search for her father and the other narrated by her father voice as she reads his diary br br while we re still talking about living dead picture messiah of evil is different and only loosely one at least with current preconceptions of what zombie movie is supposed to be the origin of the living dead here is 100 year old curse bestowed upon the town by mysterious dark stranger who came from the woods one day in the meantime hyuck finds time for snippets of mass consumption criticism in flesh eating supermarket scene that predates dawn of the dead by good number of years you can hear the mst3k line already man is dead only his capitalist food tins remain and nicely thought but poorly executed similar scene in movie theater br br generally think that the surreal works in careful well measured doses how is the absurd to work if it not hidden within the perfectly normal hyuck seems to just smear it all over the picture and by doing so dangerously overplays his hand when the albino for example picks up girl hitching her way to town and eats squirrel in front of her you can almost imagine the director winking meaningfully at the audience amused and satisfied with his own hijinks br br the general film making level is also pretty low after the half way mark the pace becomes muddled and the story tiresome and evidently going nowhere and not particularly fast either add to that the choppy editing average acting and hyuck general inability to capture true atmosphere the empty streets of coastal town are criminally misused and d file messiah under missed opportunity but still grindhouse afficionados will find enough to appreciate even though it not particularly gory trashy or sleazy ',
 ' in the wasteland that hollywood productions have become of late this movie in and of itself is truly manna from heaven br br in what could best be described as cute movie approximately 350 years of movie acting experience allright give or take 100 years joyously lights up the screen to tell tale of deceit remorse and redemption about catholic family in buffalo ny br br truly well positioned to take its place in the feel good movie genre this quiet little independent film by the burton sisters five sisters productions company will leave smile on your face and joy in your heart all while renewing your faith in mankind br br from the spectacular opening scene shots of buffalo ny to the final credits the film manages to tell tale that could have been told of any family anywhere yet somehow this particular gathering of family and family by association in small non descript house in buffalo more than fits the bill if you ve never been to buffalo you ll leave the theater with thoughts of shuffling off for visit shots of the city landmarks and surroundings help to bring quaint down to earth tone to the film which suits it just fine the quiet beauty of the queen city of the great lakes compliments rather than detracts from the tale that is being told if only more movies would take advantage of the natural beauty of this country second cities instead of running off to soundstage somewhere the end results would be so much more believable br br great performances by shirley jones frank gorshin wendy malick jill eickenberry and the rest of the ensemble cast prove again that true talent outlasts hollywood flavor of the week any time br br go see this movie br br you ve wandered in hollywood desert for too long ',

 ' william shakespeare the merchant of venice is about jewish moneylender and his bond to extract pound of flesh from the wealthy merchant antonio the forfeiter of debt the jewish moneylender of course is shylock and he is given such towering performance by al pacino that even outstanding actors like jeremy irons joseph fiennes and lynne collins fade into the background the film is set in 16th century venice and director michael radford relies on setting mood and realism to tell its story rejecting lavish period costumes or modern setting with rock music to appeal to wider audience br br radford slices the play three hour length to manageable two hours and eight minutes and also provides some historical background in the opening narration he tells us how jews came to england were subject to increasing persecution and eventually expelled from england they were forbidden to own property could make profits only by lending money at interest and were forced to live in venetian geto forerunner of darker events to come in the film the merchant antonio jeremy irons spits upon shylock in public yet feels no shame in going to the usurer to borrow 3000 ducats to help his friend and suggested lover bassanio joseph fiennes to properly court portia lynne collins wealthy heiress though shylock has been insulted by antonio he agrees to loan the money without interest for three months on the condition that forfeiture of the bond grants him the right to exact pound of flesh from antonio heart br br the play is primarily drama of hatred and revenge but like many of shakespeare works there are touches of broad comedy as well here the comedy involves three pairs of lovers bassanio and portia gratiano bassanio friend and nerissa and lorenzo another friend of bassanio and jessica shylock daughter portia has offered herself to the person who can pick the right treasure from one of three boxes made of gold silver and lead the prince of morocco chooses the one of gold the prince of aragon the one of silver and both are disappointed bassanio however loves her for herself and opens the leaden casket to find the portrait within radford adaptation conveys remarkable feeling for time and place portia residence at belmont suggests one of those splendid summer homes complete with immaculate gardens and art treasures hanging in every room and contrasts well with the grungy look of shylock city with its dank alleyways br br when it becomes clear that antonio cannot repay the debt bassanio returns to venice leaving portia behind when he arrives the loan is in default and shylock is demanding his pound of flesh even when bassanio backed by portia wealth offers many times the amount in repayment shylock is intent on revenge not only for the loss of the money but for lifetime of outsider status the duke who sits in judgment will not intervene as portia enters in the guise as lawyer to defend antonio it is here that the film reaches its dramatic heights as all parties come to court to achieve final resolution br br the merchant of venice is not only about an unpaid debt but also about the estrangement of jews from christian society and their desire for belonging it has been one of shakespeare most controversial plays and analysts have debated for long time whether it is an anti semitic play or simply play about anti semitism that reflects the prevalent view of christian society in elizabethan england although shylock is definitely caricature he is an ambiguous figure and there are many indications that shakespeare views his flaws as human failings not jewish ones the duke recognizes that he is simply man who has failed to adhere to the compassionate language of the torah br br in the monologue am jew hath not jew eyes â if you prick us do we not bleed if you tickle us do we not laugh if you poison us do we not die and if you wrong us shall we not revenge shylock shows universal humanity expressing the equality of all men though we are horrified at the sentence he wishes to carry out we can feel his pain accumulated over the years pacino performance brings new vigor to the text and his often over the top persona is replaced with gentler more understated demeanor that brings understanding to his cause during toronto international film festival interview last september radford said about pacino â when you work with brilliant actor you have great machine it a bit like driving powerful car you have to dare to do it he has dared and we are all the beneficiaries ',

 ' hayao miyazaki magic continues with this absolute crowd pleaser ponyo on the cliff by the sea his latest animated film which turns on the usual sweetness to charm your socks off thought that the trailer featured its song which was quietly hypnotic and didn have to wait for an invite to make sure got my ticket for the sneak preview of the movie scheduled to open here next week br br for fans ambitions do not bode well with her humanoid dad fujimoto tokoro joji who harbours some hatred toward the human race for pollution and briefly touching subplot on environmental protection revenge by mother nature as well an accident one day sees ponyo being washed ashore and picked up by five year old boy sosuke doi hiroki who lives on house on the said cliff with his mother lisa yamaguchi tomoko while dad koichi nagashima kazushige is mostly out to sea since he a sailor and you can expect some moments of throwback to the likes of the little mermaid or splash made for kids saying anything more would be to spoil the fun br br the artwork here is still simply astounding even though it in 2d glory knowing that each cell is painstakingly worked on there are so many things going on at the same time within the same frame that you ll probably be game for repeated viewings just to spot them all this definitely beats any 3d or cg animated production any day given its beauty coming from its simplicity and not only from the artwork department but on its story too despite complaints coming in that it took leaf from the hans christian andersen classic while there are avenues to make this film extremely dark it only suggested certain dark themes but opted instead for film with more positive emotions suitable for both kids and adults alike br br at its core its about love that between the family members of koichi lisa and sosuke and especially between mother and son more so it about the love between the boy and his new pet fish which he christened ponyo and tell you ponyo herself has enough cuteness in her to beat the likes of bolt walle and eve all hands down characterization here is top notch and it hard not to fall in love with ponyo in whichever form adopted especially when she such playful being who doesn hide her emotions if she upset with you either she turns away or you could expect jet stream come spewing from her mouth into your face br br ponyo on the cliff by the sea is definite shoo in to my top films of this year without hesitation and the next time go to tokyo m sure as hell going to make my way to the ghibli museum to bask under the magical world brought to us by hayao miyazaki highly recommended film so don you go missing this on the big screen ',

 ' man castle is set in one of those jerry built settlements on vacant land and parks that during these times were called hoovervilles named after our unfortunate 31st president who got stuck with the great depression occurring in his administration the proposition of this film is that man home is still his castle even when it just shack in hooverville br br spencer tracy has such shack and truth be told this guy even in good times would not be working all that much but in part very typical for tracy before he was cast as priest in san francisco the start of slew of classic roles he playing tough good natured mug who takes in loretta young br br one of the things about man castle is that it shows the effects of the depression on women as well as men women had some additional strains put on them if men had trouble finding work women had it twice as hard and they were sexually harassed and some resorted to prostitution just for square meal spence takes loretta young in who facing those kind of problems and makes no demands on her in his castle pretty soon though they re in love though tracy is not the kind to settle down br br the love scenes had some extra zing to them because tracy and young were having torrid affair during the shooting of man castle and both were catholic and married and in those days that was an insuperable barrier to marriage both tracy and young took the catholic faith quite seriously br br also in the cast are walter connolly as kind of father figure for the whole camp marjorie rambeau who been through all the pitfalls young might encounter and tries to steer her clear and arthur hohl really loathsome creep who has his eye on young as well hohl brings the plot of man castle to its climax through his scheming br br man castle is grim look at the great depression not the usual movie escapist fare for those trying to avoid that kind of reality in their entertainment ',

 ' the photography is accomplished the acting is quite good but in virtually every other department the greek tycoon is dreary bore taking its inspiration from the real life love affair of jackie kennedy and aristotle onassis the film is glossy but absolutely empty soap opera of the kind that can be found on tv all day long viewers who embrace the whole celebrity magazine culture paparazzi photographs and gossipy stories about the rich and famous will undoubtedly find much to whet their appetite here but those who prefer films with bit more substance and craft and quirkiness will find the 107 minute running time butt numbing slog br br american president james cassidy james franciscus and his beautiful wife liz jacqueline bisset are in greece on official business ridiculously wealthy greek shipping tycoon theo tomasis anthony quinn catches sight of liz at party at his elegant manor despite the fact that both of them are married to someone else there is an immediate attraction between them later at private party aboard his yacht tomasis makes his desires known to liz some while later president cassidy is assassinated whilst out strolling on beach liz is shocked and saddened by his death but it isn long before she seeks comfort in the arms of her greek lover tomasis eventually the two of them are married and their love affair becomes favourite talking point for the world newspapers magazines photographers and wags br br it is somewhat amusing to note the vigour with which the producers of this film denied that it was dramatisation of the kennedy onassis story they wanted the film to be seen as an original story rooted in fiction but anyone with brain can see from where the movie is drawing its inspiration even aristotle onassis himself knew the greek tycoon amounted to his love life getting the hollywood treatment if rumours are to be believed he actually had hand in approving anthony quinn for the tomasis role lee thompson isn really the right sort of director for this type of movie â he better suited to action fodder like the guns of navarone and ice cold in alex â but he marshals the proceedings with an uninspired professional adequacy quinn is very watchable as tomasis bisset looks lovely as the object of his desires franciscus uses his toothy smile and faã ade of integrity to make for believable politician their performances are good on the surface but there little for the actors to do on any deeper level similarly tony richmond photography gives the film an elegant surface sheen as it moves from one exotic locale to the next but the merest of scratches proves that there nothing behind the film glossy exterior ',
 ' one dark night is highly overlooked and little known film from the early 80 that deserves an audience that fear it will never get and that a damn shame have seen this film compared to others that have gotten bigger name over the years most notably phantasm hell night and mausoleum this is much different film than those and don see the comparisons other than the mausoleum which is bit similar to the one in phantasm but not enough to make any real comparisons m not sure how this one slipped through without broader acceptance maybe it all in the marketing don know perhaps remake would breathe new life into it unless raymar drained all the life out of it that is m not too big on all the remakes that are abundant these days but think they do work well with lesser known films except for the awful ghost ship remake which other than the opening scene and mudvayne not falling blaring was utter crap so if remake of one dark night would happen to fall into the right hands think it would make lot of people go and watch the original know that what do if there a remake of film haven seen before so anything short of remake fear would not bring this film back to life unless of course raymar got his eyes on it br br anyways one dark night is must see for horror fans especially 80 horror fans cause we all know that when the best horror movies were made creepy setting fairly good acting very good story campy what more could you want from an early 80 horror film what that nudity and gore well sorry no nudity or gore in this film but it still great nonetheless solid 8 out of 10 enjoy ',

 ' wrong doer is often man that has left something undone not always he that has done something emperor marcus aurelius br br the dvd release of watch on the rhine could not come at better moment it restores to us major lillian hellman play stirringly adapted to the screen by dashiell hammett hellman scholar bernard dick audio commentary affirms his authorship it presents subtle performance by bette davis who took subdued secondary role long after she become the workhorse queen at the warner bros lot equally significantly it reminds us that world war ii had purpose br br sure you say like we needed that we ve heard cary grant sermonizing in destination tokyo 1943 about japanese boys and their bushido knives we ve watched jackboots stomp the living hills in the sound of music 1965 we ve toured an england callously occupied by germany in it happened here 1966 yet truth to tell we still need the message spread br br have an 81 year old friend who curses franklin roosevelt regularly he feels that fdr connived the s into foreign fight we didn need and thereby caused the death of his favorite cousin he encouraged in his demonizing of allied leaders and the trivializing of war two by patrick buchanan br br the political columnist has freshly released fat book heavy with detailed research which claims that adolf hitler would have posed no further menace to poland europe or the world if only the third reich had been handed the free city of danzig in 1939 buchanan holds that if those selfish poles hadn confronted the nazis drawing in foolishly meddling britain and giddily altruistic france no war would have engulfed the west he believes that without the rigors of total war no one in germany would have built gas chambers to provide final solution to the jewish problem br br some commenters on this site feel that watch sags under the weight of stale propaganda maybe however neither my friend nor pat buchanan seem to have gotten the film point some people hurt and kill to grab other people land goods and liberty such people dominated the axis powers and enough didn appear in their vocabulary br br paul lukas deserved the oscar he won he and bette davis put convincing passion into their portrayals of refugees who fight oppressors they give emotional punch to the intellectual case for stepping off the sidelines for actively facing down torturers and murderers bernard dick notes that hellman didn care for lukas as person since he stayed apolitical of course as hungarian he had seen first hand bela kun bloody dictatorship of the proletariat replace an outmoded empire and then topple to admiral horthy right wing tyranny br br in marvelous cameo role added to the play by hammett henry daniell sardonically depicts wehrmacht officer of the class that disdains the brown shirts he serves his phili von ramme would doubtless stand with field marshal rommel in 1944 during the plot of july 20th against hitler in april 1940 however he pragmatically abets the nazi cause although he insults herr blecher the butcher and scorns the rumanian aristocrat teck de brancovis for trying to peddle information on an underground leader br br teck pauper and possible cuckold wishes cash and visa to return to europe where he can resume the shreds of life that had come undone with the empire shattering great war and the greater world wide economic depression he has no political convictions no scruples about trading freedom fighter for his own tomorrow mercury theater graduate george coulouris lends this burnt out case old world cynicism an edge of desperate menace br br lucille watson gives winsome vitality to the grasping man hostess domineering old gal who knows her mind and gets her way but who doesn adequately appreciate her children and their achievements outside the home she controls she and her pallid office bound son belong to the american version of von ramme and de brancovis privileged kind however this family hasn seen ruin and never will they re moneyed people who could silently advance evil simply by not opposing it br br this mother and son might easily make choices which would reflect that complaisance toward national socialism and fascism which flourishes today in my friend and in pundit buchanan watch on the rhine has manicured period look its dialogue reflects its erudite origins on the stage rather than sounding fresh from the streets yet hellman and hammett film has gut based power audiences still need to hear and heed its call to arms against grabbers relentlessly on the march ',
 ' peter lorre turns in one of his finest performances as hungarian watchmaker coming to the united staes to make new life for himself and someday bring his girl across the big pond to be with him lorre infectious optimism and bright outlook come off very effectively which makes the performance all the better when he has his face hideously burned in hotel fire and when no one will give him chance to work turns reluctantly to life of crime lorre range as an actor is seldom as apparent as in this movie with his jovial good natured immigrant to his depressing melancholic disfigured self searching for the truth behind what he believed america afforded him to his suave intelligent better than your average hood to his sympathetic dealings with blind woman with whom he falls in love the story is well paced has some interesting twists and gives lorre many opportunities to shine director robert florey does quality job behind the lens and all of the supporting cast help aid the film with evelyn keyes giving particularly good turn as the blind girl loved the ending and the truth that was shone to exist in lorre character despite all the negative things society had done toward him for little picture the man behind the mask is good movie making for its time ',

performance along with dominique brad may be one very messed up kid in real life but at least he can act so the only reason this movie gets any skulls is because got what basically wanted which was dominique swain and brad renfro also had the added pleasure of seeing underrated actress bijou phillips make me like her even more so even though was annoyed throughout still came out with some positives although this was pretty hard this time br br recommend you to only see this if you ve seen lolita and know how good dominique is or if you are some offbeat fan of brad or bijou uber melanie fans will be sorely depressed also if you re fan of crappy movies like me please do not assume this be guilty pleasure because you will feel guilty alright for the money spent on buying or renting br  ' cassavetes was clearly an intelligent sensitive man with bold new ideas about making films he wanted to be an auteur to break away from the confines of the system and bring new realism to the american cinema for that applaud him br br unfortunately as member of his audience cannot applaud woman under the influence cassavetes took what could have been fascinating topic an insane woman and somehow managed to craft dull film filled with lengthy ad libbed ranting and drawn out scenes he seems to have had gift for capturing the dullest moments of person life on film and it often appears as though he simply turned the camera on his family and let the motor run and run this tactic would be acceptable if cassavetes had captured something devastatingly real or even kernel of something so real it touched the heart in ways conventional film could not yet found the performances particularly rowlands to be artificial never believed for moment that she was really insane have met people who are truly mentally disturbed yet ve never seen any of them act quite like gena rowlands in woman under the influence she played it like very obnoxious uninhibited woman who drinks lot and even that was confusing because we only see her drink once at the beginning but she acts drunk for the remainder of the film there are some moments in which she taps into something real but those moments are few and far between she fails to sustain seamless mentally disturbed character again applaud her efforts but effort alone is not enough to make the performance ring true br br novice audiences who happen upon this film and see its high imdb rating will no doubt feel compelled to love it and rate it highly just to prove that they get it but don be brainwashed by the hype judge for yourself you don have to pretend to like it br br like woody allen john cassavetes could be accused of solipsism in his film making seeming to find his own psyche and his own life experiences so endlessly fascinating that he couldn imagine that to others they appeared presumptive and tortuously self indulgent but woody allen at least has demonstrated gift for keeping an audience entertained he knows that compelling story structure and good dose of humor are essential to any movie if cassavetes had employed some self discipline and sharp pair of editing shears woman under the influence could have stood chance but what the point of making realistic film if the only people who can stand to sit through it are the art house devotees and film students who worship cassavetes as some sort of anti establishment deity without dumbing anything down believe cassavetes could have made woman slightly more accessible by keeping the pace moving with an actual plot instead of presenting string of 30 minute long scenes of ad libbed arguments if you just make films for yourself and few of your fans you re just reaching the already converted watch this movie with your own set of eyes and make your own decisions about it if you are truly moved and fascinated by it good for you ',
 ' one of the better movies to come out of the 1980 this based on fact movie tells the story of disturbed high school student who murders his girlfriend leaves her naked body on river bank and brags about it later to his friends what is just as bad is their inability to feel anything about it br br disturbing but incredibly compelling look at aimless and apathetic kids who have no respect for their parents or any sort of authority who seem almost doomed to live lives of rebellion and recklessness this drama hits hard and is impossible to forget the young cast does creditable job even keanu reeves in one of his earliest roles is better than usual of course there no reason for the character of layne crispin glover to be as crazed and off the wall as he is but that just glover being himself veteran dennis hopper has an especially good role as loner who despite his own sordid past is saddened by the attitudes of this group of kids would like to point out the chilling performance by daniel roebuck as the young murderer he an under rated actor and aside from hopper his is probably the best performance in the film br br saw river edge for the first time long time ago when it first started being shown on cable tv movie channels however didn catch all of it saw it in its entirety for the first time number of years later and now ve seen it again for what is probably the definitive time br br some potently affecting moments include madeleine constance forslund breakdown where she wails that maybe she should leave her children just like their worthless father did also liked the scenes where matt reeves faces off with his disturbed younger brother joshua miller and when the teacher mr burkewaite jim metzler deplores the fact that the girl has died and that none of his students seem to care br br will never forget this film not as long as live it too saddening for that br br 10 10 ',

 ' discovering something the journey is so much more fun so much more surreal and so much more emotionally galvanizing than when you finally arrive at the destination falling in love is perhaps one of the most opulent feelings in the world you feel energized invigorated and alive you simply want to be around that person every second of the day and the very sound of their voice gets you excited and journey together where love and the discovery of the emotions along the way will help save them br br lane is dealing with the typical jerk of an ex husband who still loves her but in her eyes only because the woman he cheated with no longer wants him as hurt as she was by him as much as she really dislikes him there is part of her that is actually considering taking him back why you might ask because in life and love sometimes comfort supersedes intelligence yes this man cheated on her but she has kids with him she built life with him and there is obviously still connection with him br br adrienne is taking care of soon they find comfort in each other arms and discover that they too can have second chance in life br br by now this sounds like simple idea for film and although it might be something you ve seen or read about before gere and lane simply own the film diane lane lights the screen up with her smile her eyes twinkle in the dark and the life she brings to the character is one worth watching gere character is little different he is more hardened and bitter it takes adrienne pain and her passion to bring him out of his shell he blames quietly himself for his strained relationship with his son and her secretly blames himself for the death of the patient on the outside he tells anyone who will listen that it is not his fault and that she was 1 in 50 000 casualty but deep down it eats away at him they find each other at time when both need someone to listen br br gere and lane have been in film together before but this is the first time they play lovers they were married in unfaithful but here they play lovers finding each other when the people in their lives have abandoned them they have spark and real chemistry would love to see more films with them together  ' am always wary of taking too instant dislike to film look at it month later and you might see it differently or dig it up after 50 years in different continent and some cult followers find something stylistically remarkable that went unnoticed at first after sitting through the great ecstasy of robert carmichael at its uk premiere it came as no surprise to me that found the question and answer session afterwards more interesting than the film itself shane danielsen artistic director of the edinburgh international film festival aided by the film director and producer gave spirited defence of movie than received an overall negative response from the audience edinburgh festival audiences are not easily shocked only one person walked out in disgust the criticisms of the film included very articulate and constructive ones from the lay public as well as an actor and woman who teaches a film directors this was not an overly shocking film there was degree of uninterrupted sexual violence but far less extreme than many movies most actual weapon contact was obscured as were aroused genitals the audience disliked it because they had sat through two hours that were quite boring where the acting standards were not high where the plot was poor predictable and drawn out and where they had been subjected to clumsy and pretentious film making on the promise of controversial movie metaphors to the war in iraq are contrived over emphasised and sloppy apart from general allusion to violence any deeper meaning is unclear and the fig leaf reference marquis de sade as one audience member put it seems mere tokenistic excuse for lack of plot development towards the finale br br we have the story of an adolescent who has certain amount going for him he stands out at school for his musical ability but takes drugs and hangs out with youths who have little or nothing going for them and whose criminal activities extend to rape and violence when pushed robert seems to have lot of violence locked inside him br br the film is not entirely without merit the audience is left to decide how robert got that way was it the influence of his peers why did all the good influences and concern from parents and teachers not manage to include him in better approach to life cinematically there is carefully montaged scene where he hangs back whether through too much drugs shyness latent sense of morality or just waiting his turn several of his friends are raping woman in back room partly glimpsed and framed in the centre of the screen in the foreground of the bare bones flat dj is more concerned that the girl screams interrupt his happy house music than with any thought for the woman ultimately he is bit annoyed if their activities attract police attention the stark juxtaposition of serious headphones enjoyment of his music even when he knows rape is going on points up his utter disdain in deeply unsettling way robert slumps with his back to us in the foreground br br but the rest of the film including its supposedly controversial climax involving considerable if not overly realistic sexual violence is not up to this standard some people have had strong reaction to it the filmmakers stated intention if they vomit we have succeeded in producing reaction but mostly and as far as can tell the edinburgh reaction seems to mirror reports from cannes they feel why have programmers subjected us to such inferior quality film making director clay hugh can talk the talk but has not developed artistic vision his replies about holding up mirror to life to tell the truth about things that are swept under the carpet even his defence that there is little plot development because he didn want to do standard hollywood movie all are good answers to criticisms but unfortunately they do not apply to his film any more than they do to holding up mirror while someone defecates or wastes film while playing ineptly with symbols wanting to try and give him the benefit of any lingering doubt spoke to him for few minutes after the screening but found him as distasteful as his movie and soon moved to the bar to wash my mouth out with something more substantial there are many truths one aspect of art is to educate another to entertain another to inspire had asked him if he had any social or political agenda and he mentions ken loach one of the many great names he takes in vain without going so far as to admit any agenda himself he then falls back on his mantra about his job being to tell the truth am left with the feeling that this was an overambitious project for new director or else disingenuous attempt to put himself on the map by courting publicity for second rate work br br andy warhol could paint tin of soup and it was art clay hugh would like to emulate the great directors that have made controversial cinema and pushed boundaries sadly his ability at the moment only extends to making high sounding excuses for publicity seeking film ',

 ' the twins effect chinese action comedy charlene choi gillian chung br br this vampire action comedy is one of my favorites for the very fact that was thoroughly entertained throughout the entire movie first of all the characters are memorable contributing myriad of classic scenes charlene and gillian are naturally cute charismatic and humorous this movie was my first exposure to them and all wanted to do was reach through my television screen and give them really big hug the remaining cast did well in their supporting roles including jackie chan karen mok the duke josie ho edison chen anthony wong and the vampire bad guys one of which looks eerily familiar to will ferrell even the abominably horrible ekin cheng was good in this one good characters are important of course because they avoid the feeling of boredom by keeping things interesting between action sequences br br and speaking of action this film has plenty of it more importantly there is an emphasis of quality in the fight choreography one aspect that helped in this regard is the featured weapon of the protagonists â sword with retractable spear ended rope this weapon in and of itself opened up variety of moves that would have been otherwise impossible josie ho and gillian chung in particular perform some wicked aerial maneuvers using these devices br br in addition the swordplay is superb and is highlighted by two great sword fights â one taking place during the opening train station sequence and the other occurring in the church finale in fact the blade wielding maneuvers showcased in this film put some other highly overrated fan favorites to great shame and truly feel sorry for those who would cite the horribly choreographed garbage seen in ashes of time storm riders or man called hero with the well planned precisely executed sequences seen in the twins effect it not even close br br can understand why this film gets so much criticism m sure die hard apologists for the hong kong golden age will hate this because it doesn fit into their narrow minded view of what hong kong action should be we should learn from the downfall of john woo one trick pony who never learned how to re invent himself we don need another clone we need something different the twins effect is one good example br br this film was so good that it actually set me up for being disappointed at other chinese movies with the same actors and actresses this especially applies to ekin cheng whose other films almost always suck â and yes this includes the obscenely overrated and exploitative wuxia crap mentioned in the previous paragraph even the twins have never been able to match the value of this movie when both were lead actresses in film although they have managed to hit some good films when either one or the other takes the leading role g beyond our ken good times bed times house of fury or when one or both are in supporting roles g colour of the truth new police story just one look the twins effect 2 should have been direct sequel instead of family fantasy am still yearning to see charlene and gillian team up and kick some butt in another movie but the fact remains that the twins effect hits on all cylinders optimizing their charisma while avoiding descent into annoyance as in protã gã de la rose noire br br all in all this film has everything one needs to be entertained and may remind the reader that it is precisely this â entertainment â that judges the greatness of movie more so than artsy dramatic elements or meaningless awards from established academies of critics who usually have no idea what they are talking about br br in the end the twins effect is classic not to be missed br br rating 5 5 stars br br s â the hollywood execs decided to slaughter this film when it was released in the s by renaming it the vampire effect and cutting out 20 minutes of footage which includes parts of the action scenes however the final fight of the s version does have better soundtrack than the original version therefore purchased both versions which allows me to first watch the original until about the 1 20 mark and then swap discs to watch the final fight on the s version ',
 ' piece is cake is defeatist revisionist history of the worst kind whose only point is to unfairly savage the reputation of the admittedly fictional pilots it portrays it left remarkably bad taste in my mouth br br in the march 1989 aeroplane monthly roland beamont wrote stinging condemnation of the way that raf fighter command was portrayed in the tv mini series few of his comments are worth repeating br br there was no sense of defeatism at any time in any of the squadrons that saw in action and total absence of the loutishness portrayed in piece of cake it would not have been tolerated for moment the prevailing atmosphere was more akin to that in good rugby club though with more discipline nor was there any sense of death or glory raf training had insisted that we were there to defend this country and now we were required to do it no more and no less br br there was no discussion of bravery or cowardice people either had guts or they did not but mostly they did but we knew fear recognised it in ourselves and in each other did our damnedness to control it and then got on with the job br br could feel no glory but there was sense of greatness and none of this bore the slightest resemblance to piece of cake br br beamont was in his own words fighter pilot who unlike the author and producer of the recent tv series was there at the time br br beamont served with 87 squadron both in france and the bob before going on to become one of the premier exponents of both the typhoon and tempest and post war test pilot br br piece of cake is an absolute total misrepresentation of the way pilots in fighter command acted at the time it is nothing less than complete and utter disgrace ',

 ' the penultimate episode of star trek third season is excellent and highlight of the much maligned final season essentially spock mccoy and kirk beam down to sarpeidon to find the planet population completely missing except for the presence of giant library and mr atoz the librarian all 3 trek characters soon accidentally walk into time travel machine into different periods of sarpeidon past spock gives convincing performance as an ice age vulcan who falls in love for zarabeth while kirk reprises his unhappy experience with time travel see the city on the edge of forever when he is accused of witchcraft and jailed before escaping and finding the doorway back in time to sarpeidon present in the end all 3 trek characters are saved mere minutes before the beta niobe star around sarpeidon goes supernova the enterprise warps away just as the star explodes br br ironically as william shatner notes in his book star trek memories this show was the source of some dispute since leonard nimoy noticed that no reason was given in lisette script for the reason why spock was behaving in such an emotional way nimoy relayed his misgivings here directly to the show executive producer fred freiberger that vulcans weren supposed to fall in love 272 however freiberger reasoned the ice age setting allowed spock to experience emotions since this was time when vulcans still had not evolved into their completely logical present state this was great example of improvisation on freiberger part to save script which was far above average for this particular episode while shatner notes that the decline in script quality for the third season hurt spock artistically since his character was forced to bray like donkey in plato stepchildren play music with hippies in the way to eden or sometimes display emotion the script here was more believable spock acting here was excellent as freiberger candidly admitted to shatner 272 the only obvious plot hole is the fact that since both spock and mccoy travelled thousands of years back in time mccoy too should have reverted to more primitive human state not just spock but this is forgivable error considering the poor quality of many other season 3 shows the brilliant spock mccoy performance and the originality of this script who could have imagined that the present inhabitants of sarpeidon would escape their doomed planet fate by travelling into their past this is certainly what we came to expect from the best of classic trek genuinely inspired story br br shatner in memories named some of his best unusual and high quality shows of season 3 as the enterprise incident day of the dove is there in truth no beauty the tholian web and the children shall lead and the paradise syndrome 273 while my personal opinion is that and the children shall lead is very poor episode while is there in truth no beauty is problematic all our yesterdays certainly belongs on the list of top season three star trek tos films give 9 out of 10 for all our yesterdays ',

can lay claim to that hackneyed adjective luminous but because her performance has an honesty and un bookish intelligence that utterly compelling br br the result is film women can enjoy without feeling like they re making pact with the devil to do so as in chadha bride and prejudice the relationships amongst women sizzle with chemistry that can be neatly slotted into the stodgy sweet valley high categories of best friends or sisters perhaps chadha is even right in her commentary to disavow the film flirtation with lesbianism bend it like beckham has an electricity that can be reduced to the simple hetero homosexual love triangle its conventionally structured script would suggest the precise nature of its pleasure is ultimately bit of mystery â and is all the more seductive for it br  ' this was great when saw the japanese version first it was probably the scariest movie had ever seen it was not blood and guts it was eerie atmospheric and terrifying when the mother ghost lent over the bed in the japanese version nearly had heart attack was concerned that the american version would be watered down and that buffy would take away from the dark creepy nuances of the original version needn have been concerned the makers of this movie wisely kept the same japanese people who were involved with the original movie on hand and gave the direction of the movie to the same man they also set it in japan in the same location in the same house in fact the japanese director took pains to remake the same movie as it was in the original the only difference was the casting of american actors that actually turned into benefit as it added the element of strangers in strange land to the overall horror not only were they being haunted by an absolutely terrifying and relentless ghost but they were also stuck in completely foreign land having difficulty integrating into society it just added to the overall anxiety built into the movie and thought it was an excellent touch br br buffy actually does very good job she looks vulnerable and is able to convey her fear well there are none of the smart aleck remarks that are so common to american horror movies or one liners that detract from the overall darkness and horror of the characters situation in fact it was easily as good as the ring which also thoroughly enjoyed hope the future of american horror follows more closely the japanese new wave of horror started with the incredible success of ringu we are finally getting movies that actually can be categorized as horror 8 10 ',

 ' in life we first organize stones piedras in spanish such as career family friendship and love in this way we shall find space between these to fit smaller stones our small necessities if you act in an inverse way you will not have enough room for larger stones the five protagonists in this film are women who have not been able to organize the large stones in their lives ramon salazar spanish motion picture director defines his first feature stones in this way the film tells the parallel conflicting trajectory of five women anita monica cervera 1975 isabel angela molina 1955 adela antonia san juan 1961 leire najwa nimri 1972 and maricarmen vicky pena 1954 all are endeavoring to remove the stones that insistently appear in their path or worst that are in their shoes they are five cinderellas in search of prince charming and new chance in life the best story of these five cinderellas is that of anita monica cervera who also stars in 20 centimeters busco crimen ferpecto entre vivir sonar hongos and octavia sarge booker of tujunga california ',

 ' soylent green is one of the best and most disturbing science fiction movies of the 70 and still very persuasive even by today standards although flawed and little dated the apocalyptic touch and the environmental premise typical for that time still feel very unsettling and thought provoking this film quality level surpasses the majority of contemporary sf flicks because of its strong cast and some intense sequences that personally consider classic the new york of 2022 is depressing place to be alive with over population unemployment an unhealthy climate and the total scarcity of every vital food product the only form of food available is synthetic and distributed by the soylent company charlton heston in great shape plays cop investigating the murder of one of soylent most eminent executives and he stumbles upon scandals and dark secrets the script is little over sentimental at times and the climax doesn really come as big surprise still the atmosphere is very tense and uncanny the riot sequence is truly grueling and easily one of the most macabre moments in 70 cinema edward robinson is ultimately impressive in his last role and there a great but too modest supportive role for joseph cotton baron blood the abominable dr phibes this is science fiction in my book nightmarish and inevitable fade for humanity no fancy space ships with hairy monsters attacking our planet ',

stunning architecture are also mixed in coherent whole to explore the life of the late iconic louis khan br br the documentary begins contemplative classical music plays archives are scanned with reflective shadowy face superimposed blurring letters symbolically referencing train window passing backdrop landscape â journey â focus and out of focus the search eventually culminates to an article in newspaper nathanial khan reads from the front page of the new york times where his father is simultaneously praised as the best american architect alive and his death announced br br when first read that obituary have to admit was looking for my own name was his child too his only son didn know my father very well he never married my mother and he never lived with us â he died when was eleven br br so years later this illegitimate son is still haunted by unclear fragmented thoughts and feelings about his father who seems to be great professional and public figure but who secretive personal life escapes him and affects him to the point where he intends to do something about it br br for years struggled to be satisfied with the little pieces of my father life ve been allowed to see but it wasn enough needed to know him needed to find out who he really was so set out on journey to see his buildings and to find whatever there was left of him out there it would take me to the other side of the world looking for the man who left me with so many questions br br so the documentary is two fold by slow systematic discovery of the world renown architect we get to know 1 his ideas buildings and the architectural perspective and 2 his families coworkers people life he affected and the human perspective br br the dvd also offers added insight with q with the writer director and additional footage that includes such great louis khan quotes as everything that everybody says is the truth it their truth it might not be factual and good idea that doesn happen is no idea at all br br this movie is journey of discovery self discovery and discovery of man great man yet human imperfect like all of us we get to know him through the eyes of an admiring and slightly bitter son but with the openness and objectivity to really explore without making easy conclusions and without judging br br by key interviews with people who interacted with him in various capacity we slowly put some pieces together until that final interview with this man from bangladesh who really seems to bring it back home with visceral and sensible comments br br brilliant architect brilliant documentary ',

 ' originally filmed in 1999 as tv pilot mulholland dr was rejected the next year david lynch received money to film new scenes to make the movie suitable to be shown in theaters he did so and created one of the greatest most bizarre and nightmarish films ever made br br the film really doesn have main characters but if there were main characters they would be betty naomi watts and rita laura elena harring betty is perky blonde who staying in her aunt apartment while she auditions for parts in movies she finds rita in her aunt apartment and decides to help her you see rita lost her memory she has no clue who she is she takes her name rita from gilda poster in the bathroom so the two set out to discover who rita really is br br david lynch has been known for making some weird movies but this film is the definition of weird it bizarre nightmarish and absolute indescribable it like dream captured on film by the 100 minute point the film has become extremely confusing but if you ve been watching closely it will make perfect sense having watched the movie and then read an article on the internet pointing out things in the film now understand the movie completely br br the acting is very good watts is terrific justin theroux is very good as hollywood director facing problems with the local mob the music is excellent angelo badalamenti delivers one of his finest scores and the directing hah david lynch is as masterful filmmaker as ever there was br br is this your type of film well that depends you should probably view more of lynch work before watching this movie you ll need to be patient with the film and probably watch it second time to pick up the many clues lynch has left throughout the movie for lynch fans this is dream come true br br mulholland dr is masterpiece it brilliant enigmatic and masterfully filmed love it ',

 ' some films manage to survive almost on originality alone wonderland is certainly one of those films the script manages to throw everything into near fever pitch but without making it incoherent the speed of this thriller is not to chosen to cover up weak script but rather to accurately reflect the drug addled reality br br as director james cox as very peculiar way of working his actors most of the characters are perpetually on edge and often because they re rather quite ugly personalities val kilmer has described john holmes to be hustler able to manipulate and control no offense to kilmer but his version of holmes seems only able to control the drastically weak minded nonetheless it a stunning performance comparing this to kilmer more hollywood roles like in the saint it seems to prove he is far more at home in gritty indie flicks br br the actors are the main force holding all together there are various little performances that stand out especially the women carrie fisher kate bosworth and lisa kudrow all have limited screen time next to their male counterparts but they are all fantastic aside from kilmer ted levine and dylan mcdermott give weird stunning energy to their roles br br originally put off watching wonderland because assumed it was film about porn actor in the strictest sense yes the story revolves around john holmes but it has literally nothing to do with his professional career basically this film is murder mystery and as such it excellent br br rating 7 5 out of 10 ',
