 ' much praise has been lavished upon farscape but don think it that good it certainly has distinctive look but it lacks just about everything else story purpose direction excitement you name it m big sci fi fan and make it point to watch all the sci fi shows can ve almost finished the four seasons of farscape and at this point m not very satisfied the show does have few good things most notably claudia black who sadly missing from the first few episodes of season four but they are very few and very far between as whole the show is marred by lot of very silly stuff such as fantasy elements rather than sf ditto and many many episodes esp in season four are unspeakably messy and very poorly structured and one just feels that it isn going anywhere it mostly just non directional adventures with thin long running plot lines which develop painstakingly slowly well sometimes it a little bit tighter but it only lasts for very few episodes at time br br effects wise there are few impressive things here and there esp out in space occasionally but the show seems stuck in the same style of effects which frankly gets old fast outlandish and unconvincing puppet aliens mar the show great deal and ve come to prefer by far the episodes where regular human looking characters are the focus br br think the peacekeepers are by far the most stylish and intriguing and interesting figures on the show they succeed in being convincingly alien culture despite their all human appearance there are few really cool episodes with them esp in the first season iirc where crichton masquerades as peacekeeper captain and invades and eventually destroys one of their secret bases such episodes can reach rating of 8 out of 10 but cannot award the show as whole more than 4 rating br br aside from the peacekeepers which themselves are somewhat too single mindedly totalitarian and militaristic to be really nuanced the show simply doesn offer anything important or significant that you need to know or want to see otoh it does contain few good ideas and is not total loss br br this is just my opinion of course but as seasoned sci fi fan think it counts for something and may be of help to others there aren a lot of good sci fi shows out there but star trek any series and especially the new battlestar galactica are definitely better than farscape but if you re huge fan of mediocre sci fi shows you may well like farscape too br br my rating 4 out of 10 ',

 ' caught evening in the cinema with lady friend evening is chick flick with no apologies for being such but can say with some relief that it not so infused with estrogen that it painful for red blooded male to watch except for single instance at the very end of the movie watched with interest and did not have to turn away or roll my eyes at any self indulgent melodrama ladies for their part will absolutely love this movie br br ann lord is elderly bed ridden and spending her last few days on earth as comfortably as possible in her own home with her two grown daughters at her side discomfited by the memories of her past ann suddenly calls out man name her daughters have never heard before harris while both of her daughters silently contemplate the significance of their mother strong urge to recall and redress her ill fated affair with this mysterious man at this of all times ann lapses back in her head to the fateful day she met harris and in doing so lost the youthful optimism for the future that we all inevitably part ways with br br both ann and her two daughters one married with children one serial commitophobe struggle with the central question of whether true love really exists and perhaps more importantly if true love can endure the test of time are we all one day fated to realize that love never lasts forever will we all realize that settling for the imperfect is the only realistic outcome the subtle fact that the aged ann is still wrestling with an answer to these questions on her deathbed is not lost on her two daughters br br the cinematography for evening is interesting most of the film is spent in ann mind as she recalls the past and for that reason think the film was shot as if it was all deliberately overexposed to give everyone an ethereal glow and thus make it very obvious that all of this is not real but occurred in the past claire danes is beautiful appearing to be really really tall though just 5 5 in reality and is absolutely captivating in one climactic scene where her singing talents are finally put to the test br br you can really talk trash about the cast which leads off with claire danes and doesn let up from there vanessa redgrave patrick wilson meryl streep and glenn close fill out the other major and minor roles in the film br br can really say anything negative about this film at all though hugh dancy struggle to have his character emerge from utter one dimensionality is in the end total loss playing the spoiled lovable drunk offspring of the obscenely rich who puts up front of great bravado but is secretly scared stiff of never amounting to anything probably doesn offer much in the way of character exploration he had his orders and stuck to them br br in the end gentlemen your lady friend will most certainly weep and while you ll likely not feel nearly as affected the evening will definitely not be waste for the time spent watching evening catch it in theatres or grab it as rental to trade off for points for when you want to be accompanied to viewing of die hard 4 or the upcoming rambo flick it ll be your little secret that this viewing didn really cost you much at all  ' water lilies is well made first film from france about young female sexuality and friendship sciamma works with specialized slightly sanitized material that is as off putting to some as it is alluring to others the film focuses exclusively on three middle class teenage girls in tidy new paris suburb their lives revolve around big indoor swimming pool where two of the three are part of synchronized water ballet team br br such distractions as parents siblings work and school have been neatly excised from the equation the central sensibility belongs to the attractively sullen but skinny marie pauline acquart who is not on the team but thinks she would like to be marie worships floriane adã le haenel an alluring blonde and team standout whom the boys are after this takes marie away from her former best friend also member of the water ballet team the somewhat plump anne louise blachã re being less special anne is more truly accessible to the boys floriane like this film promises bit more then she truly offers marie has the more essential quality for teenage girl she suffers inwardly flroiane doesn so much suffer as jump into situations and then bolt br br marie is dazzled by the glamor of the water ballet as well as floriane floriane takes advantage of this to make marie first her slave and cover for her assignations then lacking any other friends her confidante all the other girls think floriane slut an illusion she encourages in the men and boys she teases because it leads them on she suffers the pretty girl fate of being not person but an object and she can resist the validation the boys give her by wanting to kiss her and bed her but she doesn really care about any of them and knows her involvements with them are trap enlisting marie to act as her pal so her unseen mother won know she going out to meet boys she also gets marie to rescue her from the boys later it looked the opposite at first but floriane needs marie as much as marie thinks she needs her anne is left with her discomfort with her body and desire to get laid that earthier and more real than the other girls br br keeping all external context at bay sciamma can highlight subtle shifts in the delicate equation of the three girls goals and interactions on the other hand the film water madness which includes lots of showering and spitting as well as underwater swimming shots makes it feel completely airless at times and some of its 95 minutes do not pass so quickly luckily the film has sense of humor and lets the trio sometimes forget their ever present goals and avoidances and just do silly pointless girl things it the offbeat moments that give the film life too bad in way that there aren more of them but sciamma has the courage of her obsessions and what remains as one walks out of the theater is the personalities and their dynamics along the way of course it is pleasant to watch the swimming and to gaze at the girls who understandably love to gaze at themselves br br there no great revelation or drama on the way but things get bit more interesting when it emerges that marie doesn just admire but truly desires floriane and is jealous of her boyfriends whom floriane always stops before they go all the way in typical irony of this kind of plot floriane actually decides she wants to have her first real sex with marie but marie is the one who holds off because she knows it won have the significance to floriane that it will have to her when it happens it a timid mechanical affair meanwhile anne has huge crush on francois warren jacquin male swimmer but of course he is after floriane boys are not an element that been subtracted and there always seem to be several dozen ready at poolside or on the dance floor but they are just bodies and faces available studs ',

caron father br br in short think it all would have been improved by casting some young comedic relief type dancer as jerry the kind that usually turned up in musical supporting roles g ray macdonald in good news or bobby van in small town girl maybe not them necessarily but someone like them someone who could have chased lise and made it seem harmlessly playful someone who would have appeared genuinely happy living in that chaplinesque hole in the wall someone whose humor and naivete would have contrasted better with oscar levant sarcastic grumpiness it probably also would have made the ballet seem less ponderous and it might have provided voice that could sing gershwin better br br all this may give the impression that don like gene kelly do like him he was terrific in most of his with somebody but not jerry mulligan wouldn wish that on her ',

 ' scarface has major cult following even now 22 years after its release br br it has also been widely criticized as being very tacky unrefined over the top and all bloated up these are people who compare scarface to the godfather movies it is true that on the technical front cinematography screenplay direction etc scarface is way behind the godfather br br but it is also true that what scarface has and some other gangster movies lack is the rawness the sheer crude approach of the gangsters the latino gangsters in this movie look much more menacing and real than any of the polished italian or irish gangsters from other gangster classics like the godfather or goodfellas this is one of the major winning points of scarface and strongly believe that this fact has been written off as tackiness by most critics have seen the original 1932 scarface and must say that both these movies are way too different from each other and should be seen as two different movies instead of praising the original over the remake br br al pacino has been criticized to be over the top and loud in this movie but how about considering that that is precisely the way the film makers wanted tony montana character to be he is this angry young man who takes hasty decisions and throws fits of tantrum every other minute he is not the calm michael corleone here he is tony montana very tacky uneducated individual who doesn really think much and gets angry all the time br br there is definitely very 80s feel to this movie the soundtrack is all 80s love some of the songs including gina and elvira theme push it to the limit and the title track instrumental br br there are some memorable and beautifully shot sequences including the famous chainsaw scene the rebenga hit the first meeting with sosa and tony visit to his mother br br about the performances al pacino is brilliant as the angry cuban refugee he has reportedly mentioned that he enjoyed playing tony montana the most in his entire career and it really does seem like he has enjoyed himself thoroughly in all his scenes one wonders what scarface would be like without pacino just couldn imagine anyone else portraying tony montana and in all probabilities the film wouldn be as effective without him br br steven bauer shines as tony friend manny br br robert loggia is wonderful as tony boss lopez so is murray abraham as omar in small role br br then there is some eye candy in the form of elvira played by michelle pfeiffer she looks beautiful and is adequate in her role br br the director does go bit overboard during particular part in the climax without revealing anything would only say that that was the only little part that suffers due to improper handling br br scarface is definitely one of the most entertaining and one of the best gangster movies to ever come out enjoy it for what it is raw portrayal of the drug lords and their gangland ',

 ' if good intentions were enough to produce good film would have rated the turgid ponderous obvious focus bit higher than 4 macy does his best but as an earlier poster commented miller little parable asks us to suspend disbelief too often perhaps the novel gives us bit more background on newman so we can understand how someone who is obviously not without intelligence could be so dense in perceiving the attitudes of those around him agree with another reviewer that if one is unaware of how bigoted average citizens were in america during this time period then this movie might be an eye opener grew up in the fifties and the good pastors of my lutheran church found nothing wrong with having the church picnic at commercial beach whose sign prominently indicated that no jews or blacks would be admitted it is difficult for young people today to understand that this was the norm and not just in the south as late as 1964 when graduated from somewhat racially integrated but sexually segregated public high school in baltimore my black classmates could not attend the traditional father and son banquet as it was held at facility which did not admit blacks sadly it was an establishment owned by jewish family the subject matter of focus is important and we should never forget despite the lingering signs of racism in modern america how truly repulsive the attitudes of that previous generation were the greatest generation indeed so perhaps this film is somewhat valuable in countering the recent wave of sentimental crap about the forties from the likes of steven spielberg and tom brokow but in the end as in far from heaven the filmmakers good intentions are undermined by having protagonist so ridiculously oblivious to the social conventions of their time ',
 ' hadn heard anything about this project until saw that it was going to be on so watched it with completely open mind and gee the cast is full of strong players br br unfortunately it awful don mean it isn good mean it extraordinarily bad sometimes laughably so but mostly it just boring its strongest appeal comes from having attractive people as naked as us network tv will allow but it all tease and no substance and having nymphs as backup characters can justify several hours of bad tv br br there are two basic problems that the cast can overcome first the script is awful yes making changes to the hercules myth which is certainly not single monolithic story in the first place is traditional but this version is relentlessly dull and much too frequently dumb and sometimes downright head shakingly peculiar with terrible pacing bits borrowed from here and there and several parts seemingly belonging in different films and truly awful dialogue the dialogue is frequently unbearably bad in fact to the point where you feel embarrassed for the actors sean astin apparently now typecast as second banana seems especially burdened by one awful line after another there no consistency of tone or atmosphere and little cohesion to the plot br br second most of the special effects are really bad really bad there occasionally decent bit of cgi but mostly again you feel really embarrassed on behalf of the cast have no idea what the budget for this project was but it sure looks like crap compared to clash of the titans or even hercules the legendary journeys and doesn even compare very favorably with the old lou ferrigno and italian spaghetti hercules movies just painfully miserable br br there are plenty of other problems the story is needlessly complex and can keep up with itself and hercules himself isn presented as very interesting character almost everyone who doesn have european accent tries to fake one of some kind which is not merely amateurish and dated but never really made sense in the first place drama doesn become better just because the actors use british accents after all but the terrible script and equally terrible effects sink the whole thing right off the worse don think you could make hercules good by adding to it but that doesn mean that the continuity say hasn suffered from the network edits there no way ll watch the usa version to see though ',

put vikki guerrero in the sharpshooter or not luckily he came to his senses and let her go this led to chavo attempting the roll up only for it to be countered into the sharpshooter for the submission dangerous spots some of which took place outside the ring this was match much more deserving of the crowd response than what it got jbl put it best when he berated the fans in richmond virginia for sitting on their hands during this one and at one point even started boring chant helms picked up the duke after jawbreaker type manoeuvre with his knees to smackdowns resident redneck br br the number 3 world heavyweight champion batista and wwe champion john cena teamed up to take on finlay and the champion of champions king booker there was no way the match could top the tag team championship match from earlier on but it entertained none the less the match would have been more memorable had it been given an extra five to ten minutes but how many times have said that about wwe matches this year already it was king booker who was pinned at the end of the match after big batistabomb br br so 2006 is over for the wwe in regards to it pay per view schedule it started the year on terrible note with new year revolution but ended on high one with armageddon this ladder match will long be remembered as one of the greatest ladder matches of all time my hat is off to all eight competitors who but their bodies on the line to give the fans one hell of match ',
 ' like others have seen and studied most of the books and films concerning the clutter killings including few dramatic works thematically based on the actions and psycho mythology of the participants to the crime including capote himself as to capote cannot forgive him for willfully withholding perry smith confessions intimacies and writings from even the defense counsels believe truths and facts capote reserved for his book which required for capote two guilty verdicts and capital punishment would almost certainly have sustained successful insanity defense for perry smith even under the old mcnaughton rule capote himself could never write another major literary work after in cold blood shame and guilt in my opinion he willingly encouraged and planned the brutal capital punishment to provide the spectacular ending he required for his book drama to him both men had to die for his book to succeed the book had to justify itself by pretending it was about the horror of capital punishment his actions and silence assured that ice cold conclusion br br capote book is not truth it is not factual or journalistic it is drama and melodrama spiced with his own creatively psychotic imagination what most people consider the virtues of the contemporaneous first movie are stark images of capote mind which may have been the most cold blooded aspect of all no wonder viewers ironically but necessarily prefer blake performance that actor is the nightmare from capote dishonest imaginings br br so who is to say how the two killers should be played who is to judge what could make an essentially poetic psychotic snap from excessive courtesy and kindness to do it now killing agree with the few who see in eric roberts work magnificent performance shakespearean in its range yet played with heartbreaking sincerity anthony edwards takes much safer attitude mode to create smarmy hickok but he is one dimensional and boring with only few notes in his television range roberts is almost four dimensional adding physical weakness and agony to powerful animal body frankenstein creature who thinks in poetry and knows exactly what not to do like leopold apropos loeb robert perry smith is hopelessly in love with an evil man without hickok or man of his particularities perry smith would not have brought his psychotic mind into world of horrors he fears himself more than he fears anything else in life br br given the freedom from capote death grip on the consciousness of the clutter killings roberts and edwards are free to create original personalities and psychoses to craft different and new production of the drama same facts some of the same lines from the case record but deeper more complex with clearly titanic psychotic stresses indeed roberts is so good at this fluidic madness that he physically and facially demonstrates in every moment how little awareness he has of where or who he is br br what many of our reviewers dislike about this film roberts in particular is that cold blooded killing isn shown the way they expect and have been manipulated to demand that is because here we are seeing far more profoundly realistic interpretation of life and death than capote could ever create real tragedy br br the actual cold blooded killer mr capote and his hypocritically artistic non fiction novel do not control these interpretations and performances br br if in cold blood and capote effect on life literature and truth matters as much as scholars say then it takes guts as well as talent to portray the truth or version of the truth that is not the rank cowardly lie drawn up from the fathoms of capote own abyss ',

 ' in cold blood has to be ranked as first rate movie making even if the subject matter is about as grim as it gets in the world of make believe but film noir fans should definitely find this one gripping piece of work based as it is on true life crime spree br br it opens with quincy jones music under the credits and starkly dramatic views of highway bus heading toward kansas city effectively setting the mood of the film even before the credits end the w photography of conrad hall does superb job right from the start br br also clear from the start robert blake and scott wilson are natural born actors they do great job of portraying free spirited buddies looking for the next thrill ever see millionaire fry in the electric hair hell no there are two kinds of rules in this world one for the rich and one for the poor says wilson taking swig of alcohol behind the wheel br br both are destined to cross the path of farm family showing no mercy and leaving no witnesses behind br br blake reminiscing about movies and thinking of hunting for gold in mexico says remember bogart in treasure of the sierra madre an ironic moment because blake himself was in the film as little boy selling lottery tickets got you pegged for natural born killer wilson tells blake br br john forsythe is one of the lead detectives on the case discovering that all four family members were tied up shot in the head and one had his throat cut don people around here lock doors asks paul stewart they will tonight is the terse reply br br after the murders the killers discover that there was no big fat safe in the wall like their prison informant told them so in the end it was truly stupid senseless crime the question is why did they do it and this is something the second half of the film explores in depth it takes an hour and half into the movie before the detectives catch up with the killers and begin the interrogation br br it these final scenes that carry the most conviction and the most interest as the boys are told they ve made numerous mistakes and left living witness the actual events up to and including the murder are saved until the end it makes no sense blake tells forsythe mr the latter cesar romero plays an american impresario who for some reason is staging musical in edinburgh there a vague attempt to link this show to the edinburgh festival which is nonsense the festival is not showcase for splashy leg shows we also see couple of stock shots of the royal mile apart from few highland accents there absolutely no attempt to convey scottish atmosphere in this movie the funniest gag occurs at the very beginning when we learn that the title of romero show is frolics to you this is cheeky pun that britons will get and yanks won br br vera ellen is as usual cute and appealing and an impressive dancer but the very few musical numbers in this movie are boring and bad the plot mistaken identity between magnate david niven and reporter gordon jackson is brainless though no more so than the plots of several dozen hollywood musicals romero is less annoying than usual here probably because for once he isn required to convince us that he interested in bedding the heroine br br the single biggest offence of this movie is its misuse of bobby howes the father of sally ann howes was major star of west end stage musicals his wistful rendition of she my lovely was big hit in britain in 1937 here he shows up in several scenes as romero dogsbody but never has chance to participate in musical number nor even any real comedy it absolutely criminal that this movie with title containing the word lovely sure to evoke howes greatest hit would cast major british musical star but give him nothing to do br br the delightful character actress ambrosine phillpotts whom worked with once shines in one restaurant sequence and there a glimpse of the doomed beauty kay kendall as vera ellen confidante somebody named diane hart speaks in one of the most annoying voices ve ever heard it sounds like an attempt to imitate joan greenwood and glynis johns both at the same go but doesn match either val guest has story credit but this movie doesn come up to the quality of his brilliant comedies the colour photography is wretched though realise that postwar britain could not afford hollywood process work happy go lovely is at utmost best pleasant time waster with waster being the operative word ll rate this movie just 4 out of 10 ',
 ' once watched the tenant and interpreted it as horror movie it uses many of the tropes of the genre the sinister apartment suspicious neighbors apparitions mysteries hallucinations the life of the hero trelkovsky seemed surrounded by evil secret forces trying to drive him mad br br last time watched it challenged this initial interpretation if this movie is horror movie it only horror in the sense that kafka novel is horror in fact this movie can be understood on literal level as lonely man slowly becoming crazy without any external influence br br polanski made in his career three movies dealing with madness repulsion which don particularly like because the development of madness in the heroine never convinced me rosemary baby in which the heroine is driven mad by evil forces and the tenant which might be the best study of paranoia ever made in cinema br br trelkovsky is young man who rents an apartment in which woman killed herself he becomes obsessed with her and slowly starts becoming her he wears her clothes puts on makeup talks like her but is he being possessed by spirit or is he just letting his wild imagination get the best of him it this hesitation between what is real and imaginary and which polanski never resolves that makes this such fascinating movie many events in the movie can be attributed to the supernatural as easily as they can be to normal causes and it up to the viewer to decide what to believe in br br although this is not my favorite polanski movie it is nevertheless good example of his ability to create suspense and portray madness in very convincing terms and technically speaking it a marvel too suffice to say he collaborates with film composer philippe sarde and legendary director of photography sven nykvist bergman dp in the making of this movie slow pacing and sometimes uninteresting segments may make this movie difficult to enjoy but it an experience nevertheless ',

In [13]:
train=processed_features
test=processed_features
In [14]:
from sklearn.feature_extraction.text import CountVectorizer
from nltk.corpus import stopwords

cv = CountVectorizer(stop_words=stopwords.words('english'))
cv.fit(train)
X = cv.transform(train)
X_test = cv.transform(test)
In [15]:
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split

target = [1 if i < 20000 else 0 for i in range(20890)]

X_train, X_val, y_train, y_val = train_test_split(X, target, train_size = 0.75)

for c in [0.01, 0.05, 0.25, 0.5, 1]:
    
    lr = LogisticRegression(C=c)
    lr.fit(X_train, y_train)
    print ("Accuracy for C=%s: %s" % (c, accuracy_score(y_val, lr.predict(X_val))))

E:\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\sklearn\linear_model\logistic.py:432: FutureWarning: Default solver will be changed to 'lbfgs' in 0.22. Specify a solver to silence this warning.
  FutureWarning)

Accuracy for C=0.01: 0.95807007466973
Accuracy for C=0.05: 0.9571127704384453
Accuracy for C=0.25: 0.9532835535133065
Accuracy for C=0.5: 0.9490714148956538
Accuracy for C=1: 0.9477311889718553
In [74]:
final_model = LogisticRegression(C=0.01)
final_model.fit(X, target)
print ("Final Accuracy: %s" 
       % accuracy_score(target, final_model.predict(X_test)))

Final Accuracy: 0.9576352321685017
In [75]:
y_pred = final_model.predict(X_test)
y_pred
Out[75]:
array([1, 1, 1, ..., 1, 1, 1])
In [76]:
feature_to_coef = {
    word: coef for word, coef in zip(
        cv.get_feature_names(), final_model.coef_[0]
    )
}
for best_positive in sorted(
    feature_to_coef.items(), 
    key=lambda x: x[1], 
    reverse=True)[:5]:
    print (best_positive)

('good', 0.19121092076640644)
('great', 0.1774647890976894)
('best', 0.16078517219150526)
('love', 0.15939211352957972)
('worst', 0.1588687142745714)

    key=lambda x: x[1])[:5]:
    print (best_negative)
